english: An Asian person wearing glasses, carrying a camera, and walking in a group is not always a Japanese person.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: そのことは私には分かりかねますから、部長にお聞きになって下さい。
reading: そのことは私には分かりかねますから、部長にお聞きになって下さい。
english: I am not in a position to figure out that matter, so please ask the departmental chief.

explanation: 「かねない」 means "quite capable of ...; might happen."
japanese: あの男はどんな馬鹿なことでもやりかねない。
reading: あの男はどんな馬鹿なことでもやりかねない。
english: He might do any stupid thing.
extra_notes: Uses a different meaning of かねる。「かねない」actually means "quite capable of ...; might happen."

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: 来週はロンドンへ出張しますので、誠に申し訳ございませんが、名古屋での会議には出席できかねます。
reading: 来週はロンドンへ出張しますので、誠に申し訳ございませんが、名古屋での会議には出席できかねます。
english: Next week I am making a business trip to London, so I cannot attend the meeting in Nagoya.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: これだけの書類を一月では処理いたしかねますが。
reading: これだけの書類を一月では 処理[しょり]いたしかねますが。
english: I cannot process this many documents in a month.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: 大変遺憾に存じますが、ご依頼には応じかねます。
reading: 大変 遺憾[いかん]に存じますが、ご 依頼[いらい]には 応[おう]じかねます。
english: It is a great regret, but we cannot comply with your request.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: こんな高価な贈り物、頂きかねます。
reading: こんな 高価[こうか]な贈り物、頂きかねます。
english: I cannot accept such an expensive gift.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: 彼は私の気持ちを量りかねているようだ。
reading: 彼は私の気持ちを 量[はか]りかねているようだ。
english: He appears to find it hard to understand my feelings.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: 非常に言いにくいことなので、さすがの部長も切り出しかねている。
reading: 非常に言いにくいことなので、さすがの部長も切り出しかねている。
english: It is such a delicate matter, so even the departmental chief finds it hard to break the ice.

translation: Cannot; be not in a position to; hardly possible; hard; hesitate to do
explanation: An auxiliary expressing that someone cannot do something even if s/he wants to do it.
japanese: みどりさん、ご主人がお待ちかねよ。
reading: みどりさん、ご主人がお待ちかねよ。
english: Midori, your husband is waiting for you with impatience (literally: cannot wait).

explanation: 「かねない」 means "quite capable of ...; might happen."
japanese: あいつはとんでもないことを言いかねないから、注意した方がいいよ。
reading: あいつはとんでもないことを言いかねないから、注意した方がいいよ。
english: He might say outrageous things, so watch out.

explanation: 「かねない」 means "quite capable of ...; might happen."
japanese: あの男はちょっとしたことで暴力を振るいかねない。
reading: あの男はちょっとしたことで暴力を振るいかねない。
english: That man might use violence at the slightest provocation.

explanation: 「かねない」 means "quite capable of ...; might happen."
japanese: この事件は内閣総辞職にも発展しかねない。
reading: この事件は 内閣総辞職[ないかくそうじしょく]にも 発展[はってん]しかねない。
english: It is possible for this incident to develop into resignation of the entire cabinet.

explanation: 「かねない」 means "quite capable of ...; might happen."
japanese: 暴動すら起こりかねないような緊迫した情況だった。
reading: 暴動[ぼうどう]すら起こりかねないような 緊迫[きんぱく]した情況だった。
english: It was such a tense situation that even a riot could have taken place.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: スミスさんは週刊誌から学術書に至るまで、幅広い日本語が読める。
reading: スミスさんは週刊誌から学術書に至るまで、幅広い日本語が読める。
english: Mr. Smith can read Japanese widely, ranging from weekly magazines to scholastic books.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: その新聞記者は首相の公の生活から私生活に至るまで、何でも知っている。
reading: その新聞記者は  首相[しゅしょう]の公の生活から私生活に至るまで、何でも知っている。
english: That newspaper reporter knows everything about the prime minister, ranging from his public life to his private life.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: 私が日本へ行った時、友人の山田さんは空港への出迎えからホテルの予約に至るまで、実に親切にしてくれた。
reading: 私が日本へ行った時、友人の山田さんは空港への出迎えからホテルの予約に至るまで、実に親切にしてくれた。
english: When I went to Japan, my friend Mr. Yamada was very kind to me. He did everything from picking me up at the airport to making the hotel reservation for me.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: その女の人は私に家族のことから自分の悩みに至るまで、細かに話した。
reading: その女の人は私に家族のことから自分の悩みに至るまで、細かに話した。
english: That lady told me everything in detail, starting with her family and ending with the worries of her life.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: 社長が現れた時には、守衛から副社長に至るまで、門の前で待っていた。
reading: 社長が現れた時には、守衛から副社長に至るまで、門の前で待っていた。
english: When the president of the company arrived, everyone from the guards to the vice-president was waiting in front of the gate.

translation: Starting with ~ ending with ~; from ~ to ~
explanation: A structure that expresses a wide range of things.
japanese: ルーシーは靴から帽子に至るまで、緑の装束だった。
reading: ルーシーは靴から帽子に至るまで、緑の装束だった。
english: Lucy was dressed in green, from her shoes to her hat.

translation: Through ~ into ~; through ~ on to; from ~ till/to
explanation: A structure that expresses coverage from one time/location into the other.
japanese: 今年の夏、七月から八月にかけて中国大陸を旅行した。
reading: 今年の夏、七月から八月にかけて中国大陸を旅行した。
english: This summer I travelled on the Chinese continent from July through August.

translation: Through ~ into ~; through ~ on to; from ~ till/to
explanation: A structure that expresses coverage from one time/location into the other.
japanese: 今週は木曜から金曜にかけて雪が降るでしょう。
reading: 今週は木曜から金曜にかけて雪が降るでしょう。
english: This week it will probably snow from Thursday through Friday

translation: Through ~ into ~; through ~ on to; from ~ till/to
explanation: A structure that expresses coverage from one time/location into the other.
japanese: 日本は六月から七月にかけて梅雨が続く。
reading: 日本は六月から七月にかけて梅雨が続く。
english: In Japan the rainy season continues through June and July.

translation: Through ~ into ~; through ~ on to; from ~ till/to
explanation: A structure that expresses coverage from one time/location into the other.
japanese: 高気圧が朝鮮半島から九州にかけて張り出している。
reading: 高気圧が朝鮮半島から九州にかけて張り出している。
english: High atmospheric pressure extends from the Korean Peninsula up through Kyushu.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 子供だからと言って許すわけにはいかない。
reading: 子供だからと言って許すわけにはいかない。
english: I cannot forgive him just because he is a child.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 何も不平を言わないからと言って現状に満足しているわけではない。
reading: 何も不平を言わないからと言って現状に満足しているわけではない。
english: Even though I don't complain, it doesn't mean that I'm satisfied with the present situation.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 試験に受からなかったからと言ってそんなに悲観することはない。
reading: 試験に受からなかったからと言ってそんなに悲観することはない。
english: You don't have to be so pessimistic just because you didn't pass the exam.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 弁償したからと言って済む問題ではない。
reading: 弁償[べんしょう]したからと言って済む問題ではない。
english: It is not a problem which will be solved because you have paid / will pay compensation.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 上司の命令だからと言って黙って従うわけにはいかない。
reading: 上司の命令だからと言って黙って従うわけにはいかない。
english: I cannot obey the order without asking questions even if it is from my boss.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: アメリカへ行ったからと言って勝手に英語が上手になるものではない。
reading: アメリカへ行ったからと言って勝手に英語が上手になるものではない。
english: Your English is not something that will improve (by itself / automatically) just by going to America.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 毎日授業に出ているからと言って真面目に勉強していることにはならない。
reading: 毎日授業に出ているからと言って真面目に勉強していることにはならない。
english: Even though he goes to class every day, it doesn't mean that he is studying seriously.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: こんなことを言うからと言って別に批判しているわけではない。
reading: こんなことを言うからと言って別に批判しているわけではない。
english: Even though I tell you such a thing, it doesn't mean that I'm criticizing you.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 自分の問題じゃないからと言って知らん顔をしているのはよくない。
reading: 自分の問題じゃないからと言って知らん顔をしているのはよくない。
english: It's not right for you to be indifferent just because it's not your problem.

translation: Just because; even if; even though
explanation: A conjunction which introduces the reason for someone's action or for someone's having some idea, and conveys disapproval of the action or idea.
japanese: 女だからと言って侮ってはいけない。
reading: 女だからと言って侮ってはいけない。
english: Don't take her lightly just because she is a woman.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 十年後の自分を予想するのは難しかろう。
reading: 十年後の自分を予想するのは難しかろう。
english: It is probably difficult to predict what one's self will be like in ten years time.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: この研究を一年で完成するのは極めて難しかろう。
reading: この研究を一年で完成するのは極めて難しかろう。
english: It is probably extremely difficult to complete this research in one year.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 日本人の中にも創造性のない教育に反対する人は多かろう。
reading: 日本人の中にも創造性のない教育に反対する人は多かろう。
english: Even among the Japanese, there are probably a lot of people who oppose education without creativity.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 私のように文化は宗教のようなものだと考えている人は少なかろう。
reading: 私のように文化は宗教のようなものだと考えている人は少なかろう。
english: Few people probably think, as I do, that culture is something like religion.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: アメリカの大学のように、日本の大学でも学生に教師の評価をさせるとよかろう。
reading: アメリカの大学のように、日本の大学でも学生に教師の評価をさせるとよかろう。
english: It would probably be good if Japanese universities allowed students to evaluate instructors as American universities do.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 人種偏見ほど人間に根深いものはなかろう。
reading: 人種偏見ほど人間に根深いものはなかろう。
english: Nothing is probably as deep-rooted in humans as racial prejudices.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 近い将来に日米関係に大きな変化はなかろう。
reading: 近い将来に日米関係に大きな変化はなかろう。
english: There will probably not be a big change in the US-Japan relationship in the near future.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: あの二人の間柄は親しくはなかろう。
reading: あの二人の間柄は親しくはなかろう。
english: The relationship between the two is probably not close.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 残業手当てを要求することは無理ではなかろう。
reading: 残業[ざんぎょう]手当てを要求することは無理ではなかろう。
english: It is probably not unreasonable to ask for pay for overtime work.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary indicating the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 彼にはアリバイがあるのだから、犯人ではなかろう。
reading: 彼にはアリバイがあるのだから、犯人ではなかろう。
english: He has an alibi, so he is probably not the culprit.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 林田先生は厳しい教え方をする。
reading: 林田[はやしだ]先生は厳しい教え方をする。
english: Professor Hayashida teaches in a strict manner.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 昭は変わったものの見方をする。
reading: 昭[あきら]は変わったものの見方をする。
english: Akira views things in a peculiar fashion.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: ブラウンさんは日本人のような考え方をする。
reading: ブラウンさんは日本人のような考え方をする。
english: Mr. Brown thinks like the Japanese.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 誰にでも分かるような書き方をして下さい。
reading: 誰にでも分かるような書き方をして下さい。
english: Please write in such a way that anyone can understand it.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: あのピッチャーは面白い投げ方をする。
reading: あのピッチャーは面白い投げ方をする。
english: That pitcher throws (a ball) in an interesting way.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 吉田君は乱暴な運転のし方をするので乗せてもらうのが怖い。
reading: 吉田[よしだ]君は 乱暴[らんぼう]な運転のし方をするので乗せてもらうのが怖い。
english: I'm afraid of getting a ride from Yoshida because he drives carelessly (literally: in a wild fashion).

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 正はほかの学生と違った勉強のし方をしているようだ。
reading: 正[ただし]はほかの学生と違った勉強のし方をしているようだ。
english: Tadashi seems to study in a different way from other students.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 私には野村先生のような考え方は出来ない
reading: 私には野村先生のような考え方は出来ない
english: I cannot think like Professor Nomura.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: この問題について私と同じような考え方をする人は多くないでしょう。
reading: この問題について私と同じような考え方をする人は多くないでしょう。
english: There wouldn't be many people who think about this problem in the same way as I do.

translation: Do something in a ~ fashion/manner/way
explanation: A phrase to indicate a manner of doing something.
japanese: 田村はその大臣をよく知っているような話し方をする。
reading: 田村はその 大臣[だいじん]をよく知っているような話し方をする。
english:
1. Tamura's talk sounds like he knows the minister well. (or)
2. Tamura talks as if he knew that minister well.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: 日本人はみんな寿司が好きかと言うと、そうではない。嫌いな人もいる。
reading: 日本人はみんな寿司が好きかと言うと、そうではない。嫌いな人もいる。
english: You would think that all the Japanese like sushi, but that is not true. Some Japanese don't like it.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: 日本に行って、二、三年住めば日本語が上手になるかと言うと、そうでもないようだ。かえって下手になることもある。
reading: 日本に行って、二、三年住めば日本語が上手になるかと言うと、そうでもないようだ。かえって下手になることもある。
english: You'd think that if you went to Japan and lived there for a few years, your Japanese would become good, but that doesn't seem to be true. On the contrary, your Japanese may become worse than before.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: 大学の時にいい成績の学生が社会で成功するかと言うと、必ずしもそうではないようだ。
reading: 大学の時にいい成績の学生が社会で成功するかと言うと、必ずしもそうではないようだ。
english: You'd think that a college student with good grades would be successful in society, but that doesn't always seem to be the case.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: 毎日運動をすれば長生きをするかと言うと、そうでもなさそうだ。
reading: 毎日運動をすれば長生きをするかと言うと、そうでもなさそうだ。
english: You'd think that if you did exercise every day, you would live long, but that does not seem to be true.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: 日本語は難しいかと言うと、話したり聞いたりすることはそんなに難しくない。
reading: 日本語は難しいかと言うと、話したり聞いたりすることはそんなに難しくない。
english: You'd think that Japanese would be hard, but speaking and listening are not that hard.

translation: You would think that ~ but (that is not right)
explanation: A conjunction to indicate the speaker's assertion that a popular belief is not right.
japanese: ボストンでの車なしの生活が不便だったかと言うと、全然そうではなかったんです。
reading: ボストンでの車なしの生活が不便だったかと言うと、全然そうではなかったんです。
english: You'd think that my life without a car in Boston must have been inconvenient, but it wasn't at all.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 昼間遊ぶ代わりに夜勉強するつもりだ。
reading: 昼間遊ぶ代わりに夜勉強するつもりだ。
english: I am going to enjoy myself in the daytime, so /but (to make up for it) I will study at night.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 山田さんにはちょっと余分に働いてもらった代わりに特別手当てを出した。
reading: 山田さんにはちょっと 余分[よぶん]に働いてもらった代わりに特別 手当[てあ]てを出した。
english: Mr. Yamada worked for us a bit extra, so (to make up-for it) we paid him special compensation.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 前のアパートは設備が悪かった代わりに家賃が安かった。
reading: 前のアパートは 設備[せつび]が悪かった代わりに家賃が安かった。
english: The former apartment had bad facilities, so /but (to make up for it) the rent was cheap.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 今朝は、コーヒーの代わりにココアを飲んだ。
reading: 今朝は、コーヒーの代わりにココアを飲んだ。
english: This morning I drank cocoa instead of coffee.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 今日は図書館で勉強する代わりに寮の部屋で勉強した。
reading: 今日は図書館で勉強する代わりに寮の部屋で勉強した。
english: Today I didn't study in the library. Instead, I studied in my dorm room.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 私はトムに日本語を教えてあげた代わりに彼に英語を教えてもらった。
reading: 私はトムに日本語を教えてあげた代わりに彼に英語を教えてもらった。
english: I taught Tom Japanese, so (to make up for it) he taught me English.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 高い長距離電話をかける代わりに、手紙をよく書いています。
reading: 高い 長距離電話[ちょうきょりでんわ]をかける代わりに、手紙をよく書いています。
english: Instead of making expensive long distance calls I often write letters.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 私のアパートは家賃が高い代わりに、駅に近くてとても便利です。
reading: 私のアパートは家賃が高い代わりに、駅に近くてとても便利です。
english: My apartment is expensive, but it is close to the station and very convenient.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 私達の日本語の先生は厳しい代わりに学生の面倒見がいい。
reading: 私達の日本語の先生は厳しい代わりに学生の 面倒見[めんどうみ]がいい。
english: Our teacher is strict, so (to make up for it) he takes good care of his students.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 大学の先生は給料が低い代わりに自由がある。
reading: 大学の先生は給料が低い代わりに自由がある。
english: College professors' salaries are low, but (instead) they have freedom.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 父は体が弱い代わりに意志がとても強い。
reading: 父は体が弱い代わりに意志がとても強い。
english: My father is physically weak, but (to make up for it) he has a very strong will.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: この辺は静かな代わりに、店も遠くて不便です。
reading: この辺は静かな代わりに、店も遠くて不便です。
english: This area is quiet, but (instead) it's inconvenient because the stores are far away.

translation: Instead of; instead; but (to make up for ~); so (to make up for ~); in place of
explanation: An action/state that is expressed in the subordinate clause is balanced by another action/state expressed in the main clause, or something/someone that is replaced by something/someone else.
japanese: 日本語の授業にいつもの山田先生の代わりに田中という新しい先生がいらっしゃった。
reading: 日本語の授業にいつもの山田先生の代わりに田中という新しい先生がいらっしゃった。
english: To our Japanese class came a new teacher, Ms. Tanaka, instead of our regular teacher, Ms. Yamada.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 投票の結果、その提案は反対多数で否決された。
reading: 投票[とうひょう]の結果、その 提案[ていあん]は反対 多数[たすう]で 否決[ひけつ]された。
english: As a result of the vote, the proposal was rejected by the majority's opposition.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 妻と相談した結果、家を買うことにした。
reading: 妻と相談した結果、家を買うことにした。
english: After my wife and I discussed it, we decided to buy a house.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 相談の結果、今回の旅行は延期することになった。
reading: 相談の結果、今回の旅行は 延期[えんき]することになった。
english: After discussion, it's been decided that the planned trip will be postponed.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 調査の結果、新しい事実が発見された。
reading: 調査の結果、新しい事実が 発見[はっけん]された。
english: As a result of the investigation, new facts emerged.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 警察で調べた結果、原因は煙草の火の不始末と分かった。
reading: 警察で調べた結果、原因は煙草の火の 不始末[ふしまつ]と分かった。
english: As a result of the police investigation, it was determined that the cause (of the fire) was the careless handling of a cigarette butt.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 特別のダイエットをした結果、十キロの減量に成功した。
reading: 特別のダイエットをした結果、十キロの 減量[げんりょう]に成功した。
english: I've succeeded in losing ten kilos as the result of a special diet.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: 新しい教科書を使った結果、学生の成績が著しく伸びた。
reading: 新しい教科書を使った結果、学生の成績が 著[いちじる]しく伸びた。
english: As a result of using a new textbook, the students improved their performance remarkably.

translation: As a result of; after; upon
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea "as a result of".
japanese: ゴルフの個人指導を受けた結果、自分の問題点が明らかになった。
reading: ゴルフの個人指導を受けた結果、自分の問題点が明らかになった。
english: Upon taking a private golf lesson, my problems became clear.

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: ここの寿司は、結構美味しいね。
reading: ここの寿司は、結構美味しいね。
english: The sushi in this place is quite good, isn't it?

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: この車は古いんだけど、結構よく走りますよ。
reading: この車は古いんだけど、結構よく走りますよ。
english: This car is old, but it runs quite well, you know.

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: あの人は間抜けに見えるでしょう。でも、結構頭がいいんです。
reading: あの人は間抜けに見えるでしょう。でも、結構頭がいいんです。
english: He looks dumb, but he is quite sharp.

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: 四月だというのに、結構寒いね。
reading: 四月だというのに、結構寒いね。
english: It is April, but it is rather cold, isn't it?

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: 小さい町なのに、結構いいレストランがあるね。
reading: 小さい町なのに、結構いいレストランがあるね。
english: There are quite a few good restaurants in this small town, aren't there?

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: この料理は量は少ないけど、結構胃にもたれるね。
reading: この料理は量は少ないけど、結構胃にもたれるね。
english: This dish is small in quantity, but it is pretty heavy on the stomach.

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: 今日は日曜日なのに高速が結構混んでいるね。
reading: 今日は日曜日なのに高速が結構混んでいるね。
english: Today is Sunday, but the highway is rather crowded, isn't it?

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: 父は楽天的な人でしたが、失職した時に結構悩んだようです。
reading: 父は楽天的な人でしたが、失職した時に結構悩んだようです。
english: My father was an optimist, but when he lost his job, I think he suffered quite a bit.

translation: Quite; rather; pretty
explanation: An adverb that indicates that something exceeds the speaker's and/or hearer's expectation to a considerable degree.
japanese: カラオケは初めてだったが、結構楽しかった。
reading: カラオケは初めてだったが、結構楽しかった。
english: It was my first karaoke, but it was rather enjoyable.

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: 秋山さんはこの春結婚します。
reading: 秋山さんはこの春結婚します。
english: Miss Akiyama will marry (this spring / this coming spring).

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: 山下君はこの一週間授業を休んでいます。
reading: 山下君はこの一週間授業を休んでいます。
english: Yamashita has been absent from class for the past week.

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この間吉岡さんに会いました。
reading: この間 吉岡[よしおか]さんに会いました。
english: I met Mr. Yoshioka the other day.

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: このたびこの会の会員に加えていただきました。
reading: このたびこの会の会員に 加[くわ]えていただきました。
english: I became a member of this club at this time.

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この際車を買おうか。
reading: この 際[さい]車を買おうか。
english: Shall we buy a car given this occasion?

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この辺で妥協したらどうですか。
reading: この辺で 妥協[だきょう]したらどうですか。
english: Why don't we compromise now (literally: around this time)?

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この夏は日本の女流作家の研究しています。
reading: この夏は日本の 女流作家[じょりゅうさっか]の研究しています。
english: This summer I'm doing research on Japanese female writers.

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この一週間は忙しくて何もできないだろう。
reading: この一週間は忙しくて何もできないだろう。
english: I'll be busy this coming week and probably won't be able to do anything (else).

translation: The last; this past; this; this coming
explanation: A demonstrative adjective which indicates a time or time period around the moment of speech.
japanese: この次はいつお目にかかれますか。
reading: この次はいつお目にかかれますか。
english: When could I meet you next?

translation: Such; like this
explanation: A demonstrative which refers to someone or something mentioned as an example in previous discourse.
japanese: こうした問題はこの国では聞かれないようである。
reading: こうした問題はこの国では聞かれないようである。
english: We do not seem to hear about problems like this in this country.

translation: Such; like this
explanation: A demonstrative which refers to someone or something mentioned as an example in previous discourse.
japanese: こうした行為がどのような結果を招くかは誰の目にも明らかだ。
reading: こうした行為がどのような結果を 招[まね]くかは誰の目にも明らかだ。
english: It is clear to anyone what kind of result such behaviour brings about.

translation: Such; like this
explanation: A demonstrative which refers to someone or something mentioned as an example in previous discourse.
japanese: こうした経験は日本へ行ったことのある者なら誰にでもあるはずだ。
reading: こうした経験は日本へ行ったことのある者なら誰にでもあるはずだ。
english: Anyone who has been to Japan would have had such an experience.

translation: Such; like this
explanation: A demonstrative which refers to someone or something mentioned as an example in previous discourse.
japanese: 私はこうした話には耳を貸さないことにしている。
reading: 私はこうした話には耳を 貸[か]さないことにしている。
english: I make it a rule not to listen to such stories.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: これこそ我々が探し求めていたものだ。
reading: これこそ我々が探し 求[もと]めていたものだ。
english: This is the very thing that we've been looking for.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: 一人でやってこそ勉強になるのだ。
reading: 一人でやってこそ勉強になるのだ。
english: It is only when you do it by yourself that you can learn something.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: Ａ：どうもすみませんでした。 Ｂ：いいえ、こちらこそすみませんでした。
reading:
Ａ：どうもすみませんでした。 
Ｂ：いいえ、こちらこそすみませんでした。
english:
A: I'm very sorry. 
B: No, it's me who should say that (literally: be sorry).

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: 君が正直に話してくれたからこそ問題は最小で済んだんだ。
reading: 君が正直に話してくれたからこそ問題は 最小[さいしょう]で 済[す]んだんだ。
english: It is only because you explained (literally: told) it to us honestly that we could minimize the problem.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: A: 一体一週間も何をしていたんだ。 B: そう言う君こそ何をしていたんだ
reading:
A: 一体[いったい]一週間も何をしていたんだ。 
B: そう言う君こそ何をしていたんだ。
english:
A: What on earth were you doing for a whole week? 
B: You say that but what were you doing?

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: こんな時(に)こそ全員で力を合わせて問題を解決しなければならない。
reading: こんな時(に)こそ全員で力を合わせて問題を解決しなければならない。
english: On this kind of occasion in particular, we all have to cooperate in order to solve the problem.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: 今年こそこの試験に通ってみせる。
reading: 今年こそこの試験に通ってみせる。
english: I will pass this exam definitely this year.
extra_notes: Helpful variant translation to help this sentence: "for sure"(emphasizing preceding word)​

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: それでこそ我々のリーダーだ。
reading: それでこそ我々のリーダーだ。
english: That is precisely the kind of behaviour/what we expect from our leader.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: ここにいてこそいい仕事も見つかるのだ。
reading: ここにいてこそいい仕事も見つかるのだ。
english: Only by being here can you find a good job.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: 親友だからこそこんなことまで君に言うんだよ。
reading: 親友だからこそこんなことまで君に言うんだよ。
english: It's because you are my friend that I can tell you (even) such a thing.

translation: The very ~; it is ~; that ~; only (when, after, because, etc.); in particular; precisely; definitely; [an italicized or underlined word]
explanation: A particle which emphasizes a word, phrase, or clause.
japanese: 出来ないからこそ人より余計に練習しなければならないのだ。
reading: 出来ないからこそ人より 余計[よけい]に練習しなければならないのだ。
english: It’s precisely because you can’t do it that you have to practice more than others do.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 発表は十五分以内で行うこと。
reading: 発表は十五分以内で行うこと。
english: Each presentation should be completed (literally: done) within fifteen minutes.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: プールサイドを走らないこと。
reading: プールサイドを走らないこと。
english: Do not run on the pool deck.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 詳細は二十三ページ（を）参照のこと。
reading: 詳細[しょうさい]は二十三ページ（を） 参照[さんしょう]のこと。
english: See page 23 for details.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 私語は慎むこと。
reading: 私語[しご]は 慎[つつし]むこと。
english: Refrain from whispering.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 先に必ずテープを聞くこと。
reading: 先に必ずテープを聞くこと。
english: Be sure to listen to the tape beforehand.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 辞書は見ないこと。
reading: 辞書は見ないこと。
english: You may not consult any dictionaries.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 裸足で歩き回らないこと。
reading: 裸足[はだし]で歩き回らないこと。
english: Do not walk around barefoot.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 弁当（を）持参のこと。
reading: 弁当（を） 持参[じさん]のこと。
english: Bring your own lunch.

translation: (don't) V; should (not); (not) ought to; may not
explanation: An auxiliary noun to express a command.
japanese: 制服（を）着用のこと。
reading: 制服[せいふく]（を） 着用[ちゃくよう]のこと。
english: Wear uniforms.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 私は週末にゴルフをすることで気分転換を図っています。
reading: 私は週末にゴルフをすることで 気分転換[きぶんてんかん]を 図[はか]っています。
english: I try to lift my spirits by playing golf on weekends.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 彼が仲裁の場に出ていったことで事態は余計にこじれた。
reading: 彼が仲裁の場に出ていったことで事態は余計にこじれた。
english: The situation got even more complicated because he appeared at the mediation scene.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 私が十万円出すことで問題は解決した。
reading: 私が十万円出すことで問題は解決した。
english: The problem was solved by my paying 100,000 yen.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 彼女はものを言わないことで私へ精一杯の抵抗を示しているのです。
reading: 彼女はものを言わないことで私へ 精一杯[せいいっぱい]の 抵抗[ていこう]を示しているのです。
english: She is demonstrating her utmost resistance to me by not talking.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 朝晩簡単な体操をするだけのことで素晴らしい健康が保てます。
reading: 朝晩[あさばん]簡単な 体操[たいそう]をするだけのことで素晴らしい健康が 保[たも]てます。
english: You can maintain wonderful health just by doing simple exercise in the morning and evening.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 私が参加することであなたに迷惑はかかりませんか。
reading: 私が参加することであなたに迷惑はかかりませんか。
english: Wouldn't my participation cause you trouble?

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 彼のパーティーに行かなかったことで彼の気持ちを害したのでなければよいが。
reading: 彼のパーティーに行かなかったことで彼の気持ちを 害[がい]したのでなければよいが。
english: I hope I didn't hurt his feelings because I didn't go to his party (literally: by not having gone to his party).

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: 私は英語が下手ことで時々損をしている。
reading: 私は英語が下手ことで時々 損[そん]をしている。
english: I am sometimes put at a disadvantage because I am poor at English.

translation: By V-ing; because; result in; cause
explanation: A compound particle which indicates a means or a cause.
japanese: この国では外国人であることで得をすることがある。
reading: この国では外国人であることで 得[とく]をすることがある。
english: In this country there are times when you benefit for being a foreigner.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: これ以上聞くのは彼を余計に苦しめることになる。
reading: これ以上聞くのは彼を余計に苦しめることになる。
english: Asking more than this will cause him to suffer too much.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: 今これをしておかなかったら後で大変なことになる。
reading: 今これをしておかなかったら後で大変なことになる。
english: If we don't do this now, we will end up with an awful situation later.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: こんな結果になったということは我々の準備に手落ちがあったことになる。
reading: こんな結果になったということは我々の準備に手落ちがあったことになる。
english: Ending up with such a result means that there was something wrong with our preparation.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: 今回何も起こらなかったということはこのシステムで大丈夫だということになる。
reading: 今回何も起こらなかったということはこのシステムで大丈夫だということになる。
english: The fact that nothing happened this time means that the system is alright (literally: the situation is alright with this system).

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: 今怠けていると試験の時ひどいことになるよ。
reading: 今怠けていると試験の時ひどいことになるよ。
english: If you don't work now, you'll end up with a terrible situation when you take the exam.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: そんなことをしたら二度と人前に出られないことになる。
reading: そんなことをしたら二度と人前に出られないことになる。
english: If I / you do such a thing, I / you will end up not being able to appear in public again.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: A社が百万円寄付してくれれば合計一千万円に達することになる。
reading: A社が百万円寄付してくれれば合計一千万円に達することになる。
english: If Company A donates one million yen, the total sum will become (literally: end up with) ten million yen.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: すべてがうまくいけば来年卒業ということになります。
reading: すべてがうまくいけば来年卒業ということになります。
english: If everything goes well, (it means that) I will graduate next year.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: 葉書が戻って来たということは彼はもうこの住所には住んでいないことになる。
reading: 葉書が戻って来たということは彼はもうこの住所には住んでいないことになる。
english: That the postcard came back means that he doesn't live at this address any longer.

translation: End up (with); cause; come to mean that
explanation: A phrase which indicates that an action or event leads to a certain situation or logical conclusion.
japanese: これが一キロ二千円ということはこちらの方が高いということになる。
reading: これが一キロ二千円ということはこちらの方が高いということになる。
english: That this costs 2,000 yen a kilo means that this is more expensive.

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 今回の失敗は事前の話し合いが不十分だったことによる。
reading: 今回の失敗は 事前[じぜん]の話し合いが 不十分[ふじゅうぶん]だったことによる。
english: The failure this time is the result of insufficient discussion beforehand.
extra_notes:
【事前】じぜん ★★★★
prior,beforehand,in advance,before the fact,ex ante

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 進が非行に走ったのは両親の愛情が不足していたことによる。
reading: 進[すすむ]が 非行[ひこう]に走ったのは両親の愛情が 不足[ふそく]していたことによる。
english: Susumu's delinquency was caused by his parents' lack of affection. (literally: The fact that Susumu ran to juvenile delinquency is because his parents were not affectionate enough with him.

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 彼の現在の成功は平生の努力を怠らなかったことによる。
reading: 彼の現在の成功は 平生[へいぜい]の努力を 怠[おこた]らなかったことによる。
english: His present success is due to the fact that he worked hard every day (literally: did not neglect daily effort).

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 彼らの離婚は二人の価値観があまりに違っていたことによる。
reading: 彼らの離婚は二人の 価値観[かちかん]があまりに 違[ちが]っていたことによる。
english: Their divorce was caused by the fact that their value systems were very different.

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 彼が負けたのは勝ちを焦りすぎたことによる。
reading: 彼が負けたのは勝ちを 焦[あせ]りすぎたことによる。
english: His loss is due to the fact that he tried to win too quickly.

translation: Be due to the fact that; be caused by; be brought about by; be the result of; because
explanation: A phrase which is used to present an event as the cause of something.
japanese: 彼の才能がこれ程までに開発されたのは鈴木氏に師事したことによる。
reading: 彼の才能がこれ 程[ほど]までに 開発[かいはつ]されたのは鈴木氏に 師事[しじ]したことによる。
english: That his talent was developed to this degree is due to the fact that he studied with Mr. Suzuki.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: あんな男の言うことを聞くことはない。
reading: あんな男の言うことを聞くことはない。
english: There's no need to listen to a man like that.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: 彼女が今日の会議を忘れることはないと思います。
reading: 彼女が今日の会議を忘れることはないと思います。
english: I think that there is no possibility that she will forget today's meeting.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: あんな奴に親切にしてやることはない。
reading: あんな奴に親切にしてやることはない。
english: There is no need to be kind to a guy like that.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: 何もそんなに慌てることはない。
reading: 何もそんなに 慌[あわ]てることはない。
english: There is no need at all to be in such a hurry.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: 君が来ることはないと思います。
reading: 君が来ることはないと思います。
english: 1. I don't think it will be necessary for you to come here. 2. I think that there is no possibility that you will come here.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: もうお目にかかることはないかもしれませんね。
reading: もうお目にかかることはないかもしれませんね。
english: I might not have a chance to see you again.

translation: There is no need to; not necessary; there is no possibility that; there is no chance to
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that there is no need to do something or that there is no possibility of doing something.
japanese: 多分私が教えることはないと思います。
reading: 多分私が教えることはないと思います。
english: I don't think there is a possibility that I will teach.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: 加奈子の性格は明るく、無邪気だった。
reading: 加奈子[かなこ]の性格は明るく、 無邪気[むじゃき]だった。
english: Kanako's personality was cheerful and innocent.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: せっかく講演をしに行ったのに、聴衆が少なく、がっかりした。
reading: せっかく 講演[こうえん]をしに行ったのに、 聴衆[ちょうしゅう]が少なく、がっかりした。
english: I went all the way to give a lecture, but the audience was so small that I felt discouraged.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: カルフォルニアの空は青く、美しかった。
reading: カルフォルニアの空は青く、美しかった。
english: The Californian sky was blue and beautiful.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: トムの東京のアパートの部屋は暗く、狭い。
reading: トムの東京のアパートの部屋は暗く、狭い。
english: Tom's apartment room in Tokyo is dark and small.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: バッハの音楽は歯切れがよく、幾何学的だ。
reading: バッハの音楽は 歯切[はぎ]れがよく、 幾何学的[きかがくてき]だ。
english: Bach's music is very crisp and geometrical.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: ニューヨークタイムズは質が高く、購読者の数も多い。
reading: ニューヨークタイムズは 質[しつ]が高く、 購読者[こうどくしゃ]の数も多い。
english: The New York Times is high in quality and has many subscribers.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: 世界の平和は得られにくく、維持しにくい。
reading: 世界の平和は得られにくく、 維持[いじ]しにくい。
english: World peace is hard to achieve and hard to maintain.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: あの哲学者の思想は分かりやすく、文章も簡潔だ。
reading: あの 哲学者[てつがくしゃ]の 思想[しそう]は分かりやすく、文章も 簡潔[かんけつ]だ。
english: That philosopher's ideas are easy to understand and his writing is simple, too.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: 去年の冬は雪が多く、車の運転が大変だった。
reading: 去年[きょねん]の冬は雪が多く、車の運転が大変だった。
english: Last winter there was much snow and it was hard to drive around.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: 私は失敗が恐ろしく、新しいことが何も出来ない
reading: 私は失敗が恐ろしく、新しいことが何も出来ない
english: I'm afraid of failure, and I can't do anything new.

translation: And; so
explanation: A continuative form of an い-type adjective.
japanese: 洋子は一人でいるのが寂しく、最近猫を飼い始めた。
reading: 洋子[ようこ]は一人でいるのが寂しく、最近猫を飼い始めた。
english: Yoko felt lonely living alone, so she got a pet cat recently.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 私達は一歩も歩けないくらい疲れていた。
reading: 私達は 一歩[いっぽ]も歩けないくらい疲れていた。
english: We were so tired that we couldn't even take a step. (literally: We were tired to the extent that we couldn't even walk one step.)

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 今晩は暖かいのでストーブが要らないくらいだ。
reading: 今晩は暖かいのでストーブが要らないくらいだ。
english: It is so warm this evening that we (almost) don't need a heater.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 山田さんくらいよく物を忘れる人はいない。
reading: 山田さんくらいよく物を忘れる人はいない。
english: There's no one who is as forgetful as Yamada (literally: who forgets things as much as Yamada does).

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 私は料理は下手ですが、ご飯くらい（は）炊けます。
reading: 私は料理は下手ですが、ご飯くらい（は） 炊[た]けます。
english: I am a poor cook (literally: bad at cooking), but I can at least cook rice.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 今この仕事が出来るのは彼くらいのものだ。
reading: 今この仕事が出来るのは彼くらいのものだ。
english: He is the only person who can do this job now. (literally: The person who is capable enough to do this job is he.)

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: そんなことをするくらいなら死んだ方がましだ。
reading: そんなことをするくらいなら死んだ方がましだ。
english: I would rather die than do such a thing.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: その家は直しようがないくらい傷んでいた。
reading: その家は直しようがないくらい 傷[いた]んでいた。
english: That house was so damaged that it seemed it couldn't be repaired. (literally: That house was damaged to the extent that it seemed it couldn't be repaired.)

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 次郎はひどく酔っていて立っていられないくらいだった。
reading: 次郎[じろ]はひどく 酔[よ]っていて立っていられないくらいだった。
english: Jiro was so drunk that he couldn't hold himself upright.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 内田さんくらいかわいそうな人はいない。
reading: 内田さんくらいかわいそうな人はいない。
english: This is no one who is as pitiful as Uchida.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: あの時くらい苦しかった時はない。
reading: あの時くらい苦しかった時はない。
english: I have never suffered as much as I did that time.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: 信頼していた人に裏切られる（こと）くらい辛いことはない。
reading: 信頼[しんらい]していた人に裏切られる（こと）くらい 辛[つら]いことはない。
english: There is nothing as painful as being betrayed by someone you have trusted.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: いくら安い所でもシャワーくらい付いているでしょう。
reading: いくら安い所でもシャワーくらい付いているでしょう。
english: Even though it is a cheap place, there should at least be a shower.

translation: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
explanation: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
japanese: あんな男の下で働くくらいなら乞食になった方がましだ。
reading: あんな男の下で働くくらいなら 乞食[こじき]になった方がましだ。
english: I would rather be a beggar than work under such a man.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 山田さんは日本人のくせにあまり漢字を知らない。
reading: 山田さんは日本人のくせにあまり漢字を知らない。
english: Although Mr. Yamada is Japanese, he doesn't know many kanji.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 山内はよく知っているくせに何も教えてくれない。
reading: 山内はよく知っているくせに何も教えてくれない。
english: In spite of the fact that Yamauchi knows a lot about it, he doesn't tell me anything.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 彼は大学生のくせに漫画ばかり読んでいる。
reading: 彼は大学生のくせに漫画ばかり読んでいる。
english: Although he is a college student, all he does is read comics.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 良子はまだ学生のくせに高いマンションに住んでいる。
reading: 良子はまだ学生のくせに高いマンションに住んでいる。
english: Although Yoshiko is still a student, she lives in an expensive condominium.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 隆司は下手なくせに私とテニスをしたがる。
reading: 隆司[たかし]は下手なくせに私とテニスをしたがる。
english: Takashi is a bad (tennis) player, and yet he wants to play with me.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 孝男はお金もないくせに外車を欲しがっている。
reading: 孝男[たかお]はお金もないくせに 外車[がいしゃ]を欲しがっている。
english: Takao doesn't have money, and yet he wants a foreign car.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 吉田は前は私を見ても挨拶もしなかったくせに、私が部長になった途端に急に愛想がよくなった。
reading: 吉田は前は私を見ても挨拶もしなかったくせに、私が部長になった 途端[とたん]に急に 愛想[あいそ]がよくなった。
english: Before (the time I became a division chief), Yoshida never greeted me when he saw me, but he suddenly became friendly  when I became a division chief.

translation: Although; in spite of the fact that; and yet; but
explanation: A conjunction which expresses the speaker's contempt, anger, or disagreement about someone's action, behaviour, or state.
japanese: 昨日まで見習いだったくせに大きな口をきくな。
reading: 昨日まで見習いだったくせに大きな口をきくな。
english: Don't talk big! You were only a trainee until yesterday!
extra_notes: 見習い = apprentice, trainee

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: これは簡単な計算だから計算器を使うまでもない。
reading: これは簡単な計算だから計算器を使うまでもない。
english: This is a simple calculation, so it is not necessary (to bother) to use a calculator.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 言うまでもなくジョージ・ワシントンはアメリカの初代大統領だ。
reading: 言うまでもなくジョージ・ワシントンはアメリカの初代大統領だ。
english: Needless to say, George Washington was the first president of the United States.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 彼がみんなに尊敬されたのは言うまでもない。
reading: 彼がみんなに尊敬されたのは言うまでもない。
english: It goes without saying that he was respected by everybody.
extra_notes: 言うまでもない: it goes without saying; obviously, needless to say

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 大した用事じゃないからあなたがわざわざ行くまでもないでしょう。
reading: 大した用事じゃないからあなたがわざわざ行くまでもないでしょう。
english: It's not important business, so it's probably not necessary for you to go out of your way to go there.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 行けば分かることですから電話して聞くまでもありません。
reading: 行けば分かることですから電話して聞くまでもありません。
english: We can find out when we get there, so we don't need to call about it.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 今更申すまでもありませんが、山中先生はこの分野では指導的な立場にあるお方です。
reading: 今更[いまさら] 申[もう]すまでもありませんが、山中先生はこの 分野[ぶんや]では 指導的[しどうてき]な立場にあるお 方[かた]です。
english: Needless to say at this point in time, Professor Yamanaka is a leading figure in this field.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: それは説明するまでもなく明らかなことだ。
reading: それは説明するまでもなく明らかなことだ。
english: It is so obvious that no explanation is necessary.

translation: Not necessary (to bother) to; do not need (to go as far as) to; do not have to
explanation: There is no point in going as far as to do something.
japanese: 待つまでもなく妻は買い物から帰ってきた。
reading: 待つまでもなく妻は買い物から帰ってきた。
english: My wife came back from shopping without my having to wait for her.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: もう橋本には何も頼むまい。
reading: もう橋本には何も頼むまい。
english: I will probably not ask any more favours of Hashimoto.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: これは恐らく誰も気が付くまい。
reading: これは恐らく誰も気が付くまい。
english: Probably no one will notice this.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: 参加者はそれほど多くはあるまい。
reading: 参加者はそれほど多くはあるまい。
english: There probably won't be many participants.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: この教え方はあまり効果的ではあるまい。
reading: この教え方はあまり効果的ではあるまい。
english: This teaching method is probably not very effective.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: これは何かの間違いではあるまいか。
reading: これは何かの間違いではあるまいか。
english: I have a feeling that this is some kind of mistake. (literally: Is this not some kind of mistake?)

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: 清のパーティーにはもう行くまい。
reading: 清[きよし]のパーティーにはもう行くまい。
english: I will not go to Kiyoshi's parties any more.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: 日本へ行こうか行くまいか迷った。
reading: 日本へ行こうか行くまいか迷った。
english: I couldn't decide whether I should go to Japan or not.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: 彼は多分誰の言うことも聞くまい。
reading: 彼は多分誰の言うことも聞くまい。
english: He probably won't listen to anyone.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: それは今我々には必要ではあるまい。
reading: それは今我々には必要ではあるまい。
english: It is probably not necessary for us now.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: この問題はこの学校の学生にはそれほど難しくはあるまい。
reading: この問題はこの学校の学生にはそれほど難しくはあるまい。
english: This problem is probably not very difficult for these students.

translation: Will not; will probably not; be probably not
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's negative volition or conjecture.
japanese: ジョージが真相を知っているのではあるまいか。
reading: ジョージが真相を知っているのではあるまいか。
english: I have a feeling that George knows the truth.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさか美智子があんな男と結婚するとは思わなかった。
reading: まさか美智子があんな男と結婚するとは思わなかった。
english: I never dreamed that Michiko would marry that kind of a guy.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさかあたしの誕生日を忘れたんじゃないでしょうね。
reading: まさかあたしの誕生日を忘れたんじゃないでしょうね。
english: Don't tell me that you forgot my birthday!

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさか彼がこんな寒い日に来るはずはないですよ。
reading: まさか彼がこんな寒い日に来るはずはないですよ。
english: Surely he won't show up on such a cold day!

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: 最近父から手紙が来ないけれど、まさか具合が悪いのではあるまい。
reading: 最近父から手紙が来ないけれど、まさか具合が悪いのではあるまい。
english: Lately I haven't heard from my father, but God forbid that he might be ill.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: Ａ：七十のおじいさんが高校に入ったんだって。 Ｂ：まさか。
reading:
Ａ：七十のおじいさんが高校に入ったんだって。
Ｂ：まさか。
english:
A: I heard that an old man of 70 entered a high school.
B: Incredible!

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさか自分が交通事故に巻き込まれるとは思いませんでしたよ。
reading: まさか自分が交通事故に巻き込まれるとは思いませんでしたよ。
english: I never thought that I would be involved in a traffic accident.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさか司法試験に一度でパス出来るとは考えてもいなかった。
reading: まさか司法試験に一度でパス出来るとは考えてもいなかった。
english: I never dreamed that I could pass the bar examination on my first attempt.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: 青い顔をしているけど、まさか病気じゃないでしょうね。
reading: 青い顔をしているけど、まさか病気じゃないでしょうね。
english: You look pale. Are you sure you are not ill?

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさかこんな高いダイヤモンドの指輪を買ってくれたんじゃないでしょうね。
reading: まさかこんな高いダイヤモンドの指輪を買ってくれたんじゃないでしょうね。
english: I don't believe that you brought me such an expensive diamond ring!

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさかあんないい人が人を殺すなんてあるはずがない。
reading: まさかあんないい人が人を殺すなんてあるはずがない。
english: Don't tell me a good person like that killed someone.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさか彼が日本語の先生になるとは考えてもみなかった。
reading: まさか彼が日本語の先生になるとは考えてもみなかった。
english: I never thought that he would become a Japanese language teacher.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: まさかあの人がそんなことを言うはずはないでしょ。
reading: まさかあの人がそんなことを言うはずはないでしょ。
english: It's not at all likely that she has said such a thing!

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: もう五月なのだから、まさか雪は降るまい。
reading: もう五月なのだから、まさか雪は降るまい。
english: Since it is May it is very unlikely that it will snow.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: 母は入院中だから、まさか私の結婚式に出席するわけにはいくまい。
reading: 母は入院中だから、まさか私の結婚式に出席するわけにはいくまい。
english: Because my mother is in the hospital right now, it is impossible to expect her to attend my wedding.

translation: Incredible; never thought; never dreamed; surely not; impossible; don't tell me that ~; not at all likely; absolutely not.
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's strong belief that something is not expected to (have) become a reality.
japanese: A: スミスさんは日本語を一年しか勉強していないのに、ペラペラですよ。 B: まさか。
reading:
A: スミスさんは日本語を一年しか勉強していないのに、ペラペラですよ。
B: まさか。
english:
A: Smith has studied Japanese for only one year, but he is fluent, you know. 
B: Impossible!

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: こんな給料をもらう（くらい）なら辞めた方がましだ。
reading: こんな給料をもらう（くらい）なら辞めた方がましだ。
english: If this is the salary, it would be better to quit.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: 今度の日本語の先生は前の先生よりずっとましだ。
reading: 今度の日本語の先生は前の先生よりずっとましだ。
english: This new Japanese teacher is much better than the former teacher.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: もう少しましなコーヒーはありませんか。
reading: もう少しましなコーヒーはありませんか。
english: Isn't there coffee that's a bit better?

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: こんな大学に入るくらいなら、仕事をした方がましだ。
reading: こんな大学に入るくらいなら、仕事をした方がましだ。
english: I might as well work than enter such a college.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: こんな苦しい生活をするくらいなら、死んだ方がましだ。
reading: こんな苦しい生活をするくらいなら、死んだ方がましだ。
english: It is better to die than to lead such a life.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: 学校へ行くくらいなら家でテレビでも見ていた方がましだ。
reading: 学校へ行くくらいなら家でテレビでも見ていた方がましだ。
english: It's better to watch TV at home than go to school.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: こんな不味いご飯を食べるくらいなら何も食べない方がいい。
reading: こんな 不味[まず]いご飯を食べるくらいなら何も食べない方がいい。
english: It's better not to eat anything rather than eating such an untasteful meal.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: あのレストランよりこのレストランの方がましだ。
reading: あのレストランよりこのレストランの方がましだ。
english: This restaurant is better than that restaurant over there.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: ここの夏も暑いですが、東京の夏よりましですね。
reading: ここの夏も暑いですが、東京の夏よりましですね。
english: Summer here is hot, too, but it's better than summer in Tokyo.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: 僕の車もとても古いけど、君のよりましだ。
reading: 僕の車もとても古いけど、君のよりましだ。
english: My car is also very old, but it is better than yours.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: 給料は二万円でも、ないよりましだ。
reading: 給料は二万円でも、ないよりましだ。
english: Although the salary is just 20,000 yen it's better than nothing.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: お宅は狭いと言っても私の家に比べたらずっとましですよ。
reading: お宅は狭いと言っても私の家に比べたらずっとましですよ。
english: You say your house is small, but it is much better than our house, you know.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: もう少しましな人間になろうと思っています。
reading: もう少しましな人間になろうと思っています。
english: I am thinking of becoming a slightly better person.

translation: Better; less objectionable; preferable; might as well ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that although someone/something (or some situation) is not satisfactory it is better than someone/something else.
japanese: このホテルはひどいですね。この辺にもう少しましなホテルはないんでしょうか。
reading: このホテルはひどいですね。この辺にもう少しましなホテルはないんでしょうか。
english: This hotel is awful. Isn't there a slightly better hotel around here?

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 現金（か）、または小切手でお払い下さい。
reading: 現金（か）、または小切手でお払い下さい。
english: Please pay either in cash or by check.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: Ａ（か）、またはＢのどちらかを選びなさい。
reading: Ａ（か）、またはＢのどちらかを選びなさい。
english: Select either A or B.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 電話番号を聞き違えたか、またはもうこの電話は使われていないのだろう。
reading: 電話番号を聞き違えたか、またはもうこの電話は使われていないのだろう。
english: I guess that either I misheard the phone number or this number (literally: phone) is no longer in use.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 黒（か）、または青のボールペンを使って下さい。
reading: 黒（か）、または青のボールペンを使って下さい。
english: Please use a black or blue ballpoint pen.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 三年以下の懲役（か）、または百万円以下の罰金。
reading: 三年以下の 懲役[ちょうえき]（か）、または百万円以下の 罰金[ばっきん]。
english: Imprisonment up to three years or a penalty up to one million yen.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 昼は仕事があるから、夜間コースを取るか、または家庭教師を探すしかない。
reading: 昼は仕事があるから、 夜間[やかん]コースを取るか、または家庭教師を探すしかない。
english: I have to work during the day, so I have no choice but to take a night course or look for a tutor.

translation: Or; either ~ or ~
explanation: A conjunction which connects two choices or possibilities expressed by noun phrases or sentences.
japanese: 二週間前に出したはずの手紙がまだ先方に着いていない。私の秘書が出し忘れたか、または郵便局が間違えたのだろう。
reading: 二週間前に出したはずの手紙がまだ 先方[せんぽう]に 着[つ]いていない。私の 秘書[ひしょ]が出し忘れたか、または郵便局が間違えたのだろう。
english: A letter that I assumed was mailed two weeks ago has not reached the addressee yet. It is probably that my secretary forgot to mail it or that the post office made a mistake.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: 私の車は右から二台目です。
reading: 私の車は右から二台目です。
english: My car is the second one from the right.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: それは上から三つ目の引き出しに入っています。
reading: それは上から三つ目の引き出しに入っています。
english: It is in the third drawer from the top.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: 山本先生は前から二列目、左から三人目の人だ。
reading: 山本先生は前から 二列[にれつ]目、左から三人目の人だ。
english: Mr. Yamamoto is the person third from the left in the second row.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: 一回目は失敗した。
reading: 一回目は失敗した。
english: I failed the first time.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: この日本語プログラムは今年で五年目になる。
reading: この日本語プログラムは今年で五年目になる。
english: This Japanese program is in its fifth year (this year).

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: 五周目からは林先生がこのクラスをお教えになります。
reading: 五周目からは 林[はやし]先生がこのクラスをお教えになります。
english: From the fifth week on Mr. Hayashi will teach this class.

translation: -th; -th one
