explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: 上野さんは一番目に演奏する。
reading: 上野さんは一番目に演奏する。
english: Miss Ueno will perform first.

translation: -th; -th one
explanation: A suffix which represents an ordinal number.
japanese: A: 今のバイオリンは何台目ですか。 B: 六台目です。
reading:
A: 今のバイオリンは何台目ですか。 
B: 六台目です。
english:
A: How many violins have you used so far? 
B: The present one is my sixth.

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: 彼か学業面では優秀だが、精神面に少し弱さがあるようだ。
reading: 彼が学業面では 優秀[ゆうしゅう]だが、精神面に少し弱さがあるようだ。
english: He is excellent in terms of his academic performance (literally: on the side of his academic performance) but he seems to have some psychological weakness (literally: have some weakness on the side of his psychology).

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: この食堂は衛生面によく気を配っている。
reading: この食堂は衛生面によく気を配っている。
english: This restaurant pays close attention to hygiene (literally: the hygienic aspect).

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: 藤田さんは技術面からのみものを見る傾向がある。
reading: 藤田[ふじた]さんは技術面からのみものを見る傾向がある。
english: Mr. Fujita tends to view things from the technical standpoint alone.

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: ここの土地所有者は税金面で優遇措置を受けている。
reading: ここの土地所有者は税金面で優遇措置を受けている。
english: The land owners here receive favourable treatment in terms of tax.

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: あの候補者の演説は政策面での説得力に欠ける。
reading: あの候補者の演説は政策面での説得力に欠ける。
english: That candidate's speech is not convincing from the standpoint of policy.

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: 彼女は日本へ行っても語学面は心配しなくてもいい。
reading: 彼女は日本へ行っても語学面は心配しなくてもいい。
english: She does not need to worry about language (literally: the aspect of language) when she goes to Japan.

translation: (on) the side of; (from) the aspect of; (from) the standpoint/viewpoint of; in terms of
explanation: A suffix which forms a compound that means a side of X, or an aspect of X.
japanese: この車は性能面を高く評価された。
reading: この車は性能面を高く評価された。
english: This car was highly regarded in terms of performance.

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 僕は小説を書いて、芥川賞を取ってみせる。
reading: 僕は小説を書いて、 芥川[あくたがわ]賞を取ってみせる。
english: I will definitely write a novel and get the Akutagawa Prize.
extra_notes: (literary award)​

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 僕はこの会社の社長になってみせる。
reading: 僕はこの会社の社長になってみせる。
english: I am determined to become the president of this company.

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 私はあのハンサムな男の子と結婚してみせるわ。
reading: 私はあのハンサムな男の子と結婚してみせるわ。
english: I can manage to marry that handsome guy.

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 三百ページの本を一時間で読んでみせるぞ。
reading: 三百ページの本を一時間で読んでみせるぞ。
english: I will definitely read a 300-page book in one hour.

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 今年こそは修士論文を書き上げてみせる。
reading: 今年こそは修士論文を書き上げてみせる。
english: This year I will definitely finish writing my master's thesis.

translation: Can manage to; will definitely do; am determined to
explanation: The speaker's strong determination to achieve something for others to see.
japanese: 一男は百メートルを十一秒で走ってみせた。
reading: 一男は百メートルを十一 秒[びょう]で走ってみせた。
english: Kazuo managed to run 100 meters in 11 seconds.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 吉岡さんは今年七十歳だが、毎日一キロ走る。時々泳ぎもする。
reading: 吉岡さんは今年七十歳だが、毎日一キロ走る。時々泳ぎもする。
english: Although Mr. Yoshioka is seventy this year, he runs one kilometre every day. He occasionally swims, too.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: この本は有益で、その上、面白くもある。
reading: この本は有益で、その上、面白くもある。
english: This book is beneficial and, on top of that, it is also interesting.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: この映画は面白くないし、特に教育的でもない。
reading: この映画は面白くないし、特に教育的でもない。
english: This movie is not interesting and not particularly educational, either.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 奥田氏は弁護士であり、作家でもある。
reading: 奥田氏は弁護士であり、作家でもある。
english: Mr. Okuda is a lawyer and also a novelist.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 由利子は最近廊下ですれ違っても見向きもしない。
reading: 由利子は最近廊下ですれ違っても見向きもしない。
english: Recently Yuriko does not (even) look at me even if we pass each other in the hall.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 猿だっておかしければ笑いもするでしょう。
reading: 猿だっておかしければ笑いもするでしょう。
english: Apes also laugh if something is funny, right?

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 健一は新婚早々三日も家を空けたが、和代は泣かなかった。そして、怒りもしなかった。
reading: 健一は新婚早々三日も家を空けたが、 和代[かずよ]は泣かなかった。そして、 怒[いか]りもしなかった。
english: Kenichi didn't go home for three days right after their marriage, but Kazuyo didn't cry. She didn't get mad, either.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: あのアパートはあまり便利ではないし安くもない。
reading: あのアパートはあまり便利ではないし安くもない。
english: That apartment is not convenient and not inexpensive, either.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 周遊券は便利な上、経済的でもある。
reading: 周遊券は便利な上、経済的でもある。
english: Excursion tickets are convenient; on top of that, they are also economical.

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 田口さんなんて友達でもないのに、どうしてそんなにしてあげるの。
reading: 田口さんなんて友達でもないのに、どうしてそんなにしてあげるの。
english: Mr. Taguchi is not even a friend. How come you do so much for him?

translation: Also; too; (not) either; (not) even
explanation: A particle which implies that something else is also (not) the case.
japanese: 安くもないのに、そうしてそんなものを買うんですか。
reading: 安くもないのに、どうしてそんなものを買うんですか。
english: Why are you going to buy a thing like that which is not even cheap?

translation: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
japanese: この美術館は三時間もあれば全部見られる。
reading: この美術館は三時間もあれば全部見られる。
english: Three hours are enough to see everything in this art museum. (literally: If you have as many as three hours, you can see everything in this art museum.)

translation: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
japanese: 二万円も持って行けば足りるでしょう。
reading: 二万円も持って行けば足りるでしょう。
english: 20,000 yen will probably be enough. (literally: If you take as much as 20,000 yen with you, it will probably be sufficient.)

translation: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
japanese: ビールは二ダースも買っておけば大丈夫だ。
reading: ビールは二ダースも買っておけば大丈夫だ。
english: As for beer, if we buy two dozen, it will be enough (literally: we will be all right).

translation: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
japanese: 一週間もすれば歩けるようになります。
reading: 一週間もすれば歩けるようになります。
english: It will take no more than a week until you can walk (literally: until you become able to walk).

translation: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
japanese: 二、三回も聞けば大体分かる。
reading: 二、三回も聞けば大体分かる。
english: Listening two or three times is/will be sufficient for understanding most of it.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 私は俳句が大好きで、よく読みもするし自分で作りもする。
reading: 私は 俳句[はいく]が大好きで、よく読みもするし自分で作りもする。
english: Loving haiku, I read them a lot and I write them myself (too).

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: あのアパートはよくも安くもない。
reading: あのアパートはよくも安くもない。
english: That apartment is neither good nor cheap.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 彼の作品は面白くもあり読みやすくもある。
reading: 彼の作品は面白くもあり読みやすくもある。
english: His writings are interesting and also easy to read.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 彼女の英語は特に上手でも下手でもない。
reading: 彼女の英語は特に上手でも下手でもない。
english: Her English is neither particularly good nor bad.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 彼は親戚でもなければ友達でもない。
reading: 彼は親戚でもなければ友達でもない。
english: He is neither a relative nor a friend.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 私達のクラスには中国人の学生もいればスペイン人の学生もいる。
reading: 私達のクラスには中国人の学生もいればスペイン人の学生もいる。
english: In my class, there are Chinese students and there are Spanish students too.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 私はドイツ語なら読みも話しも出来る。
reading: 私はドイツ語なら読みも話しも出来る。
english: When it comes to German, I can both read it and speak it.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: この教科書は難しすぎもせずやさしすぎもせず、ちょうどいい。
reading: この教科書は難しすぎもせずやさしすぎもせず、ちょうどいい。
english: This textbook is not too difficult and not too easy, either; it's just right.
extra_notes: せず - without

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: ボブの奥さんは料理もしなければ掃除もしない。
reading: ボブの奥さんは料理もしなければ掃除もしない。
english: Bob's wife does not cook and does not clean (the house), either.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: この物語は面白くもなければおかしくもない。
reading: この物語は面白くもなければおかしくもない。
english: This story is not interesting and not funny, either.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: 奥田氏は弁護士でもあり、作家でもある。
reading: 奥田[おくだ]氏は弁護士でもあり、作家でもある。
english: Mr. Okuda is a lawyer and also a novelist.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: この言葉の意味は字引も引いたし友達にも聞いたが結局わからなかった。
reading: この言葉の意味は 字引[じびき]も 引[ひ]いたし友達にも聞いたが結局わからなかった。
english: I checked the word in the dictionary and also asked my friend, but I didn't get the meaning after all.

translation: Both ~ and ~; neither ~ nor ~; also; (not) either
explanation: A structure which presents two states or actions of someone or something.
japanese: あの人は頭もいいしハンサムもあるが、どうも好きになれない。
reading: あの人は頭もいいしハンサムもあるが、どうも好きになれない。
english: That man is smart and handsome, too, but I'm unable to like him for some reason.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: 現在のコンピュータのほとんどはフォン・ノイマン型と呼ばれているものである。
reading: 現在のコンピュータのほとんどはフォン・ノイマン型と呼ばれているものである。
english: Most of the present computers are those which are called the von Neumann model.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: Ｃ社が盲人用障害物感知器の試作品を発表した。この装置は目の不自由な人が皮膚への刺激を通して、前にある障害物などを感知出来るようにしたもの（である）。
reading: Ｃ社が 盲人[もうじん]用 障害物[しょうがいぶつ] 感知器[かんちき]の試作品を発表した。この 装置[そうち]は 目の不自由[めのふじゆう]な人が 皮膚[ひふ]への刺激を通して、前にある障害物などを 感知[かんち]出来るようにしたもの（である）。
english: C Company announced an experimental model of an obstacle detector for the blind. This device enables blind people to sense obstacles ahead of them through stimuli to their skin.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: 米国の貿易赤字はしばらくこのまま続くものと予想される。
reading: 米国[べいこく]の 貿易赤字[ぼうえきあかじ]はしばらくこのまま続くものと予想される。
english: It is predicted that the U.S. trade deficit [is something which] will remain as it is for a while.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: この本の内容はいかなる人間社会にも当てはまる一般的なものである。
reading: この本の内容はいかなる人間社会にも当てはまる一般的なものである。
english: The content of this book is something which generally applies to any human society.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: これは革命的発見とも言うべきものだ。
reading: これは革命的発見とも言うべきものだ。
english: This is something which should be called a revolutionary discovery.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: C社がM型ワープロの五パーセント値下げに踏み切った。これは、最近低下している同社のワープロシェアの巻き返しを狙ったもの（である）。
reading: C社がM型ワープロの五パーセント 値下[ねさ]げに踏み切った。これは、最近 低下[ていか]している 同社[どうしゃ]のワープロシェアの巻き返しを狙ったもの（である）。
english: C Company has decided to reduce the price of M-type word-processors by five percent. Their aim is to regain their recently declining share of the word-processor market.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: 大学入試制度調査会の第一回会合が昨日都内のホテルで行われた。この調査会は、最近しばしば批判の対象になっている、現行の大学入試制度の見直しのために発足したものである。
reading: 大学入試制度 調査会[ちょうさかい]の第一回会合が昨日 都内[とない]のホテルで行われた。この調査会は、最近しばしば 批判[ひはん]の 対象[たいしょう]になっている、 現行[げんこう]の大学入試制度の 見直[みなお]しのために 発足[はっそく]したものである。
english: The first meeting of the Study Group for University Entrance Examinations was held at a hotel in Tokyo yesterday. This study group was started for the purpose of reviewing the present university entrance examination system which is criticized frequently these days.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: この問題は時期が来れば自然に解決されるものと見られている。
reading: この問題は 時期[じき]が来れば自然に解決されるものと見られている。
english: This problem is expected to resolve smoothly when the time comes.

translation: (is) that which ~; (is) something which ~; (are) those which ~
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to create a sentence structure which presents a characteristic of something.
japanese: エレクトロニクスの世界は今後も急速な進歩を続けていくものと予想される。
reading: エレクトロニクスの世界は今後も 急速[きゅうそく]な 進歩[しんぽ]を続けていくものと予想される。
english: It is predicted that the world of electronics will continue advancing rapidly from now on, too.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 彼はよく食べるなあ。
reading: 彼はよく食べるなあ。
english: He eats a lot!

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 素晴らしい映画だなあと思った。
reading: 素晴らしい映画だなあと思った。
english: I was so impressed by that (wonderful) movie. (literally: What a wonderful movie, I thought.)

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: まだ間に合うかなあ。
reading: まだ間に合うかなあ。
english: I wonder if I can still make it in time.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 河合君、早く来ないかなあ。
reading: 河合[かわい]君、早く来ないかなあ。
english: I wish Kawai would come soon.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 車があったらいいなあ。
reading: 車があったらいいなあ。
english: I wish I had a car.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: よく飲んだなあ。
reading: よく飲んだなあ。
english: We drank a lot! / Did we drink!

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: あのけちの吉田がよく金を出したなあ。
reading: あのけちの吉田がよく金を出したなあ。
english: I'm surprised that that stingy guy Yoshida gave money.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 家が欲しいなあ。
reading: 家が欲しいなあ。
english: I want a house so badly.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 山内さん、今日は来ないかなあ。
reading: 山内さん、今日は来ないかなあ。
english: I wonder if Mr. Yamauchi is not coming today.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 何か面白い映画はないかなあ。
reading: 何か面白い映画はないかなあ。
english: I wonder if there is (literally: isn't) an interesting movie.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: 彼女、こんなことを言っても怒らないかなあ。
reading: 彼女、こんなことを言っても怒らないかなあ。
english: I wonder if she will (literally: won't) get mad if I say such a thing.

translation: How ~!; what ~! ~!; I wonder; I wish
explanation: An exclamatory sentential particle which is used in informal male speech.
japanese: タイガース、今日勝たないかなあ。
reading: タイガース、今日勝たないかなあ。
english: I wish the Tigers would win today.

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: 日本の文化はユニークだなどと言う人がいるが、私はそうは思わない。
reading: 日本の文化はユニークだなどと言う人がいるが、私はそうは思わない。
english: There are people who say things like Japanese culture is unique, but I don't think so.

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: お金がないから、日本へ行くなどということは夢です。
reading: お金がないから、日本へ行くなどということは夢です。
english: I don't have money, so ideas like going to Japan are just dreams.

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: 毎日運動しろなどとは言いませんから、週に二、三度運動したらどうですか。
reading: 毎日運動しろなどとは言いませんから、週に二、三度運動したらどうですか。
english: I'm not saying you should exercise every day, but why don't you do it 2 or 3 times a week?

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: 困った時は助けてくれるだろうなどと甘く考えてはいけない。
reading: 困った時は助けてくれるだろうなどと甘く考えてはいけない。
english: Don't think indulgent things like people will help you when you are in trouble.

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: 日本へ留学しようとしているケントさんは、うまく日本の生活に適応出来るかなどと心配している。
reading: 日本へ留学しようとしているケントさんは、うまく日本の生活に適応出来るかなどと心配している。
english: Mr. Kent, who is about to go to Japan to study, is worried about things like whether he will be able to adjust to Japanese life.
extra_notes: ようとする = to try to...; to be about to do... (​after the volitional form of verb)

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: みんなが君のことをクラブのホープだなどと言っているよ。
reading: みんなが君のことをクラブのホープだなどと言っているよ。
english: Everybody is saying things like you are the hope of our club.

translation: (things) like ~; ~ or something like
explanation: A compound particle that indicates an approximate quote of words or ideas.
japanese: 尊敬しています、などと言われると照れくさい。
reading: 尊敬しています、などと言われると照れくさい。
english: When I am told that they respect me, I feel embarrassed.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: この部屋は狭いながら（も）居心地がよい。
reading: この部屋は狭いながら（も）居心地がよい。
english: Although his room is small, it is comfortable.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 山口はそのことを知りながら（も）黙っていた。
reading: 山口はそのことを知りながら（も）黙っていた。
english: Yamaguchi kept silent, although he knew about the matter.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: あの人は若いながら（も）、なかなか有能だ。
reading: あの人は若いながら（も）、なかなか有能だ。
english: He is young, but he is very capable.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 教授のゼミは厳しいながら（も）学ぶところが多かった。
reading: 教授のゼミは厳しいながら（も） 学[まな]ぶところが多かった。
english: Although my professor's seminar was tough, I learned a lot from it (as a result).
extra_notes: ところ here is used to mean "as a result."

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: ベッキーの日本語はたどたどしいながら（も）言おうとしていることは分かった。
reading: ベッキーの日本語はたどたどしいながら（も）言おうとしていることは分かった。
english: Becky's Japanese is halting, but I was able to figure out what she was trying to say.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: この辺は不便ながら（も）、車も少なく、空気が綺麗だ。
reading: この辺は不便ながら（も）、車も少なく、空気が綺麗だ。
english: This area is inconvenient, but there is little traffic and the air is clean.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 残念ながら、明日の音楽会には行けません。
reading: 残念ながら、明日の音楽会には行けません。
english: To my regret, I cannot go to tomorrow's concert.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: ひとみは子供ながら（も）、よく考えてものを言う。
reading: ひとみは子供ながら（も）、よく考えてものを言う。
english: Hitomi is just a child, but she says things very carefully (literally: after thinking hard).

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: この車は小型ながら（も）よく走る。
reading: この車は小型ながら（も）よく走る。
english: This car runs well, although it is such a small car.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 日本の単身赴任のサラリーマンは苦しみながら（も）、会社のために働いている。
reading: 日本の単身赴任のサラリーマンは苦しみながら（も）、会社のために働いている。
english: Japanese white-collar workers who have to leave their families behind for work transfers work for the company even though their lives are hard.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: ボブは日本にいながら（も）、洋食ばかり食べている。
reading: ボブは日本にいながら（も）、洋食ばかり食べている。
english: Bob is in Japan, but he eats only Western-style food.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 煙草は体に悪いと分かっていながら（も）、吸ってしまう。
reading: 煙草は体に悪いと分かっていながら（も）、吸ってしまう。
english: Even though I know cigarettes are bad for my body, I end up smoking them.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 弟は沢山本を買っていながら（も）、少しも読んでいない。
reading: 弟は 沢山[たくさん]本を買っていながら（も）、少しも読んでいない。
english: My younger brother has bought many books, but he has not read any of them.

translation: Although; even though; nevertheless
explanation: A disjunctive conjunction used normally in written Japanese with the meaning of 'although'.
japanese: 彼は何度も日本へ行っていながら（も）、日本語が少しも話せない。
reading: 彼は何度も日本へ行っていながら（も）、日本語が少しも話せない。
english: Although he has been to Japan many times he cannot speak Japanese at all.

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese:
Ａ：日本語の新聞は読まないんですか。
Ｂ：いいえ、読まないこと{も/は}ないんですが、時たまですね。
reading:
Ａ：日本語の新聞は読まないんですか?
Ｂ：いいえ、読まないこと{も/は}ないんですが、時たまですね。
english:
A: Don't you read Japanese newspapers?
B: I do read them, but very rarely. (literally: It isn't the case that I don't read them, but very rarely.)

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese: A: この辺は夏涼しくないんですか。B: いや、涼しくないこともないんですが、時々ひどく暑くなります。
reading:
A: この辺は夏涼しくないんですか。
B: いや、涼しくないこともないんですが、時々ひどく暑くなります。
english:
A: Isn't it cool around here during the summer? 
B: Yes, it is cool, but sometimes it gets terribly hot.

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese: A: お父さんはお元気じゃないんですか。B: いや、元気じゃないことはないんですが、血圧が少し高いようです。
reading:
A: お父さんはお元気じゃないんですか。
B: いや、元気じゃないことはないんですが、血圧が少し高いようです。
english:
A: Isn't your father in good health? 
B: Yes, he is healthy, but his blood pressure is a bit high.

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese: A：日本語は難しくありませんか。B: いえ、難しくないこともないんですが、日本語の難しさは強調されすぎていると思いますよ。
reading:
A：日本語は難しくありませんか。
B: いえ、難しくないこともないんですが、日本語の難しさは強調されすぎていると思いますよ。
english: A: Isn't Japanese difficult? B: Yes, it is difficult, but it seems that the difficulty of Japanese is overemphasized.

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese: A：山田さんは政治学者じゃないんですね。B: いや、政治学者じゃないこともないんですが、どちらかというと政治家です。
reading:
A：山田さんは政治学者じゃないんですね。
B: いや、政治学者じゃないこともないんですが、どちらかというと政治家です。
english: A: Mr. Yamada isn't a political scientist, is he? B: It's not that he isn't a political scientist, but he is more of a politician.

grammar_point: ないことも / はない
translation: It isn't the case that ~ not ~; it is not that ~ not ~
explanation: A double negative phrase used to make a conditional affirmative statement.
japanese: 日本人は集団行動が好きだとよく言われている。確かに、集団行動をしないことはないのだが、個人行動をとる日本人も結構いる。
reading: 日本人は集団行動が好きだとよく言われている。確かに、集団行動をしないことはないのだが、個人行動をとる日本人も結構いる。
english: Japanese are said to like group behaviour. Certainly, they do behave as a group, but there are quite a few Japanese who behave individually.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: ブラウンさんは日本語がなかなか上手ですね。
reading: ブラウンさんは日本語がなかなか上手ですね。
english: {Mr. Brown is / Mr. Brown, you are} remarkably good at Japanese.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: この生け花はなかなか見事に生けてある。
reading: この生け花はなかなか見事に生けてある。
english: This flower arrangement is done quite nicely.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 今年は桜の花がなかなか咲きません。
reading: 今年は桜の花がなかなか咲きません。
english: It will be a long time before the cherry blossoms are out this year. (literally: This year the cherry blossoms do not bloom easily.)

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: あの男は仕事がなかなか出来るねえ。
reading: あの男は仕事がなかなか出来るねえ。
english: That guy does his job quite well, doesn't he?

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 山田部長の奥さんはなかなか（の）美人だ。
reading: 山田部長の奥さんはなかなか（の）美人だ。
english: The wife of our departmental chief Yamada is quite a beauty.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: この庭園はなかなか綺麗ですね。
reading: この庭園はなかなか綺麗ですね。
english: This garden is quite beautiful, isn't it?

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: この数学の問題はなかなか難しそうだ。
reading: この数学の問題はなかなか難しそうだ。
english: This math problem looks quite difficult, doesn't it?

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 君はなかなかコンピュータに強いそうじゃないか。
reading: 君はなかなかコンピュータに強いそうじゃないか。
english: I heard that you are quite good with computers.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: この大学の学生はなかなかよく出来る。
reading: この大学の学生はなかなかよく出来る。
english: The students at this college are pretty good.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: あのピアニストはモーツァルトをなかなかうまく弾く。
reading: あのピアニストはモーツァルトをなかなかうまく弾く。
english: That pianist plays Mozart quite well.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: テニスは毎日練習しているのに、なかなか上手にならないんです。
reading: テニスは毎日練習しているのに、なかなか上手にならないんです。
english: I am practicing tennis every day, but I cannot become good at it readily.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 約束の時間になっても友達がなかなか来なかったので家に帰ってしまった。
reading: 約束の時間になっても友達がなかなか来なかったので家に帰ってしまった。
english: The meeting time long passed, but my friend didn't show up for a long time, so I went home.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: あの人はどんなに説明しても、僕の言うことがなかなか分からないようだ。
reading: あの人はどんなに説明しても、僕の言うことがなかなか分からないようだ。
english: No matter how hard I try to explain, he doesn't seem to understand me easily.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 風邪がなかなか治らないので、困っているんです。
reading: 風邪がなかなか治らないので、困っているんです。
english: I'm having a difficult time, because my cold won't go away easily.

translation: Quite; fairly; considerably; (not) easily; pretty; (not) readily
explanation: An adverb used to indicate the speaker's feelings that something is impressive or his annoyance at slowness or difficulty in achieving something.
japanese: 河豚は怖くて、なかなか食べられないんだ。
reading: 河豚[ふぐ]は怖くて、なかなか食べられないんだ。
english: I am scared of blowfish (pufferfish) and cannot eat it easily.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 日本語の期末試験はあまり難しくなく、ほっとした。
reading: 日本語の期末試験はあまり難しくなく、ほっとした。
english: The Japanese final examination was not very hard, and I felt relieved.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 私の研究対象は現代史ではなく、古代史だ。
reading: 私の 研究対象[けんきゅうたいしょう]は 現代史[げんだいし]ではなく、 古代史[こだいし]だ。
english: My research area is not modern history, but ancient history.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 今年の冬はあまり寒くなく、オーバーも二、三度しか着なかった。
reading: 今年の冬はあまり寒くなく、オーバーも二、三度しか 着[き]なかった。
english: It wasn't very cold this winter and we wore our overcoats only two or three times.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 昨日見た映画は実に面白くなく、途中で寝てしまった。
reading: 昨日見た映画は実に面白くなく、途中で寝てしまった。
english: The movie I saw yesterday was so boring that I went to sleep during it.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 私には日本語を聞くのが容易ではなく、大分苦労した。
reading: 私には日本語を聞くのが 容易[ようい]ではなく、 大分[だいぶ] 苦労[くろう]した。
english: To listen to Japanese was not easy, and I had quite a difficult time.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 彼女と別れた時はそれほど悲しくなく、自分でも驚いた。
reading: 彼女と別れた時はそれほど悲しくなく、自分でも驚いた。
english: I was surprised that I did not feel so sad when I parted with her.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 私には日本語を教えてくれたのは日本人ではなく、アメリカ人だった
reading: 私には日本語を教えてくれたのは日本人ではなく、アメリカ人だった
english: The person who taught me Japanese was not a Japanese but an American.

translation: Not ~ and; not ~ but
explanation: a continuative form of ない used in written Japanese (to indicate a reason/cause for what follows if ない is attached to Adjective (い/な) and contrast if it is attached to a Noun+Copula).
japanese: 僕が好きなのは日本料理ではなくタイ料理だ。
reading: 僕が好きなのは日本料理ではなくタイ料理だ。
english: What I like is not Japanese cuisine, but Thai cuisine.

translation: I don't know for sure, but
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker's uncertainty about something.
japanese: 何でも山本さんは奥さんと別れて、一人で暮らしているそうですよ。
reading: 何でも山本さんは奥さんと別れて、一人で暮らしているそうですよ。
english: I don't know for sure, but they say that Mr. Yamamoto has separated from his wife and lives alone.

translation: I don't know for sure, but
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker's uncertainty about something.
japanese: 何でもこの辺は物価が非常に高いそうですよ。
reading: 何でもこの辺は物価が非常に高いそうですよ。
english: I don't know for sure, but they say things are expensive in this neighbourhood.

translation: I don't know for sure, but
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker's uncertainty about something.
japanese: 何でもあの人は株で大分もうけたようですよ。
reading: 何でもあの人は株で大分もうけたようですよ。
english: I don't know for sure, but he appeared to have earned a lot of money through stocks.

translation: I don't know for sure, but
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker's uncertainty about something.
japanese: 何でも戸田さんの息子さんはシカゴ大学で経営学修士を取ったらしいですよ。
reading: 何でも戸田さんの息子さんはシカゴ大学で経営学修士を取ったらしいですよ。
english: I don't know for sure, but it seems that Mr. Toda's son received an MBA at the University of Chicago.

translation: I don't know for sure, but
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker's uncertainty about something.
japanese: 何でも日本とアメリカの西海岸を五時間ぐらいで飛ぶ飛行機を開発しているという話ですよ。
reading: 何でも日本とアメリカの西海岸を五時間ぐらいで飛ぶ飛行機を開発しているという話ですよ。
english: I don't know for sure, but there's some talk that they are developing an airplane that flies between Japan and the west coast of the States in about five hours.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: うちの父は頑固なんだ。何しろ一度言い出したら絶対に引き下がらないんだから。
reading: うちの父は頑固なんだ。何しろ一度言い出したら絶対に 引き下[ひきさ]がらないんだから。
english: My father is obstinate. As a matter of fact, once he says he will do something, he never changes his mind.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: Ａ：この大学の教育はいいらしいね。Ｂ：うん、何しろ学生六人に先生一人だからね。
reading:
Ａ：この大学の教育はいいらしいね。
Ｂ：うん、何しろ学生六人に先生一人だからね。
english:
A: I heard that education at this college is good. 
B: Yeah, you may be surprised, but the student-instructor ratio is 6 to 1.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: 一日中ボスにがなり立てられるんで、何しろ、ストレスが多いんだ。
reading: 一日中ボスにがなり立てられるんで、何しろ、ストレスが多いんだ。
english: Because my boss hollers at me all day long, I'm unbelievably stressed.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: あの人は金持ちですよ。何しろベンツを三台も持っているんですからね。
reading: あの人は金持ちですよ。何しろベンツを三台も持っているんですからね。
english: He is rich, you know. Believe it or not, he has three Mercedes Benz.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: 今年の冬は本当に雪が多かったです。何しろ、雪の降らない日の方が少ないくらいでしたからね。
reading: 今年の冬は本当に雪が多かったです。何しろ、雪の降らない日の方が少ないくらいでしたからね。
english: It snowed a lot this winter. In fact, there were less snow-free days than snowy days, you know.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: あの人はよく煙草を吸いますよ。何しろ一日に六十本ぐらい吸うんですから。
reading: あの人はよく煙草を吸いますよ。何しろ一日に六十本ぐらい吸うんですから。
english: He is a heavy smoker. In fact, he smokes about 60 cigarettes a day.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: A: 日本は人が多いねえ。B: うん、何しろ、面積はアメリカの二十五分の一なのに、人口は二分一だからね。
reading:
A: 日本は人が多いねえ。
B: うん、何しろ、 面積[めんせき]はアメリカの二十五分の一なのに、人口は二分の一だからね。
english:
A: Japan is crowded, isn't it? 
B: Yeah, as a matter of fact, the size is one twenty fifth of America but the population is one half, you know.

translation: As a matter of fact; no matter what; believe it or not; you may be surprised, but ~; in fact; unbelievably
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker's emotive feeling about some extreme state of affairs.
japanese: 何しろ、忙しいんだ。寝る時間もないんですよ。
reading: 何しろ、忙しいんだ。寝る時間もないんですよ。
english: I'm unbelievably busy. I don't have any sleeping time, you know.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 病気の母のことが心配でならない。
reading: 病気の母のことが心配でならない。
english: I'm very much worried about my sick mother. (Literally: I cannot help worrying about my sick mother).

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 日本の歴史をもっと深く知りたくてならない。
reading: 日本の歴史をもっと深く知りたくてならない。
english: I'm dying to know Japanese history more deeply.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 一人で住んでいる母親のことが気になってならない。
reading: 一人で住んでいる母親のことが気になってならない。
english: I cannot help worrying about my mother who is living alone.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 夫が単身赴任しているので、寂しくてなりません。
reading: 夫が単身赴任しているので、寂しくてなりません。
english: My husband has gone alone for work and I cannot help feeling lonely.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 二人の婚約が決まって、嬉しくてならないようだ。
reading: 二人の婚約が決まって、嬉しくてならないようだ。
english: The couple have decided to get engaged and they look overjoyed.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 松本清張の推理小説は面白くてならない。
reading: 松本清張[まつもとせいちょう] の推理小説は面白くてならない。
english: The mystery novels by Seicho Matsumoto are irresistibly interesting.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 隣の家のステレオがやかましくてならない。
reading: 隣の家のステレオがやかましくてならない。
english: Our neighbour’s stereo is unbearably noisy.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 山田先生がこの大学をお辞めになるので、残念でならない。
reading: 山田先生がこの大学をお辞めになるので、残念でならない。
english: Since Professor Yamada is going to quit this university, I cannot help feeling disappointed.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 東京の夏は暑くてならない。
reading: 東京の夏は暑くてならない。
english: The summer in Tokyo is awfully hot.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 駅の階段を急いで上がったら、息が苦しくてならなかった。
reading: 駅の階段を急いで上がったら、息が苦しくてならなかった。
english: When I rushed up the stairs at the station, it became unbearably painful to breathe.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 買ってきたばかりのテレビがすぐ壊れてしまい、腹が立ってならなかった。
reading: 買ってきたばかりのテレビがすぐ壊れてしまい、腹が立ってならなかった。
english: I got really mad because the TV set which I just bought got broken right away.

translation: Cannot help -ing; irresistibly; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that is used to express insurmountable psychological or physical feelings.
japanese: 仕事がうまく行っていないので、気が滅入ってならない。
reading: 仕事がうまく行っていないので、気が滅入ってならない。
english: I feel helplessly depressed because my business isn't going well.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 文法が分からなかったら、私なり鈴木先生なりに質問しなさい。
reading: 文法が分からなかったら、私なり鈴木先生なりに質問しなさい。
english: If you don't understand grammar, ask me or Professor Suzuki.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 読めない漢字は辞書を引くなり、日本人に聞くなりしなさい。
reading: 読めない漢字は辞書を引くなり、日本人に聞くなりしなさい。
english: As for kanji you can't read, find out the reading either by looking it up in a dictionary or by asking a Japanese person.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 私なり山田なりが空港に迎えに参ります。
reading: 私なり山田なりが空港に迎えに参ります。
english: Either I or Yamada will go to the airport to pick you up.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 何か連絡することがありましたら電話なりファックスなりでお願いします。
reading: 何か連絡することがありましたら電話なりファックスなりでお願いします。
english: If you have something that you want to report, please do it by telephone or by fax.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 両親なり親友なりに会って、ゆっくり話したいんです。
reading: 両親なり親友なりに会って、ゆっくり話したいんです。
english: I would like to see my parents or a close friend, and talk leisurely.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 今は忙してく旅行が出来ないが、春休みなり夏休みなりにするつもりだ。
reading: 今は忙してく旅行が出来ないが、春休みなり夏休みなりにするつもりだ。
english: Right now I'm so busy that I can't take a trip, but I intend to take one during the spring break or summer vacation.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: テニスがしたかったら、トムなりチャールズなりとしたらいいでしょう。
reading: テニスがしたかったら、トムなりチャールズなりとしたらいいでしょう。
english: If you want to play tennis, why don't you play with Tom or Charles?

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: アパートを探しているんなら、不動産屋に行くなり、新聞の広告を見るなりしたらどうですか。
reading: アパートを探しているんなら、不動産屋に行くなり、新聞の 広告[こうこく]を見るなりしたらどうですか。
english: If you are looking for an apartment, you should go to a realtor or look at the newspaper ads.

translation: ~ or ~ (for example); like ~ or ~
explanation: A phrase to indicate two representative choices/examples.
japanese: 散歩するなり、泳ぐなり、何か運動をした方がいいですよ。
reading: 散歩するなり、泳ぐなり、何か運動をした方がいいですよ。
english: You'd better do some exercise, like taking a walk or swimming.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: あの人はあの人なりによく考えているらしい。
reading: あの人はあの人なりによく考えているらしい。
english: He appears to think hard in his own way.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 動物は動物なりのコミュニケーションが出来る。
reading: 動物は動物なりのコミュニケーションが出来る。
english: Animals are capable of their own communication.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 小さい大学は小さい大学なりによさがある。
reading: 小さい大学は小さい大学なりによさがある。
english: Small colleges have their own merits.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 私は私なりに、人生観を持っています。
reading: 私は私なりに、 人生観[じんせいかん]を持っています。
english: I have my own outlook on life.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 自転車は自転車なりに、車は車なりに、長所、短所がある。
reading: 自転車は自転車なりに、車は車なりに、 長所[ちょうしょ]、 短所[たんしょ]がある。
english: A bike and a car have their own merits and demerits.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 健康な人は健康な人なりに、体に気をつけた方がいい。
reading: 健康な人は健康な人なりに、体に気をつけた方がいい。
english: Healthy people had better take care of themselves in their own way.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 私は老人が老人なりに生活を楽しめる社会が好きだ。
reading: 私は老人が老人なりに生活を楽しめる社会が好きだ。
english: I like a society in which old people can enjoy life in their own way.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 私は私なりに一生懸命働くつもりです。
reading: 私は私なりに一生懸命働くつもりです。
english: I intend to work very hard in my own way.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: この問題について、父は父なりの考えを持っているようです。
reading: この問題について、父は父なりの考えを持っているようです。
english: My father seems to have his own idea about this issue.

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: ジャズ音楽はジャズ音楽なりの魅力がある。
reading: ジャズ音楽はジャズ音楽なりの魅力がある。
english: Jazz music has its own charm

translation: In one's own way; in one's own style
explanation: In a way/style that is proper to someone/something.
japanese: 金持ちは金持ちなりの悩みがあるのだ。
reading: 金持ちは金持ちなりの悩みがあるのだ。
english: Rich people have their own suffering.

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: あなたなしでは生きていけない。
reading: あなたなしでは生きていけない。
english: Without you I cannot keep on living.

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: お金なしではいい教育は受けられない。
reading: お金なしではいい教育は受けられない。
english: Without money we cannot receive good education.

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: 暇なしでは人生はつまらなくなってしまう。
reading: 暇なしでは人生はつまらなくなってしまう。
english: Without leisure time life will become dull.
extra_notes: 暇 can be a noun and mean "spare time; free time; leisure​."

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: 仕事なしでは生活が出来ない。
reading: 仕事なしでは生活が出来ない。
english: Without a job one cannot live a life.

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: 基礎研究なしでは科学は発展しない。
reading: 基礎研究[きそけんきゅう]なしでは科学は 発展[はってん]しない。
english: Without basic research science would not develop.

translation: Without
explanation: If something/someone is missing.
japanese: 車なしではちょっと不便だ。
reading: 車なしではちょっと不便だ。
english: Without a car it is a bit inconvenient.

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 日本を知るためには一度は日本へ行かねばならない。
reading: 日本を知るためには一度は日本へ行かねばならない。
english: In order to know Japan one has to go to Japan at least once.

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 日本は市場をもっと広く開放せねばならない。
reading: 日本は市場をもっと広く開放せねばならない。
english: Japan has to open its market wider.

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 今後も同じ研究を続けねばならない。
reading: 今後も同じ研究を続けねばならない。
english: I have to continue the same research from now on.

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 人種偏見をなくさねばならない。
reading: 人種偏見をなくさねばならない。
english: We should get rid of racial prejudice.
extra_notes: なくす in this case means to "get rid of; to eliminate; to remove​"

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 会議の内容を帰国後本社に報告せねばならなかった。
reading: 会議の内容を帰国後本社に報告せねばならなかった。
english: I had to report the agenda of the conference to the main office after returning to my country.

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 自然保護を叫ばねばならない。
reading: 自然保護を叫ばねばならない。
english: We have to voice preservation of nature.
extra_notes: 叫ぶ here means "to clamor (for or against)"

translation: Must; have to; should
explanation: A phrase that indicates duty, obligation or necessity.
japanese: 日本はこれから世界をリードせねばなりません。
reading: 日本はこれから世界をリードせねばなりません。
english: From now on Japan has to lead the world.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 昨日来れば夏子に会えたでしょう・だろうに。
reading: 昨日来れば夏子に会えたでしょう・だろうに。
english: If you had come here yesterday, you could have met Natsuko.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 老人が一人で暮らすのはさぞ寂しいでしょう・だろうに。
reading: 老人が一人で暮らすのはさぞ寂しいでしょう・だろうに。
english: It must be lonely for an old man to live alone.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 後一年ぐらい日本にいたら日本語がもっと上手になるでしょうに。
reading: 後一年ぐらい日本にいたら日本語がもっと上手になるでしょうに。
english: If you could stay in Japan another year or so your Japanese would become more proficient.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: お金が沢山あればこんな家でも買えるでしょうに。
reading: お金が沢山あればこんな家でも買えるでしょうに。
english: If we had a lot of money, we would be able to buy this sort of house.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 僕にいい仕事があったら美智子さんと結婚出来ただろうに。
reading: 僕にいい仕事があったら美智子さんと結婚出来ただろうに。
english: If I had had a good job I could have married Michiko.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 飛行機で行けば簡単に行ける所でしょうに。
reading: 飛行機で行けば簡単に行ける所でしょうに。
english: If you go by plane, you could easily get there.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 彼はもう少し慎重に金を使えば、貯金出来るだろうに。
reading: 彼はもう少し慎重に金を使えば、貯金出来るだろうに。
english: If he uses his money a little more carefully, he could save his money.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 駅の近くのアパートに住んだら便利でしょうに。
reading: 駅の近くのアパートに住んだら便利でしょうに。
english: If you lived in an apartment near the station, it would be convenient.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 子供を二人も大学に行かせるのにはお金がかかるでしょうに。
reading: 子供を二人も大学に行かせるのにはお金がかかるでしょうに。
english: It must cost a lot of money to send two children to college.

explanation: A sentence final particle that expresses the speaker's feeling of great regret or sympathy.
japanese: 飛行機の切符をなくして、さぞ困ったことでしょうに。
reading: 飛行機の切符をなくして、さぞ困ったことでしょうに。
english: You must have had a difficult time when you lost your airplane ticket.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 新入社員の入社に{当たって/当たり}社長はホテルでパーティーを開いた。
reading: 新入社員の入社に{当たって/当たり}社長はホテルでパーティーを開いた。
english: On the occasion of new employees' entering the company, the president threw a party at a hotel.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 和也は大学を卒業するに{当たって/当たり}、指導教官に今後の進路について相談した。
reading: 和也は大学を卒業するに{当たって/当たり}、指導教官に今後の進路について相談した。
english: On the occasion of graduating from college, Kazuya consulted with his academic adviser on his future direction.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 私の留学に当たり、父は自分の経験を話してくれた。
reading: 私の留学に当たり、父は自分の経験を話してくれた。
english: On the occasion of my study abroad, my father told me about his own experience.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 日本の経済を研究するに当たって、国会図書館で資料集めをした。
reading: 日本の経済を研究するに当たって、国会図書館で資料集めをした。
english: Before I did research on the Japanese economy, I collected materials at the National Diet Library.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 総理はサミット出席に当たり、閣僚と会議をした。
reading: 総理はサミット出席に当たり、閣僚と会議をした。
english: The Prime minister had a conference with cabinet members before attending the summit.

translation: On the occasion of; at; in; before; prior to
explanation: A compound particle that indicates occasion of doing something or of having done something in formal Japanese.
japanese: 小説家は時代小説を書くに当たり、その時代の歴史を詳しく調べた。
reading: 小説家は時代小説を書くに当たり、その時代の歴史を詳しく調べた。
english: Before writing a historical novel, the novelist did an in-depth survey of the history of the period he dealt with.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 今年の東京国際マラソンは大方の予想に反して無名の選手が優勝した。
reading: 今年の東京 国際[こくさい]マラソンは大方の予想に反して無名の選手が 優勝[ゆうしょう]した。
english: Contrary to the majority's expectations, an unknown runner won the Tokyo International Marathon this year.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 我が社はテレビの売れ行きが伸びているのに反してオーディオ製品の売れ行きが下がっている。
reading: 我が社はテレビの 売[う]れ 行[ゆ]きが伸びているのに反してオーディオ製品の売れ行きが下がっている。
english: In our company, in contrast to the increase in sales of TV sets, the sales in audio products are decreasing.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: Ｓ１：日本ではいい大学に入るのは難しいが卒業するのは易しいと言われている。Ｓ２：これに反して、アメリカではいい大学でも入学が比較的易しいが卒業するには相当勉強しなければならない。
reading: 日本ではいい大学に入るのは難しいが卒業するのは易しいと言われている。これに反して、アメリカではいい大学でも入学が 比較的[ひかくてき]易しいが卒業するには 相当[そうとう]勉強しなければならない。
english: It is said that to enter good universities in Japan is difficult but to graduate from them is easy. In contrast to this, in America even good universities are relatively easy to enter, but students must study quite hard to graduate from them.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 妙子は意に反する結婚を押しつけられた。
reading: 妙子[たえこ]は 意[い]に反する結婚を 押[お]しつけられた。
english: Taeko was forced to marry. (literally: A marriage which was against Taeko's will was forced upon her.)

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 浩は両親の期待に反して高校を出てからコックになった。
reading: 浩は両親の期待に反して高校を出てからコックになった。
english: Contrary to his parents' wishes, Hiroshi became a chef after finishing high school.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 彼は自分の意思に反して賄賂を受け取ってしまった。
reading: 彼は自分の意思に反して 賄賂[わいろ]を受け取ってしまった。
english: He was forced to accept a bribe. (literally: He received a bribe against his will.)

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: この規則に反して従業員を働かせた場合は一か月の営業停止になる。
reading: この規則に反して従業員を 働[はたら]かせた場合は一か月の 営業停止[えいぎょうていし]になる。
english: Your business will be suspended for one month if you work your employees in violation of these rules.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 奥村さんのうちはご主人が無口なのに反して奥さんが人一倍のおしゃべりだ。
reading: 奥村[おくむら]さんのうちはご主人が無口なのに反して奥さんが 人一倍[ひといちばい]のおしゃべりだ。
english: In Okumura's family, whereas the husband is quiet, the wife is very talkative.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 日本での初等教育は生徒に知識を与えることに主眼が置かれている。これに反して、アメリカでは生徒の創造性や個性を伸ばすことに重点が置かれている。
reading: 日本での 初等教育[しょとうきょういく]は 生徒[せいと]に知識を 与[あた]えることに 主眼[しゅがん]が 置[お]かれている。これに反して、アメリカでは 生徒[せいと]の 創造性[そうぞうせい]や 個性[こせい]を伸ばすことに 重点[じゅうてん]が置かれている。
english: The chief aim of elementary education in Japan is to provide students with knowledge. In America, in contrast (to this), emphasis is put on increasing students' creativity and individual talents.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 今回の選挙は一般の予想に反する結果に終わった。
reading: 今回の 選挙[せんきょ]は一般の予想に反する結果に終わった。
english: The election this time ended up with results which were against the general prediction.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: あの人の言葉は美辞麗句にほかならない。
reading: あの人の言葉は美辞麗句にほかならない。
english: His words are nothing but flowery words.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 日本語を勉強しているのは将来日本で仕事をしたいからにほかならない。
reading: 日本語を勉強しているのは将来日本で仕事をしたいからにほかならない。
english: The reason that I am studying Japanese is simply because I want to work in Japan in the future.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 外国語学習はほかの国の人の考え方を学ぶことにほならない。
reading: 外国語学習はほかの国の人の考え方を学ぶことにほならない。
english: Foreign language learning is nothing but learning about the ways people in other countries think.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: モーツァルトの音楽は天使の声にほかならない。
reading: モーツァルトの音楽は天使の声にほかならない。
english: Mozart's music is nothing but an angel's voice.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 結婚は人生の墓場にほかならない。
reading: 結婚は人生の墓場にほかならない。
english: Marriage is nothing but a graveyard of life.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 彼の言動は自己宣伝にほかならない。
reading: 彼の言動は自己宣伝にほかならない。
english: His speech and behaviour are nothing but self-advertisement.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 親が子供を厳しくしつけるのは子供を愛しているからにほかならない。
reading: 親が子供を厳しくしつけるのは子供を愛しているからにほかならない。
english: The reason why parents discipline their children strictly is simply because they love their children.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 彼女が僕に寄って来るのは僕を利用したいからにほかならない。
reading: 彼女が僕に寄って来るのは僕を利用したいからにほかならない。
english: The reason why she comes close to me is simply because she wants to use me.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 私の日本語がこれほど上達したのは大学の時の日本語の先生のおかげにほかならない。
reading: 私の日本語がこれほど上達したのは大学の時の日本語の先生のおかげにほかならない。
english: The reason why my Japanese made such progress is simply because of my college Japanese instructor.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: この大学の学生の質がいいのは選抜が厳しいからにほかならない。
reading: この大学の学生の質がいいのは選抜が厳しいからにほかならない。
english: The reason why the student quality of this college is so good is simply because the selection is tough.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 核兵器の使用は人類の破滅を招くことにほかならない。
reading: 核兵器の使用は人類の破滅を招くことにほかならない。
english: The use of nuclear weapons invites nothing but the annihilation of humanity.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: ほかならない君のためだから、やってあげよう。
reading: ほかならない君のためだから、やってあげよう。
english: It's for you of all people, so I'll do it.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 見合い結婚は日本に限らずほかの国でも行われている。
reading: 見合い結婚は日本に限らずほかの国でも行われている。
english: Arranged marriage is not limited to Japan; it is practiced in other countries, too.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 音楽はクラシックに限らず何でも聞きます。
reading: 音楽はクラシックに限らず何でも聞きます。
english: Talking about music, I listen to any music, not just classical music.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: このバーは男性だけに限らず女性の間にも人気がある。
reading: このバーは男性だけに限らず女性の間にも人気がある。
english: This bar is popular not only among men but also among women.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 果物は何に限らず好きです。
reading: 果物は何に限らず好きです。
english: I like any kind of fruit.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 何事に限らず仕事は誠意をもって行うことが大切だ。
reading: 何事に限らず仕事は誠意をもって行うことが大切だ。
english: Whatever you do, it is important to do it with sincerity.
extra_notes: 何＊に限らず usually has some type of "whatever/whichever/no matter" definition, though it doesn't seem to be an official phrase

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: うちの子供に限ってそんなひどいことはしませんよ。
reading: うちの子供に限ってそんなひどいことはしませんよ。
english: Our child, of all children, would not do such a terrible thing.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 中野先生はたいてい研究室にいらっしゃるのに、今日に限っていらっしゃらなかった。
reading: 中野先生はたいてい研究室にいらっしゃるのに、今日に限っていらっしゃらなかった。
english: Professor Nakano is usually in his office, but today, of all days, he wasn't there.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 傘を持って来ない日に限って雨が降るんですよ。
reading: 傘を持って来ない日に限って雨が降るんですよ。
english: Only on the day when I don't bring my umbrella, it rains, you know.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 急ぐ時に限って、バスがなかなか来ない。
reading: 急ぐ時に限って、バスがなかなか来ない。
english: Of all times, when I am in a hurry, the bus doesn't come for ages.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 嫌なことがある時に限って、嫌なことが重なる。
reading: 嫌なことがある時に限って、嫌なことが重なる。
english: Only when something unpleasant happens, do other unpleasant things occur.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: この小説家の書いたものに限って、つまらないものはない。
reading: この小説家の書いたものに限って、つまらないものはない。
english: Of all the works written by this novelist, none of them are boring.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 消費税に関して与野党の意見が対立した。
reading: 消費税に関して 与野党[よやとう]の意見が対立した。
english: With regard to the sales tax, the opinions of the leading party and the opposition parties conflicted.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 人間の言語習得に関してはまだまだ不明のことが多い。
reading: 人間の言語習得に関してはまだまだ不明のことが多い。
english: Concerning human language acquisition, there are still many unknown things.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 先週、東京で超伝導に関する学会が開かれた。
reading: 先週、東京で超<ruby title="伝導(でんどう)"><rb>伝導</rb><rt>でんどう</rt></ruby>に関する学会が開かれた。
english: Last week a conference on superconductivity was held in Tokyo.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: その学会で吉岡氏の発表に関して多くの批判がなされた。
reading: その学会で吉岡氏の発表に関して多くの批判がなされた。
english: There was a lot of criticism concerning Mr. Yoshioka's presentation at the conference.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: その件に関しましては、まだ発表できる段階ではありません。
reading: その件に関しましては、まだ発表できる<ruby title="段階(だんかい)"><rb>段階</rb><rt>だんかい</rt></ruby>ではありません。
english: With regard to that issue, we are not yet at the stage where we can announce anything.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 最近老人問題に関する記事が目に付く。
reading: 最近老人問題に関する記事が目に付く。
english: We see many articles about problems of the elderly these days.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 大気汚染に関する報告書が委員会に提出された。
reading: 大気汚染に関する報告書が委員会に提出された。
english: A report concerning air pollution was submitted to the committee.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 病気の山田先生に代わって、鈴木先生が教えて下さった。
reading: 病気の山田先生に代わって、鈴木先生が教えて下さった。
english: In place of Professor Yamada, who is ill, Professor Suzuki taught us.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 戦後ガラスに代わってプラスチックが出てきた。
reading: 戦後ガラスに代わってプラスチックが出てきた。
english: After the war plastics became available replacing glass.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: レコードに代わってCDが出て、音質がとてもよくなった。
reading: レコードに代わってCDが出て、音質がとてもよくなった。
english: In place of records, CDs have become available, and the sound quality has improved a great deal.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 私が父に代わって、空港までお客さんを迎えに行った。
reading: 私が父に代わって、空港までお客さんを迎えに行った。
english: In place of my father, I went to the airport to pick up our guest.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 御出席の皆様に代わりまして、一言ご挨拶を述べさせていただきます。
reading: 御出席の皆様に代わりまして、一言ご挨拶を述べさせていただきます。
english: On behalf of everyone present here, let me say a word of greeting.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 申し訳ございませんが、社長は今日都合が悪いので、私が社長に代わって参りました。
reading: 申し訳ございませんが、社長は今日都合が悪いので、私が社長に代わって参りました。
english: I am very sorry that the president was unable to attend, but I have come in his place.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 欧米に比べて日本の住宅事情は極めて貧困だ。
reading: 欧米に比べて日本の住宅事情は極めて貧困だ。
english: Compared to (the situations) in Europe and the U.S., the housing situation in Japan is extremely poor.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 日本に来る前に比べると今は大分日本語でものが言えるようになった。
reading: 日本に来る前に比べると今は大分日本語でものが言えるようになった。
english: I have become able to say things in Japanese fairly well compared to my level before I came to Japan.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 今年は去年に比べて雨の日が多いようだ。
reading: 今年は去年に比べて雨の日が多いようだ。
english: In comparison to last year, we seem to have more rainy days this year.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 十年前の暮らしに比べると今の暮らしは天国です。
reading: 十年前の暮らしに比べると今の暮らしは天国です。
english: Compared with our life ten years ago, our present life is heaven.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: この新しい（コンピュータ）モデルは、古いモデルと比べて演算が三倍速くなっている。
reading: この新しい（コンピュータ）モデルは、古いモデルと比べて演算が三倍速くなっている。
english: When compared with the older (computer) model, the operation speed of this new model is three times as fast.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 懸命な努力にもかかわらず、健一は大学入試に失敗した。
reading: 懸命[けんめい]な 努力[どりょく]にもかかわらず、健一は大学入試に失敗した。
english: In spite of his strenuous efforts, Ken'ichi failed the college entrance examination.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: あの人はよく運動をする（の）にもかかわらず、太っている。
reading: あの人はよく運動をする（の）にもかかわらず、太っている。
english: He is fat, although he exercises a lot.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 試験が難しかった（の）にもかかわらず、よく出来た。
reading: 試験が難しかった（の）にもかかわらず、よく出来た。
english: Although the exam was hard, I did well.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 冬山は危険なのである（の）にもかかわらず、一郎は山へ出かけた。
reading: 冬山[ふゆやま]は危険なのである（の）にもかかわらず、一郎は山へ出かけた。
english: Although winter mountains are dangerous, Ichiro left for the mountain.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 激しい雨（だった）にもかかわらず、サッカーの試合は続いた。
reading: 激しい雨（だった）にもかかわらず、サッカーの試合は続いた。
english: In spite of the fierce rain, the soccer game continued.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 安い値段（なの・である）にもかかわらず、その家はまだ売れていない。
reading: 安い 値段[ねだん]（なの・である）にもかかわらず、その家はまだ売れていない。
english: Despite the inexpensive price, that house is not sold yet.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 宏は美香を愛していた（の）にもかかわらず、結婚しなかった。
reading: 宏[ひろし]は 美香[みか]を愛していた（の）にもかかわらず、結婚しなかった。
english: In spite of the fact that Hiroshi loved Mika, he didn't marry her.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 昨日は徹夜して勉強した（の）にもかかわらず、試験は出来なかった。
reading: 昨日は 徹夜[てつや]して勉強した（の）にもかかわらず、試験は出来なかった。
english: Although I studied all night last night, I didn't do well on the exam.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: キャロルは日本に三年も住んでいた（の）にもかかわらず、日本語は大変下手だ。
reading: キャロルは日本に三年も住んでいた（の）にもかかわらず、日本語は大変下手だ。
english: Although Carol lived in Japan for three years, her Japanese is very poor.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 日本語経済力は強くなっている（の）にもかかわらず、日本人はそれを実感出来ない。
reading: 日本経済力は強くなっている（の）にもかかわらず、日本人はそれを 実感[じっかん]出来ない。
english: In spite of the fact that the Japanese economy has become strong, the Japanese people cannot feel the effects.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 私のアパートは広い（の）にもかかわらず、家賃が安い。
reading: 私のアパートは広い（の）にもかかわらず、家賃が安い。
english: My apartment is spacious, but the rent is cheap.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 旅行が好き（なの・である（の））にもかかわらず、どこに行く暇もない。
reading: 旅行が好き（なの・である（の））にもかかわらず、どこに行く 暇[ひま]もない。
english: I like to travel, but I don't have time to go anywhere.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: 事実に基づいてお話しします。
reading: 事実に基づいてお話しします。
english: I will give you the facts. (literally: I will talk on the basis of facts.)

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: これは五百年前の史料に基づく研究だ。
reading: これは五百年前の史料に基づく研究だ。
english: This is a study based on historical documents from 500 years ago.

translation: Based upon
