explanation: Each of two or more things/persons.
japanese: このキャンパスの建物はそれぞれ個性がある。
reading: このキャンパスの建物はそれぞれ個性がある。
english: Each of the buildings of this campus has its own individuality.

translation: Each; respectively
explanation: Each of two or more things/persons.
japanese: レストランではそれぞれ好きな物を食べました。
reading: レストランではそれぞれ好きな物を食べました。
english: At the restaurant we ate what each of us like.

translation: Each; respectively
explanation: Each of two or more things/persons.
japanese: 裁判官はそれぞれの席に着いた。
reading: 裁判官はそれぞれの席に着いた。
english: The judges took their respective seats.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 家に帰ったらすぐ、寝てしまいました。
reading: 家に帰ったらすぐ、寝てしまいました。
english: I went to sleep as soon as I got home.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 銀行は駅のすぐ前です。
reading: 銀行は駅のすぐ前です。
english: The bank is right in front of the station.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 部長は会社に着くとすぐ、仕事を始めた。
reading: 部長は会社に着くとすぐ、仕事を始めた。
english: The departmental head started to work as soon as he arrived at the company.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 日本に来たらすぐ、電話して下さい。
reading: 日本に来たらすぐ、電話して下さい。
english: Please call me as soon as you come to Japan.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 話したいから、すぐ来て下さい。
reading: 話したいから、すぐ来て下さい。
english: I want to talk with you, so please come right away.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 安いテレビを買ったらすぐ、壊れてしまいました。
reading: 安いテレビを買ったらすぐ、壊れてしまいました。
english: I bought a cheap TV and it broke right away.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: あの人はすぐ怒るから、嫌いだ。
reading: あの人はすぐ怒るから、嫌いだ。
english: He easily gets angry so I don't like him.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: その数学の問題はすぐ解けた。
reading: その数学の問題はすぐ解けた。
english: I could solve that math problem easily.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 私の家はすぐそこです。
reading: 私の家はすぐそこです。
english: My house is right there.

translation: At once; soon; right away; immediately; readily; instantly; easily; right
explanation: Without having much temporal or physical distance.
japanese: 郵便局はスーパーのすぐ隣です。
reading: 郵便局はスーパーのすぐ隣です。
english: The post-office is right next to the supermarket.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: 日本へ行くたびに新しいことを学んで帰ります。
reading: 日本へ行くたびに新しいことを学んで帰ります。
english: Each time I go to Japan I come home having learned something new.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: 父は旅行のたびにお土産を買ってきてくれる。
reading: 父は旅行のたびにお土産を買ってきてくれる。
english: On every trip my father comes back with souvenirs.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: あの人と話すたびに心が和みます。
reading: あの人と話すたびに心が和みます。
english: Each time I talk with her my heart softens.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: この本は読むたびに新しい発見がある。
reading: この本は読むたびに新しい発見がある。
english: Each time I read this book I make new findings.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: 僕は東京に行くたびに恩師のお宅を訪ねることにしている。
reading: 僕は東京に行くたびに恩師のお宅を訪ねることにしている。
english: I make it a point of visiting my professor's residence every time I go to Tokyo.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: 私の孫は会うたびに前より大きくなっている。
reading: 私の孫は会うたびに前より大きくなっている。
english: My grandson is growing bigger than before each time I see him.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: モーツアルトの音楽を聞くたびに人生が豊かになった気がする。
reading: モーツアルトの音楽を聞くたびに人生が豊かになった気がする。
english: Each time I listen to Mozart's music I feel my life is enriched.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: 誕生日のたびに夫は薔薇の花を買ってくれます。
reading: 誕生日のたびに夫は薔薇の花を買ってくれます。
english: On every birthday my husband buys me roses.

translation: Every time; each time; on every occasion; whenever
explanation: A conjunction to express that each time someone/something does something, something else takes place.
japanese: うちでは給料日のたびに銀座のレストランで食事をします。
reading: うちでは給料日のたびに銀座のレストランで食事をします。
english: Our family eats at a restaurant in Ginza every payday.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 彼のただ一つの欠点は時間にルーズだということだ。
reading: 彼のただ一つの 欠点[けってん]は時間にルーズだということだ。
english: His only (one) defect is that he is not punctual (literally: he is slack about time).

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 彼女はただの一度も手紙をくれなかった。
reading: 彼女はただの一度も手紙をくれなかった。
english: She didn't write me even once.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 彼はただ弁護士だけが頼りだ。
reading: 彼はただ弁護士だけが頼りだ。
english: He has no one else to rely on but his lawyer.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 彼女とはただお茶を飲んで話をした（という）だけだ。
reading: 彼女とはただお茶を飲んで話をした（という）だけだ。
english: I just talked with her over a cup of tea; that's all.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 彼はただ一人でやってきた。
reading: 彼はただ一人でやってきた。
english: He came over alone.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 私達が困っていた時、助けてくれた者はただの一人もいなかった。
reading: 私達が困っていた時、助けてくれた者はただの一人もいなかった。
english: Not a single person helped us when we were in trouble.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: ただそれだけのことで彼を首にしたんでか。
reading: ただそれだけのことで彼を首にしたんですか。
english: Did you fire him only for that reason?

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: ただ言われたことだけをやっていても進歩はない。
reading: ただ言われたことだけをやっていても進歩はない。
english: There will be no progress if you do only what you are told to do.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 私はただ頼まれたことをしているだけだ。
reading: 私はただ頼まれたことをしているだけだ。
english: I am just doing what I was asked to do; that's all.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: あの男はただ真面目だというだけだ。
reading: あの男はただ真面目だというだけだ。
english: He is just serious; he has no other merit.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: 別に大した意味はないんですが、ただちょっと聞いてみたかったんです。
reading: 別に大した意味はないんですが、ただちょっと聞いてみたかったんです。
english: It doesn't have any special meaning, but I just wanted to ask.

translation: Only; just; simply; that's all
explanation: An adverb which emphasizes the idea of "only".
japanese: ただ人の言うことを鵜呑みにしていては面白い発想は生まれない。
reading: ただ人の言うことを鵜呑みにしていては面白い発想は生まれない。
english: If you simply swallow what other people say, you won't come up with any interesting ideas.

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: 私はただの平社員ですから、そんなことは知りません。
reading: 私はただの 平社員[ひらしゃいん]ですから、そんなことは知りません。
english: I'm only an ordinary employee, so I'm not aware of that.

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: ただの風邪だと思っていたら、肺炎だった。
reading: ただの風邪だと思っていたら、 肺炎[はいえん]だった。
english: I thought it was an ordinary cold, but it was pneumonia.

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: あの人はただの学者ではないようですね。
reading: あの人はただの学者ではないようですね。
english: He doesn't appear to be an ordinary scholar, does he?

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: ただの集まりだと思って、顔を出したら、偉い人達が出席していたのでびっくりした。
reading: ただの集まりだと思って、顔を出したら、 偉[えら]い人達が 出席[しゅっせき]していたのでびっくりした。
english: I made an appearance because I thought it was an ordinary gathering, but to my surprise there were big shots attending.

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: A: お父様はお偉い方だったそうですね。B: いいえ、とんでもありません。ただの大学教師でした。
reading:
A: お父様はお偉い方だったそうですね。
B: いいえ、とんでもありません。ただの大学教師でした。
english:
A: I heard that your father was a great man. 
B: No, not at all. He was an ordinary college professor.

translation: Usual; ordinary; plain; common; rank and file
explanation: Not deserving to be mentioned.
japanese: ただの冗談ですよ。
reading: ただの冗談ですよ。
english: It was just a joke, you know.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: この車は確かに魅力的だが、値段が高すぎる。
reading: この車は確かに魅力的だが、値段が高すぎる。
english: This car is certainly attractive, but the price is too high.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: そのパーティーのことは確かに聞いたが、いつだったか思い出せない。
reading: そのパーティーのことは確かに聞いたが、いつだったか思い出せない。
english: I certainly heard about the party, but I don't remember when it is going to be.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: 確かに約束はしたが、今すぐとは言わなかった。
reading: 確かに約束はしたが、今すぐとは言わなかった。
english: It's true that I promised (to do it), but I didn't say that I would do it right now.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: 彼は確かに第一印象がよくないが、本当はいい男なんだよ。
reading: 彼は確かに第一印象がよくないが、本当はいい男なんだよ。
english: He definitely makes a bad first impression, but actually he is a nice man.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: この学校は確かにいい学校だが、僕には向いていない。
reading: この学校は確かにいい学校だが、僕には向いていない。
english: I admit that this is a good school, but it's not suitable for me.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: 確かに僕が悪かったが、そんなに怒ることはないだろう。
reading: 確かに僕が悪かったが、そんなに怒ることはないだろう。
english: I admit that it was my fault, but there's (probably) no need for you to be so mad.

translation: Indeed ~ but; certainly ~ but; truly ~ but; it is true that ~ but; I admit that ~ but; definitely ~ but
explanation: A structure which expresses the idea "indeed ~ but".
japanese: 確かに多くの日本人が海外へ出かけるようになった。海外国語を上手に話す人も沢山いる。しかし、本当の国際人と呼べる人はまだ少ない。
reading: 確かに多くの日本人が海外へ出かけるようになった。海外国語を上手に話す人も沢山いる。しかし、本当の国際人と呼べる人はまだ少ない。
english: It is true that many Japanese go abroad now. There are also many who speak other languages (literally: foreign languages) well. However, there are still few who can be called "true internationalists."

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: どんなに低く見積もったところで、工費は五億円を超えるだろう。
reading: どんなに低く見積もったところで、工費は五億円を超えるだろう。
english: No matter how low we estimate the construction expense it will go beyond 500 million yen.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: この薬を飲んだところで、風邪がすぐ治るわけじゃない。
reading: この薬を飲んだところで、風邪がすぐ治るわけじゃない。
english: Even if you took this medicine, it would not be the case that your cold would be cured right away.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: この本を読んだところで、日本の経済の全体は分からないだろう。
reading: この本を読んだところで、日本の経済の全体は分からないだろう。
english: Even if you read this book, you wouldn't understand the entire economy of Japan.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: 一週間に一度ぐらい運動したところで、あまり効果はないでしょう。
reading: 一週間に一度ぐらい運動したところで、あまり効果はないでしょう。
english: Even if you exercise once a week, it won't be very effective.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: どんなに頑張ったところで、この科目では優が取れるはずがない。
reading: どんなに頑張ったところで、この科目では優が取れるはずがない。
english: No matter how much I worked, it would be impossible to get an A in this course.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: 休みに天気が良くなったところで、どこかへ出かける当てもない。
reading: 休みに天気が良くなったところで、どこかへ出かける当てもない。
english: Even if the weather gets better on the holiday, there is no particular place to go.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: 日本語が話せたところで、日本へ行く金もないので、何にもならない。
reading: 日本語が話せたところで、日本へ行く金もないので、何にもならない。
english: Even if I were able to speak Japanese, it wouldn't amount to anything, because I cannot afford to go to Japan.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: これ以上話し合ったところで、恐らく無駄でしょう。
reading: これ以上話し合ったところで、恐らく無駄でしょう。
english: Even if we discussed it more, it would probably be futile.

translation: Even if
explanation: Even if an action or a state were realised.
japanese: 問題が起こったところで、君には迷惑はかからない。
reading: 問題が起こったところで、君には迷惑はかからない。
english: Even if a problem arises, it will not cause you any trouble.

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: こちらにいらっしゃってもう何年になりますか。
reading: こちらにいらっしゃってもう何年になりますか。
english: How long have you been here / how many years has it been since you came here?

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: 二人は結婚して二年後に離婚した。
reading: 二人は結婚して二年後に離婚した。
english: The couple got married and two years later they got divorced.

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: 会社を辞めてもう久しい。
reading: 会社を辞めてもう久しい。
english: It has been a long time since I quit the company.

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: この島を訪れてもう何年になるだろうか。
reading: この島を訪れてもう何年になるだろうか。
english: I wonder how many years have already passed since I last visited this island.

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: この会社で働き始めてこれで四年になります。
reading: この会社で働き始めてこれで四年になります。
english: It's been four years since I began to work at this company.

translation: And; since; having done something
explanation: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
japanese: この町に来てまだ一週間目です。
reading: この町に来てまだ一週間目です。
english: It's my first week in this town.

translation: Not until; only after; for the first time
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone does something or something happens only after something else happens or something else is done.
japanese: アメリカへ来て初めて竜巻を見た。
reading: アメリカへ来て初めて竜巻を見た。
english: It was not until I came to America that I saw a tornado.

translation: Not until; only after; for the first time
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone does something or something happens only after something else happens or something else is done.
japanese: 日本で生活して初めて日本人のものの考え方が分かってきた。
reading: 日本で生活して初めて日本人のものの考え方が分かってきた。
english: It was not until I lived in Japan that I started to understand how Japanese people think.

translation: Not until; only after; for the first time
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone does something or something happens only after something else happens or something else is done.
japanese: 日本語を勉強して初めて外国語を学ぶ面白さを知った。
reading: 日本語を勉強して初めて外国語を学ぶ面白さを知った。
english: I didn't realise how interesting learning a foreign language was until I studied Japanese.

translation: Not until; only after; for the first time
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone does something or something happens only after something else happens or something else is done.
japanese: 病気になって初めて健康の有り難さが分かる。
reading: 病気になって初めて健康の有り難さが分かる。
english: It is only after you become ill that you realise the value of health.

translation: Not until; only after; for the first time
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone does something or something happens only after something else happens or something else is done.
japanese: 生まれて初めて刺身を食べた。
reading: 生まれて初めて刺身を食べた。
english: I ate sashimi for the first time in my life.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 彼はそういう点でまだ大人とは言えない。
reading: 彼はそういう点でまだ大人とは言えない。
english: He is not (literally: cannot be called) an adult in that respect.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 使いやすさの点ではこの辞書はネルソンの漢英辞典に及ばない。
reading: 使いやすさの点ではこの辞書はネルソンの漢英辞典に及ばない。
english: This dictionary is no match for Nelson's Japanese-English Character Dictionary in terms of ease of use.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 通勤の便利さという点では今のアパートは最高だ。
reading: 通勤の便利さという点では今のアパートは最高だ。
english: In terms of commuting convenience, the present apartment is the best.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: このテーブルは手作りである（という）点で値打ちがある。
reading: このテーブルは手作りである（という）点で値打ちがある。
english: This table is valuable in that it is handmade.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 我々が社の製品は全ての点で国外の類似製品より優れている。
reading: 我々が社の製品は全ての点で国外の類似製品より優れている。
english: Our product is superior to similar foreign products in every way.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 学力の点ではこの学生が一番だろう。
reading: 学力の点ではこの学生が一番だろう。
english: With regard to scholarship, this student is probably the best.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 住みやすさの点では私はこの町の方が前に住んだ町より気に入っている。
reading: 住みやすさの点では私はこの町の方が前に住んだ町より気に入っている。
english: In terms of liveability I like this city better than the one where I lived before.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 時間の正確さという点では日本の鉄道は世界一でしょう。
reading: 時間の正確さという点では日本の鉄道は世界一でしょう。
english: In terms of punctuality the railway systems in Japan are probably the best in the world.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: イルカは言葉を話すという点で他の多くの水生動物より高等であると言える。
reading: イルカは言葉を話すという点で他の多くの水生動物より高等であると言える。
english: Dolphins can be said to be superior to other aquatic animals in that they speak (language).

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: 彼女と私はクラスック音楽が好きだという点で趣味が一致している。
reading: 彼女と私はクラスック音楽が好きだという点で趣味が一致している。
english: She and I share the same taste in that both of us like classical music.

translation: Point; respect; regard; aspect; way; in terms of; -wise; in that; as far as ~ is concerned
explanation: A noun which expresses the idea of "a point of argument; a point of evaluation; a point of view".
japanese: スミス氏は時代を先取り出来るという点で社長に適任だ。
reading: スミス氏は時代を先取り出来るという点で社長に適任だ。
english: Mr. Smith is the right person for president in that he can anticipate the trends of the times.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: そんなに勉強しては、体を壊しますよ。
reading: そんなに勉強しては、体を壊しますよ。
english: If you study that hard, you will ruin your health.
extra_notes: 壊す: damage, hurt, wreck, destroy [break]

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: こんなに寒くては外出できません。
reading: こんなに寒くては外出できません。
english: We cannot go out when it is this cold.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: 仕事がそんなに嫌いでは困りますね。
reading: 仕事がそんなに嫌いでは困りますね。
english: It's too bad that you hate your work that much.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: そんなに遊んでいては、試験に失敗しますよ。
reading: そんなに遊んでいては、試験に失敗しますよ。
english: If you are fooling around like that, you will fail the examination.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: あの男が来ては邪魔になる。
reading: あの男が来ては邪魔になる。
english: If he comes he will get in our way.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: こんなに働かされては、病気になってしまうよ。
reading: こんなに働かされては、病気になってしまうよ。
english: If I'm forced to work like this, I will end up by becoming ill.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: こんなに部屋が汚くては、お客さんが見えた時に恥ずかしい。
reading: こんなに部屋が汚くては、お客さんが見えた時に恥ずかしい。
english: Because the room is messy like this, I feel ashamed when I have a guest.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: 人が皆個人主義的では、国はやっていけない。
reading: 人が皆個人主義的では、国はやっていけない。
english: If everybody is individualistic, a country cannot get along well.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: こんなに忙しくては、新聞も読めない。
reading: こんなに忙しくては、新聞も読めない。
english: When one is this busy, one cannot read even the newspaper.

translation: If; when; because
explanation: A conjunction which presents an action/state as a topic about which a negative comment is given.
japanese: あんな女性がデートの相手では、彼は小さくなっているだろう。
reading: あんな女性がデートの相手では、彼は小さくなっているだろう。
english: If a woman like her is his date, he must feel intimidated.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 幸夫は来年は家が買えると大変喜んでいる。
reading: 幸夫[ゆきお]は来年は家が買えると大変喜んでいる。
english: Yukio is very happy that he can buy a house next year.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 博物館は開いているかなと、電話してみた。
reading: 博物館は開いているかなと、電話してみた。
english: (internal monologue): Wondering if the museum is open I called them.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: テニスをしようと出かけたら、途中で雨が降ってきた。
reading: テニスをしようと出かけたら、途中で雨が降ってきた。
english: With the intention of playing tennis (literally: Thinking that I will play tennis) I went out, but on my way it started to rain.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 父はまだ元気なようだと安心していたが、最近急に弱ってきた。
reading: 父はまだ元気なようだと安心していたが、最近急に弱ってきた。
english: I felt at ease, thinking that my father still looked healthy, but suddenly he began to grow weak.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 外国語の能力は単語から文、文から段落、そして段落から複段落と、伸びていく。
reading: 外国語の能力は単語から文、文から段落、そして段落から複段落と、伸びていく。
english: Foreign language proficiency develops from words to sentences, from sentences to paragraphs, and then from paragraphs to complex paragraphs.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 友達は長い間飼っていた猫が死んでしまったと、悲しがっていた。
reading: 友達は長い間飼っていた猫が死んでしまったと、悲しがっていた。
english: My friend looked sad, saying that a cat, which she kept for a long time, had died.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: その学生はもうちょっとで百点が取れたのにと、悔しがった。
reading: その学生はもうちょっとで百点が取れたのにと、悔しがった。
english: That student felt chagrined that he could almost get 100 points.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 彼女と会うのもこれが最後かと、寂しかったのです。
reading: 彼女と会うのもこれが最後かと、寂しかったのです。
english: Thinking that this would be the last time to see her, I felt lonely.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 変な音がしたなと、外に出てみたが、何でもなかった。
reading: 変な音がしたなと、外に出てみたが、何でもなかった。
english: Wondering what the strange noise was, I went outside, but it was nothing.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 僕は今晩は酒を飲むまいと、まっすぐ家に帰った。
reading: 僕は今晩は酒を飲むまいと、まっすぐ家に帰った。
english: I came straight home, thinking that I would not drink tonight.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 年内に論文を仕上げようと、懸命に努力しているところです。
reading: 年内に論文を仕上げようと、懸命に努力しているところです。
english: Thinking that I should complete the paper before the end of the year, I am right now doing my very best.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 彼にお礼を言おうとやって来たのに、ほかのことばかり話して、お礼を言うのを忘れてしまった。
reading: 彼にお礼を言おうとやって来たのに、ほかのことばかり話して、お礼を言うのを忘れてしまった。
english: I came here intending to thank him, but I just talked about something else, and forgot to thank him.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 少しは体にいいだろうと、最近は散歩をしています。
reading: 少しは体にいいだろうと、最近は散歩をしています。
english: I thought it would make a small improvement to my body, so I am taking walks these days.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 宿題を忘れたので先生に叱られるかもしれないと、ビクビクしていた。
reading: 宿題を忘れたので先生に叱られるかもしれないと、ビクビクしていた。
english: I forgot my homework so I feared that I might be scolded by my teacher.

explanation: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
japanese: 日本の四季は、春は三月から五月、夏は六月から八月、秋は九月から十一月、冬は十二月から二月までと、どの季節もほぼ同じ長さになっている。
reading: 日本の四季は、春は三月から五月、夏は六月から八月、秋は九月から十一月、冬は十二月から二月までと、どの季節もほぼ同じ長さになっている。
english: In Japan the four seasons are all of approximately equal length, in such a way that spring is from March through May, summer from June through August, autumn from September through November, and winter from December through February.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 彼は大学卒業と同時に銀行に就職した。
reading: 彼は大学卒業と同時に銀行に就職した。
english: He got a job at a bank at the time of (literally: at the same time as) his graduation from college.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 部屋に入ると同時に電話が鳴った。
reading: 部屋に入ると同時に電話が鳴った。
english: The telephone rang (literally: at the same time) as I entered the room.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 彼はこの会社の社長であると同時に大株主でもある。
reading: 彼はこの会社の社長であると同時に大株主でもある。
english: He is the president of this company and, at the same time, a big stockholder.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 彼女は結婚と同時に会社を辞めた。
reading: 彼女は結婚と同時に会社を辞めた。
english: She quit her company at the time of (literally: at the same time as) her marriage.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 銃声と同時に警官の一人が倒れた。
reading: 銃声と同時に警官の一人が倒れた。
english: We heard the shot and saw one of the policemen fall. (literally: One of the policemen fell at the same time as the sound of a gun.)

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 新しい単語の学習と同時に文法の復習も忘れてはならない。
reading: 新しい単語の学習と同時に文法の復習も忘れてはならない。
english: You mustn't forget grammar review as well as new vocabulary study.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 私はルースと同時に日本語の勉強を始めた。
reading: 私はルースと同時に日本語の勉強を始めた。
english: I started my Japanese study when (literally: at the same time as) Ruth did.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 電車が止まってドアが開くと同時に客がなだれ込んだ。
reading: 電車が止まってドアが開くと同時に客がなだれ込んだ。
english: The train came to a halt and as the doors opened the passengers rushed into the train (literally: the passengers rushed into the train at the same time as the doors opened).

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 新社長は就任すると同時に社名を変更した。
reading: 新社長は就任すると同時に社名を変更した。
english: The new president changed the company's name when (literally: at the same time as) he assumed the presidency.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 外国語を勉強する時は、文法を理解すると同時に文型の口頭練習もしなければならない。
reading: 外国語を勉強する時は、文法を理解すると同時に文型の口頭練習もしなければならない。
english: When you study a foreign language, while you learn grammar, you must also practice sentence patterns orally.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: この新しい装置は安全であると同時に効率がいい。
reading: この新しい装置は安全であると同時に効率がいい。
english: This new equipment is safe and, at the same time, efficient.

translation: At the same time (as); at the time; when; as; while; as well as ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to express the idea that someone does something or something takes place at the same time as another action or event, or that someone or something is in two states simultaneously.
japanese: 森鷗外は医者であると同時に小説家でもあった。
reading: 森[もり]鷗外[おうがい]は医者であると同時に小説家でもあった。
english: Mori Ougai was a novelist as well as a doctor.
extra_notes: Lieutenant-General Mori Rintarō, known by his pen name Mori Ōgai, was a Japanese Army Surgeon general officer, translator, novelist, and poet.

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: 私には子供がいます。子供と言ってももう大学生ですが。
reading: 私には子供がいます。子供と言ってももう大学生ですが。
english: I have a child. Well, although I said, "child," he is already a college student (literally: he is already a college student, though).

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: Ａ：毎日お忙しいんでしょうね。Ｂ：いえ、忙しいと言っても週末は休んでいますから。
reading:
Ａ：毎日お忙しいんでしょうね。
Ｂ：いえ、忙しいと言っても週末は休んでいますから。
english: A: You are busy every day, aren't you? B: No, although people may say that I'm busy, I do not work on weekends, so . . .

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: もう三月だ。しかし、三月と言ってもこの辺はまだ寒い。
reading: もう三月だ。しかし、三月と言ってもこの辺はまだ寒い。
english: It's already March. But even though I say, "March," it is still cold around here.

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: 山崎先生はまだお若いです。勿論、若いと言っても五十代ですが。
reading: 山崎先生はまだお若いです。勿論、若いと言っても五十代ですが。
english: Professor Yamazaki is still young. Of course, even though I said, "young," he is in his fifties (literally: he is in his fifties, though)

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: 仕事が見つかりました。と言ってもパートなんですが。
reading: 仕事が見つかりました。と言ってもパートなんですが。
english: I've found a job. Well, although I said, "job", it is part-time (literally: it is a part-time job, though).

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: A: 韓国語をご存知なんでしょう？B:いや、知っていると言っても二年勉強しただけですから大したことはありません。
reading:
A: 韓国語をご存知なんでしょう？
B:いや、知っていると言っても二年勉強しただけですから大したことはありません。
english:
A: You know Korean, right? 
B: No, even though people say that I know it, my knowledge is limited because I studied it only two years.

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: A：辻村さんが手伝ってくれるそうですよ。B: でも、手伝ってくれると言ってもせいぜい二、三時間でしょう。
reading:
A: 辻村[つじむら]さんが手伝ってくれるそうですよ。
B: でも、手伝ってくれると言っても精々二、三時間でしょう。
english: A: I heard that Mr. Tsujimura will help us. B: But, even though he says that he will help us, it will probably be for a couple of hours at most.

translation: Although ~ say/said that ~; even though ~ say/said that ~
explanation: A phrase which is used to clarify a statement in the preceding discourse which might be misleading.
japanese: A: あの子は強いですよ。B: いや、強いと言ってもたかが小学生ですよ。
reading:
A: あの子は強いですよ。
B: いや、強いと言ってもたかが小学生ですよ。
english:
A: That boy is strong, you know. 
B: Well, even though you say he is strong, he is only an elementary school kid.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 彼はどうしようもないという風に首を振った。
reading: 彼はどうしようもないという風に首を振った。
english: He shook his head as if to say that there was no way out.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 私は河村さんは来られないという風に聞いている。
reading: 私は 河村[かわむら]さんは来られないという風に聞いている。
english: I have been informed that Mr. Kawamura cannot come. (literally: I have been informed in such a way that I understand that Mr. Kawamura cannot come.)
extra_notes: 聞く: to hear about; to hear of; to learn of​

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 浩司は鰻、友子は天ぷら、という風にめいめいが自分の好きなものを注文した。
reading: 浩司[ひろし]は鰻、友子は天ぷら、という風に銘々が自分の好きなものを注文した。
english: Each of them ordered the (different) things they liked- Hiroshi, eel, Tomoko, tempura, and so on.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 彼はもう我慢が出来ないという風に荒々しく立ち上がった。
reading: 彼はもう我慢が出来ないという風に荒々しく立ち上がった。
english: He stood up in a violent manner showing that he could no longer bear it.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 彼女はもうこれ以上聞きたくないという風に両手で耳を被った。
reading: 彼女はもうこれ以上聞きたくないという風に両手で耳を被った。
english: She covered her ears as if to say that she didn't want to listen to it any more.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 社長には、特に問題はなかったという風に言っておいて下さい。
reading: 社長には、特に問題はなかったという風に言っておいて下さい。
english: Please tell the president that (literally: tell it to the president in such a way to convey that) there were no particular problems with it.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: この物語は今の社会を風刺しているという風には考えられませんか。
reading: この物語は今の社会を風刺しているという風には考えられませんか。
english: Can't we think that (literally: think in such a way that) this story mocks contemporary society?

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: そういうことは規則に反するから出来ないという風に説明しておけばいい。
reading: そういうことは規則に反するから出来ないという風に説明しておけばいい。
english: It would be good to explain it in a way to mean that we cannot do things like that because they are against the rules.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: 去年はボストン、今年はニューヨークという風に、この協会の大会は毎年東部の大都市で開かれている。
reading: 去年はボストン、今年はニューヨークという風に、この協会の大会は毎年東部の大都市で開かれている。
english: This association's convention is held in a big city on the East Coast every year: last year Boston; this year New York; and so on.

translation: In such a way that; in such a fashion to suggest/show (etc.) that; as if to say/show (etc.) that
explanation: A phrase which expresses a manner or a way in which someone does something.
japanese: ジョンはケートと、マイクはシンディーと、という風にみんながパートナーを見つけてペアになった。
reading: ジョンはケートと、マイクはシンディーと、という風にみんながパートナーを見つけてペアになった。
english: Everybody found a partner and paired up--John with Kate, Mike with Cindy, and so on.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 彼がこの集まりに来ないということは考えられない。
reading: 彼がこの集まりに来ないということは考えられない。
english: It is unthinkable that he won't come to this meeting.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 手紙が戻って来たということは彼女はもうこの住所にはいないということだ。
reading: 手紙が戻って来たということは彼女はもうこの住所にはいないということだ。
english: The fact that the letter came back means that she no longer lives at this address.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 彼が真面目に日本語を勉強していないということは本気で日本で仕事をする気がないのだ。
reading: 彼が真面目に日本語を勉強していないということは本気で日本で仕事をする気がないのだ。
english: The fact that he is not studying Japanese seriously means that he is not serious about working in Japan.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: これだけ丁寧に説明すれば、分からないということはあり得ない。
reading: これだけ丁寧に説明すれば、分からないということはあり得ない。
english: If we explain it this thoroughly, it is impossible that they won't understand it.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 空がこんなに赤いということは何かよくないことが起こる前兆かもしれない。
reading: 空がこんなに赤いということは何かよくないことが起こる前兆かもしれない。
english: That the sky is this red might be an omen that something bad will happen.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 彼が金を貸してくれたということは私は彼に信用されているということだ。
reading: 彼が金を貸してくれたということは私は彼に信用されているということだ。
english: The fact that he lent me money means that I am trusted by him.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 言うことを聞かないということは体罰を与えるしかないということだ。
reading: 言うことを聞かないということは 体罰[たいばつ]を与えるしかないということだ。
english: The fact that he doesn't listen to us means that there is no alternative but to punish him physically.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 私がこれだけ言っても分からないということはどういうことなんでしょう。
reading: 私がこれだけ言っても分からないということはどういうことなんでしょう。
english: What does it mean that he doesn't understand me even though I said so much?

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 彼女がパーティーをするということは試験に通ったのだ。
reading: 彼女がパーティーをするということは試験に通ったのだ。
english: That she is having a party must be because she passed the exam.

translation: That; the fact that
explanation: A phrase which changes a sentence into a topic noun clause.
japanese: 彼が毎日授業に来ているということは勉強を続けることにしたのだろう。
reading: 彼が毎日授業に来ているということは勉強を続けることにしたのだろう。
english: The fact that he is attending the class every day probably means that he has decided to continue studying.

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 四月だというのに、まだ肌寒い。
reading: 四月だというのに、まだ肌寒い。
english: It is April, but still chilly (literally: cold on the skin).

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 明後日はロンドンへ行かなければならないといのに、まだ何も準備していないんですよ。
reading: 明後日はロンドンへ行かなければならないといのに、まだ何も準備していないんですよ。
english: Although I have to go to London the day after tomorrow, I haven't prepared anything yet, you know.

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 彼は母親が危篤だというのに、映画を見に行った。
reading: 彼は母親が危篤だというのに、映画を見に行った。
english: He went to see a movie in spite of the fact that his mother is in a critical condition.

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 年末でとても忙しいというのに、うちの人は一体どこへ行ったのだろう。
reading: 年末でとても忙しいというのに、うちの人は一体どこへ行ったのだろう。
english: It's the end of the year, and we are very busy, but where in the world did my husband go?

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 小学四年生だというのに、あの子はもう中学の数学をやっている。
reading: 小学四年生だというのに、あの子はもう中学の数学をやっている。
english: The child is a fourth grader, but he is already studying junior high school math.

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 先生がわざわざ本を貸して下さったというのに、読んでいないの？
reading: 先生がわざわざ本を貸して下さったというのに、読んでいないの？
english: Your teacher kindly loaned a book to you, but you haven't read it?

translation: But; although; in spite of the fact that ~
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that an action/state takes place quite contrary to one's expectation.
japanese: 学生は貧乏だというのに、結構いい車を乗り回しているね。
reading: 学生は貧乏だというのに、結構いい車を乗り回しているね。
english: Students are said to be poor, but they are driving around in pretty good cars, aren't they?

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: パソコンというのはパーソナル・コンピュータのことだ。
reading: パソコンというのはパーソナル・コンピュータのことだ。
english: Pasokon means personal computer.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「足が出る」というのは出費が予定していたより多くなる（という）ことだ。
reading: 「足が出る」というのは出費が予定していたより多くなる（という）ことだ。
english: Ashi ga deru (literally: a foot sticks out) means that an expense (literally: is more than estimated) exceeds the amount budgeted.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「猿も木から落ちる」というのは上手な人でも時には失敗することがあるということだ。
reading: 「猿も木から落ちる」というのは上手な人でも時には失敗することがあるということだ。
english: Saru mo ki kara ochiru (literally: even monkeys fall from trees) means that even a skilful person sometimes makes a mistake.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: マイカーというのは個人が持っている車のことだ。
reading: マイカーというのは個人が持っている車のことだ。
english: Maikaa (literally: my car) means a car owned by an individual.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 裏口入学というのは試験を受けないで学校に入ることだ。
reading: 裏口入学というのは試験を受けないで学校に入ることだ。
english: Uraguchi-nyuugaku (literally: entering school through the back door) means to enter a school without taking an entrance exam.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「口が軽い」というのは人に言ってはいけないことをすぐ言ってしまう（という）ことだ。
reading: 「口が軽い」というのは人に言ってはいけないことをすぐ言ってしまう（という）ことだ。
english: Kuchi ga karui (literally: one's mouth is light) means easily telling others things one shouldn't.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「頭を絞る」というのはいいアイディアを出そうとして一生懸命考える（という）ことだ。
reading: 「頭を絞る」というのはいいアイディアを出そうとして一生懸命考える（という）ことだ。
english: Atama wo shiboru (literally: squeeze one's head) means to think hard to get good ideas.

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「猫の額のような」というのは場所がとても狭い（という）ことだ。
reading: 「猫の額のような」というのは場所がとても狭い（という）ことだ。
english: Neko no hitai no youna (literally: like a cat's forehead) means that a place is very small (as in a very small yard).

translation: Mean; the meaning of ~ is; what ~ means is
explanation: A structure which is used in interpreting, explaining, or defining a word, a phrase, or a sentence.
japanese: 「花より団子」というのは綺麗なものより食べられる団子の方がいい、外観より実質の方を取るということだ。
reading: 「花より団子」というのは綺麗なものより食べられる団子の方がいい、外観より実質の方を取るということだ。
english: Hana yori dango (literally: dumplings rather than blossoms) means that edible dumplings are better than pretty but inedible blossoms; i.e., one should take substance over appearance.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: サンフランシスコと言うと、あのケーブルカーを思い出す。
reading: サンフランシスコと言うと、あのケーブルカーを思い出す。
english: When you mention San Francisco, I remember those cable cars.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: 日本語を話すと言うと聞こえはいいんですが、実は簡単な挨拶が出来るだけなんです。
reading: 日本語を話すと言うと聞こえはいいんですが、実は簡単な挨拶が出来るだけなんです。
english: It sounds impressive when I say that I can speak Japanese, but the fact is that all I can do is exchange simple greetings.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: パリと言うと、誰でも真っ先にあのエッフェル塔を思い浮かべるだろう。
reading: パリと言うと、誰でも真っ先にあのエッフェル塔を思い浮かべるだろう。
english: When someone mentions Paris, the Eiffel Tower is the first thing likely to come to everyone's mind.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: 柔道と言うと、毎日練習した学生時代を思い出す。
reading: 柔道と言うと、毎日練習した学生時代を思い出す。
english: When it comes to judo, I remember my school days when I used to practice it every day.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: 漫画と言うと馬鹿にする人もあるが、あれはあれで面白いのだ。
reading: 漫画と言うと馬鹿にする人もあるが、あれはあれで面白いのだ。
english: Some people ridicule comics (literally: Some people despise you when you mention comics), but comics are interesting in their own way.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: 東大卒と言うと偉そうに聞こえるが、私は勉強なんか全然しない劣等生だったんです。
reading: 東 大卒[だいそつ]と言うと偉そうに聞こえるが、私は勉強なんか全然しない劣等生だったんです。
english: It sounds great when I say that I am a graduate of the University of Tokyo, but I was (in fact) a poor student who didn't study at all.

translation: When ~ mention; if ~ say that ~; when ~ say that ~; when it comes to
explanation: A phrase which is used when something which someone has mentioned causes an involuntary response.
japanese: 会社を辞めたと言うと体裁がいいんですが、彼は本当は辞めさせられたんですよ。
reading: 会社を辞めたと言うと体裁がいいんですが、彼は本当は辞めさせられたんですよ。
english: It sounds good when he says that he quit his company, but the truth of the matter is that he was made to quit.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 今年の夏は涼しいというよりは寒かった。
reading: 今年の夏は涼しいというよりは寒かった。
english: This summer was cold rather than cool.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: カーラは臆病というより（は）むしろ用心深い。
reading: カーラは臆病というより（は）むしろ用心深い。
english: Kara is cautious rather than timid.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 本田さんは教育者というより（は）むしろ学者に近い。
reading: 本田さんは教育者というより（は）むしろ学者に近い。
english: Mr. Honda is more of a scholar than an educator.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: あの人は酒を飲むというより（は）むしろ酒に飲まれていると言った方がいい。
reading: あの人は酒を飲むというより（は）むしろ酒に飲まれていると言った方がいい。
english: One should say that sake drinks him rather than he drinks sake.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 私にはこの音楽は楽しいというよりは、むしろやかましい。
reading: 私にはこの音楽は楽しいというよりは、むしろ喧しい。
english: To me this music is noisy rather than enjoyable.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: あの人は丁寧というよりは、慇懃無礼だ。
reading: あの人は丁寧というよりは、慇懃無礼だ。
english: He is politely insolent rather than polite.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 彼の説明は簡潔というよりは、むしろ不十分だと言うべきだ。
reading: 彼の説明は 簡潔[かんけつ]というよりは、むしろ不十分だと言うべきだ。
english: We should say that his explanation is insufficient rather than concise.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 父は、父親というよりは、むしろいい友達という感じでした。
reading: 父は、父親というよりは、むしろいい友達という感じでした。
english: I felt that my father was a good friend rather than a father.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 彼は大学教授というよりは、ビジネスマンだ。
reading: 彼は大学 教授[きょうじゅ]というよりは、ビジネスマンだ。
english: He is a businessman rather than a college professor.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 私は教師ですが、教えているというよりは、勉強させてもらっています。
reading: 私は教師ですが、教えているというよりは、勉強させてもらっています。
english: I'm a teacher, but I am learning (literally: I have the privilege of being allowed to study) rather than teaching.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: あの母親は子供を愛しているというよりは、むしろ、甘やかしている。
reading: あの母親は子供を愛しているというよりは、むしろ、甘やかしている。
english: That mother is pampering her child rather than loving him.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 彼と話していると、会話をしているというよりは、一方的に話を聞かされているといった感じだ。
reading: 彼と話していると、会話をしているというよりは、一方的に話を聞かされているといった感じだ。
english: When I talk with him I feel that unilaterally I am forced to listen to his talk rather than being engaged in conversation.

translation: Rather than; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate more accurate characterisation of someone or something.
japanese: 私が呼んだというより、むしろ彼女の方が押しかけて来たんです。
reading: 私が呼んだというより、むしろ彼女の方が押しかけて来たんです。
english: It's more of a case of her having invited herself than me having invited her.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: 高木さんは大阪に出張するとかでパーティーに来なかった。
reading: 高木[たかぎ]さんは大阪に出張するとかでパーティーに来なかった。
english: Mr. Takagi didn't show up at the party, saying something like he was going to make a business trip to Osaka.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: 友人の竹田は大学の授業が面白くないとかで大学を辞めてしまった。
reading: 友人の 竹田[たけだ]は大学の授業が面白くないとかで大学を辞めてしまった。
english: My friend Takeda quit college, saying something like the college classes weren't interesting.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: ミリアムは日米関係に興味があるとかで、大学で国際関係論を専攻した。
reading: ミリアムは日米関係に興味があるとかで、大学で国際関係論を専攻した。
english: Miriam majored in international relations saying something like she was interested in Japan-US relations.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: エンジンに故障があったとかで、飛行機の出発が五時間も遅れた。
reading: エンジンに故障があったとかで、飛行機の出発が五時間も遅れた。
english: The flight departure was five hours late for some reason like there was engine trouble.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: 受講生が少なかったとかで、四年生の日本語のクラスは取りやめになった。
reading: 受講生が少なかったとかで、四年生の日本語のクラスは取りやめになった。
english: The 4th-year Japanese class has been cancelled for some reason like the enrolment was low.

translation: For some reason like ~; saying something like ~; because ~ or something like that
explanation: A conjunction that is used to give an uncertain reason for something.
japanese: 田村は殺人現場に居合わせたとかで、警察に逮捕された。
reading: 田村[たむら]は殺人現場に居合わせたとかで、警察に逮捕された。
english: Tamura was arrested by the police allegedly because he happened to be at the scene of the murder or something like that.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: 先生に相談したところ、ぜひ大学院に行くよう進められた。
reading: 先生に相談したところ、ぜひ大学院に行くよう進められた。
english: When I consulted with my teacher, he strongly advised me to go to graduate school.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: 部長に頼んでみたところ、喜んで引き受けてくれた。
reading: 部長に頼んでみたところ、喜んで引き受けてくれた。
english: When I asked my boss (literally: department chief), he was glad to do it.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: 友達に話したところ、しばらく考えさせて欲しいと言った。
reading: 友達に話したところ、しばらく考えさせて欲しいと言った。
english: When I told one of my friends (about that), he said he would like me to let him think (about it) for a while.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: これまでに書いた論文を本にしたとろこ、意外によく売れた。
reading: これまでに書いた論文を本にしたところ、意外によく売れた。
english: When I published a book of the papers that I had written (literally: till this time), it sold unexpectedly well.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: 人に勧められてヨガを始めたところ、非常に効果があることが分かった。
reading: 人に勧められてヨガを始めたところ、非常に効果があることが分かった。
english: I started yoga because someone recommended it; then, I realised it had a great effect.

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: 冗談のつもりで言ったところ、思わぬ結果になって驚いている。
reading: 冗談のつもりで言ったところ、思わぬ 結果[けっか]になって驚いている。
english: I'm surprised that what I said as a joke had unexpected consequences (literally: that when I said it as a joke, it brought about an unexpected result).

translation: When; then
explanation: A dependent noun which is used to express the idea that when someone did something, something took place as the result.
japanese: その仕事に興味のある旨、手紙を出したところ、すぐに面接をしたいとの返事があった。
reading: その仕事に興味のある旨、手紙を出したところ、すぐに 面接[めんせつ]をしたいとの返事があった。
english: When I wrote to them saying that I was interested in the job, I got a letter immediately saying they wanted to interview me.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: 日本式の部屋に泊まりたいと思って旅館を予約した。ところが、通された部屋は洋式だった。
reading: 日本式の部屋に 泊[と]まりたいと思って旅館を予約した。ところが、 通[とお]された部屋は洋式だった。
english: I wanted to stay in a Japanese-style room and made a reservation at an inn. However, the room I was shown to was a Western-style one.
extra_notes: 通す - 〔招じいれる〕 show sb ┏through [into…]; 〔丁重に〕 usher; lead; guide; invite.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: Ａ：彼女にプロポーズしたんだろう？どうだった？Ｂ：ところが、駄目だったんだ。
reading:
Ａ：彼女にプロポーズしたんだろう？どうだった？
Ｂ：ところが、駄目だったんだ。
english:
A: You proposed to her, right? What happened? 
B: It didn't work out. (literally: It was no good.)

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: 私の娘はアメリカにいる時綺麗な英語を話していた。ところが、日本へ帰って一年もたたないうちにきれいに忘れてしまった。
reading: 私の娘はアメリカにいる時綺麗な英語を話していた。ところが、日本へ帰って一年もたたないうちにきれいに忘れてしまった。
english: My daughter was speaking beautiful English when she was in America. However, she forgot it completely within a year (literally: even before one year elapsed) after we came back to Japan.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: 日本から来た有名な先生の講演があるというので行ってみた。ところが、その先生は英語が下手で何を言っているのか全然分からなかった。
reading: 日本から来た有名な先生の講演があるというので行ってみた。ところが、その先生は英語が下手で何を言っているのか全然分からなかった。
english: Because I heard that there was going to be a lecture by a famous professor from Japan, I went (to listen to it). However, his English was so bad that I didn't understand what he was saying at all.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: 先生は私達に遅刻してはいけないと何度も言った。ところが、次の日、時間通りに行ってみると先生はまだ来ていなかった。
reading: 先生は私達に遅刻してはいけないと何度も言った。ところが、次の日、時間通りに行ってみると先生はまだ来ていなかった。
english: Our teacher repeatedly told us that we mustn't be late for his class. However, when I went to his class on time the next day, he was not yet there.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: アメリカへ来ればいくらでも仕事はあると言われた。ところが、来てみるとアメリカは不況でどこにも仕事はなかった。
reading: アメリカへ来ればいくらでも仕事はあると言われた。ところが、来てみるとアメリカは不況でどこにも仕事はなかった。
english: I was told that if I came to America, there would be a lot of jobs. However, when I came, there were no jobs anywhere because of the depression.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: アメリカでは鋸は押して切る。ところが、日本では引いて切る。
reading: アメリカでは鋸は押して切る。ところが、日本では引いて切る。
english: In America you push a saw in order to cut; however, in Japan you pull one to cut.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: A: 今晩のパーティー、君も来てくれるね。B: ところが、あいにく行けないの。
reading:
A: 今晩のパーティー、君も来てくれるね。
B: ところが、あいにく行けないの。
english:
A: [male speech] You can come to tonight's party, too, can't you? 
B: [female speech] No, I'm afraid I can't.

translation: However; but
explanation: A conjunction which is used to present what in fact happened or what is in fact the case when something else was/is expected.
japanese: A: 彼女は結婚しているんでしょう？B:そう見えるでしょう？ところが、まだ独身なんですって。
reading:
A: 彼女は結婚しているんでしょう？
B:そう見えるでしょう？ところが、まだ独身なんですって。
english:
A: [female or polite male speech] (She is married, isn't she? 
B: [female speech] She looks like it, doesn't she? But I heard that she's still single.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: よく勉強したから、試験にどんな問題が出ようとも大丈夫だ。
reading: よく勉強したから、試験にどんな問題が出ようとも大丈夫だ。
english: Since I studied hard I feel confident no matter what problem shows up on the test.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: いかに家事が忙し{く/かろう}とも母は文句一つ言わなかった。
reading: いかに家事が忙しくとも母は文句一つ言わなかった。
english: No matter how busy she was with housekeeping, my mother never uttered a single complaint.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: どんなに健康であろうとも、一年に一回は健康診断を受けるべきだ。
reading: どんなに健康であろうとも、一年に一回は健康<ruby title="診断(しんだん)"><rb>診断</rb><rt>しんだん</rt></ruby>を受けるべきだ。
english: No matter how healthy you are, you should have a check-up once a year.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: このプロジェクトは遅くとも来年の四月には完了するだろう。
reading: このプロジェクトは遅くとも来年の四月には完了するだろう。
english: At the latest, this project will be complete in April of next year.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: 父は何が起きようともいつも平然としている。
reading: 父は何が起きようともいつも平然としている。
english: My father is always very calm no matter what is impending.
extra_notes: とする here: to feel (e.g. after sound symbolism or psychological experience word); to look; to feel like​

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: 私は世界のどこに住もうとも一向に構わない。
reading: 私は世界のどこに住もうとも一向に構わない。
english: I do not care at all where in the world I live.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: 万一失敗しようとも、簡単に諦めてはいけない。
reading: 万一失敗しようとも、簡単に諦めてはいけない。
english: Even if by any chance you fail you shouldn't give up easily.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: いかに頭がよ{く/かろう}とも、努力しなければいい仕事は出来ない。
reading: いかに頭がよくとも、努力しなければいい仕事は出来ない。
english: No matter how bright you may be, you cannot do a good job unless you make an effort.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: どんなに品物が安{く/かろう}とも、質が悪ければ金を捨てることになる。
reading: どんなに 品物[しなもの]が安くとも、質が悪ければ金を捨てることになる。
english: No matter how cheap merchandise may be, if the quality is poor, you will end up throwing away money.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: 金が十分な{く/かろう}とも、生活を楽しむことは出来るはずだ。
reading: 金が十分な{く/かろう}とも、生活を楽しむことは出来るはずだ。
english: Even without enough money we should be able to enjoy life.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: どんなに運動が好きであろうとも、運動のやり過ぎはかえって悪い。
reading: どんなに運動が好きであろうとも、運動のやり過ぎはかえって悪い。
english: No matter how much one may like exercise, too much of it is bad.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: この手紙はあなたがいくら読みたくとも読ませるわけにはいかない。
reading: この手紙はあなたがいくら読みたくとも読ませるわけにはいかない。
english: I cannot let you read this letter, no matter how much you want to read it.

translation: No matter ~ may be; even if; at ~ -est
explanation: A conjunction in written Japanese that is used to express a concession.
japanese: 僕は少なくとも、一年に三回は海外出張をしています。
reading: 僕は少なくとも、一年に三回は海外出張をしています。
english: I make business trips abroad at least three times a year.

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: 吉田さんが初代の委員長となった。
reading: 吉田さんが初代の委員長となった。
english: Mr. Yoshida has become the first committee chairman.

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: その土地は結局国の所有物となった。
reading: その土地は結局国の所有物となった。
english: That land eventually become state property.

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: 戦後義務教育は九年間となった。
reading: 戦後義務教育は九年間となった。
english: After the war, (the period of) compulsory education was changed to (literally: became) nine years.

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: 彼らの結婚は悲劇的な結果となった。
reading: 彼らの結婚は悲劇的な結果となった。
english: Their marriage ended in tragedy (literally: became a tragic result).

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: 彼は証拠不十分で無罪となった。
reading: 彼は証拠不十分で無罪となった。
english: For lack of evidence, he was found (literally: became) innocent.

translation: Become
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that someone or something becomes something.
japanese: その試合は雨のため中止となった。
reading: その試合は雨のため中止となった。
english: The game was cancelled (literally: became a cancellation) due to rain.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 私は機械のこととなると何も分からない。
reading: 私は機械のこととなると何も分からない。
english: When it comes to mechanical things, I don't understand anything.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 彼が手伝ってくれないとなると誰かほかの人を頼むしかない。
reading: 彼が手伝ってくれないとなると誰かほかの人を頼むしかない。
english: If it's true that he is not going to help us, we'll have no alternative but to ask someone else.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 勉はギャンブルとなると人が変わってしまう。
reading: 勉[つとむ]はギャンブルとなると人が変わってしまう。
english: When it comes to gambling, Tsutomu becomes another person.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 日本語が出来る科学者となると数がかなり限られてくる。
reading: 日本語が出来る科学者となると数がかなり限られてくる。
english: When it comes to scientists who can speak Japanese, the number is quite limited.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 何でも仕事となると楽なものはない。
reading: 何でも仕事となると楽なものはない。
english: Nothing is easy (literally: There is nothing easy) when it comes to work.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 彼が参加できないとなるとこのプロジェクトは考え直さなければならない。
reading: 彼が参加できないとなるとこのプロジェクトは考え直さなければならない。
english: If it turns out that he cannot participate (in this project), we'll have to reconsider it.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 秘密が漏れたとなるとこの計画は変更しなければならない。
reading: 秘密が漏れたとなるとこの計画は変更しなければならない。
english: If it is true that the secret (of this plan) has leaked, we must change it.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: 彼が新しい社長になるとなると経営方針がかなり変わるだろう。
reading: 彼が新しい社長になるとなると経営方針がかなり変わるだろう。
english: If he turns out to be the new president, the management policy will probably be considerably different.

translation: When it comes to; if it is true that ~; if it is the case that ~; if it turns out that ~
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea "when it comes to" or "if it is true that".
japanese: この仕事は簡単そうに見えるが、一人でするとなると結構大変だ。
reading: この仕事は簡単そうに見えるが、一人でするとなると結構大変だ。
english: This job looks easy, but if (it is the case that) you do it by yourself, it will be quite tough.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 説明書の通り（に）やったが、うまくいかなかった。
reading: 説明書の通り（に）やったが、うまくいかなかった。
english: I did it as the manual shows (literally: in the same way as the manual), but it didn't work.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 私の言う通り（に）体を動かして下さい。
reading: 私の言う通り（に）体を動かして下さい。
english: Please move your body as I tell you to (literally: in the same way as I tell you).

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 思った通り彼が一番先に来ていた。
reading: 思った通り彼が一番先に来ていた。
english: As I expected (literally: thought), he was the first to come.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 結果はやはり予想した通りだった。
reading: 結果はやはり予想した通りだった。
english: The result was just as I expected, after all.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: この地図の通り（に）行けば間違いなく行けます。
reading: この地図の通り（に）行けば間違いなく行けます。
english: If you go as this map shows (literally: in the same way as this map), you can get there without fail.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 私はただ言われた通り（に）やっているだけです。
reading: 私はただ言われた通り（に）やっているだけです。
english: I'm just doing as I'm told (literally: in the way I'm told).

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: ここに書いてある通り（に）すれば誰にでも出来ます。
reading: ここに書いてある通り（に）すれば誰にでも出来ます。
english: If you do it in the way written here, anyone can do it.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 予想した通り誰も宿題をやってこなかった。
reading: 予想した通り誰も宿題をやってこなかった。
english: As I expected, no one did their homework.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 心配していた通りペンキが足りなくなった。
reading: 心配していた通りペンキが足りなくなった。
english: As I feared, I ran out of paint.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: 内容はこの間説明した通りです。
reading: 内容はこの間説明した通りです。
english: The content is the same as I explained to you the other day.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: これは私が考えていた通りのデザインです。
reading: これは私が考えていた通りのデザインです。
english: This is the same design as the one I have thought about.

translation: (in) the same way as; (in) the way; as
explanation: A dependent noun which expresses the idea that someone does something or something takes place in the same way as something else.
japanese: A：これは何語か分かりますか。B: アラビア語です。A: はい、その通りです。
reading:
A:これは何語か分かりますか。
B:アラビア語です。
A:はい、その通りです。
english:
A: Do you know what language this is? 
B: It's Arabic. 
A: That's right (literally: the same as you said).

explanation: A phrase indicating that someone assumes something.
japanese: 温度は一定（だ）とする。
reading: 温度は一定（だ）とする。
english: We assume that the temperature is constant.

explanation: A phrase indicating that someone assumes something.
japanese: 一日に五百マイル運転できるとすれば・すると、何日で着きますか。
reading: 一日に五百マイル運転できるとすれば、何日で着きますか。
english: Assuming that we can drive 500 miles a day, how many days will it take to get there?

explanation: A phrase indicating that someone assumes something.
japanese: 温暖化現象がこのまま続いたとしよう。
reading: 温暖化現象がこのまま続いたとしよう。
