english: We can teach foreign languages more effectively if we utilize new technology.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 子供達に自分で考えさせる方がより教育的だ。
reading: 子供達に自分で考えさせる方がより教育的だ。
english: It is more educational to have children think for themselves.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 今後もより速い、より大容量の記憶装置の開発が続くだろう。
reading: 今後もより速い、より大容量の記憶装置の開発が続くだろう。
english: The development of faster and larger capacity storage devices will continue from now on, too.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 私達はより多くの人々にこの施設を利用してもらいたいと思っています。
reading: 私達はより多くの人々にこの施設を利用してもらいたいと思っています。
english: We would like more people to use this facility.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: この車は車体をより軽くするためにアルミの合金を使っている。
reading: この車は車体をより軽くするためにアルミの合金を使っている。
english: In order to make the body lighter, aluminium alloy is used for this car.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 「より軽く、より薄く、より小さく」が我が社のモットーだ。
reading: 「より軽く、より薄く、より小さく」が我が社のモットーだ。
english: Lighter, thinner, and smaller is our company’s motto.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 原色を使うと、より刺激的になる。
reading: 原色を使うと、より刺激的になる。
english: Using original colours would make it more stimulating.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 電話回線を利用すれば、より広い地域のユーザーにこのサービスが提供出来る。
reading: 電話回線を利用すれば、より広い地域のユーザーにこのサービスが提供出来る。
english: If we utilise telephone lines, we can offer this service to users in a larger region.

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: 集中管理システムの方がより効率的だろう。
reading: 集中管理システムの方がより効率的だろう。
english: A centralized system would probably be more efficient.
extra_notes: 【効率的】こうりつてき  efficient

translation: More ~ (than now; than something at present; than otherwise)
explanation: An adverb which forms the comparative of an adjective or an adverb to mean 'more ~ than now or than otherwise'.
japanese: バスで通勤する方がより経済的です。
reading: バスで通勤する方がより経済的です。
english: Commuting to work by bus is more economical.

translation: Cannot help -ing; cannot (help) but; have no choice but to ~; have to
explanation: An auxiliary indicating that there is no other choice but to do something.
japanese: それは高かったが、教科書だったから買わざるを得なかった。
reading: それは高かったが、教科書だったから買わざるを得なかった。
english: It was a textbook so I had no choice but to buy it, although it was expensive.

translation: Cannot help -ing; cannot (help) but; have no choice but to ~; have to
explanation: An auxiliary indicating that there is no other choice but to do something.
japanese: 日本へ行けば、日本の習慣に従わざるを得ない。
reading: 日本へ行けば、日本の習慣に従わざるを得ない。
english: If you go to Japan you cannot help but adapt yourself to Japanese customs.

translation: Cannot help -ing; cannot (help) but; have no choice but to ~; have to
explanation: An auxiliary indicating that there is no other choice but to do something.
japanese: 上司に飲みに行こうと言われれば、部下は行かざるを得ない。
reading: 上司[じょうし]に飲みに行こうと言われれば、部下は行かざるを得ない。
english: If a subordinate is told by his superior to go out drinking he cannot help going with him.

translation: Cannot help -ing; cannot (help) but; have no choice but to ~; have to
explanation: An auxiliary indicating that there is no other choice but to do something.
japanese: これだけの人が拳銃で殺されているのだから、拳銃所持をより厳しくコントロールせざるを得ないと思う。
reading: これだけの人が拳銃で殺されているのだから、拳銃所持をより厳しくコントロールせざるを得ないと思う。
english: Because this many people have been murdered by guns, I feel that we cannot help but control possession of guns more strictly.

translation: Cannot help -ing; cannot (help) but; have no choice but to ~; have to
explanation: An auxiliary indicating that there is no other choice but to do something.
japanese: ジョンは一年で日本語がすらすら話せて、新聞が楽に読めるようになったのだから、語学の天才と言わざるを得ない。
reading: ジョンは一年で日本語がすらすら話せて、新聞が楽に読めるようになったのだから、語学の天才と言わざるを得ない。
english: Since John was able to speak Japanese fluently and read newspapers with ease in one year we cannot help calling him a genius of language learning.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: あれ、財布がどこかへ行ってしまったぞ。
reading: あれ、財布がどこかへ行ってしまったぞ。
english: Hey, my purse has gone somewhere!

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 急がないとバスに乗り遅れるぞ。
reading: 急がないとバスに 乗り遅れる[のりおくれる]ぞ。
english: If you don't hurry, you'll be late for the bus, you know.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 今日はあの子とデートが出来るぞ。
reading: 今日はあの子とデートが出来るぞ。
english: Wow! I can date that girl today.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 変だぞ。女房の顔が猫の顔に見える。
reading: 変だぞ。女房の顔が猫の顔に見える。
english: Strange indeed! My wife's face looks like a cat's face.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 今度こそ文部省の奨学金をもらってやるぞ。
reading: 今度こそ文部省の奨学金をもらってやるぞ。
english: This time, I'll definitely get the Education Ministry's Scholarship.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 今日の日本語の試験はうまくいったぞ。
reading: 今日の日本語の試験はうまくいったぞ。
english: Thank God, today's Japanese exam went well!

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 今日は寒いから、オーバーを着て行った方がいいぞ。
reading: 今日は寒いから、オーバーを着て行った方がいいぞ。
english: It's cold today, so you'd better go out with an overcoat on.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: このケーキ、食べないなら、俺が食べちゃうぞ。
reading: このケーキ、食べないなら、俺が食べちゃうぞ。
english: If you don't eat this cake, I will.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 同じ間違いをもう一度したら、許さないぞ。
reading: 同じ間違いをもう一度したら、許さないぞ。
english: If you make the same mistake again, I'm not going to forgive you.

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: おい、この酒、熱くないぞ。
reading: おい、この酒、 熱[あつ]くないぞ。
english: Hey, this sake isn't hot enough!

translation: I tell you; I'm telling you; you know
explanation: A sentence final particle that emphasises a male speaker's emotion about something in his monologue or his strong desire to draw someone else's attention.
japanese: 予告もなしに来るなんて失礼だぞ。
reading: 予告[よこく]もなしに来るなんて失礼だぞ。
english: It's rude of you to come here without any advance notice. Do you know that?

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 部長はあえて社長に反対意見を述べた。
reading: 部長はあえて社長に反対意見を述べた。
english: The department head boldly expressed his opposing view directly to the company president.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 私はあえて大がかりな研究計画を立てたいと思う。
reading: 私はあえて大がかりな研究計画を立てたいと思う。
english: I would like to take on a large-scale research proposal.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: あえて先生の理論に異議を唱えてみようと思う。
reading: あえて先生の理論に異議を唱えてみようと思う。
english: I think I will try to oppose my professor's theory.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: あえて言えばあなたの考えは机上の空論だ。
reading: あえて言えばあなたの考えは 机上[きじょう]の空論だ。
english: If I dare to say so, your idea is an unrealistic theory.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 君の言うことにあえて反対はしないよ。
reading: 君の言うことにあえて反対はしないよ。
english: I don't dare oppose what you're saying.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: アメリカでは黙っていると損をするので、私は日本人としてあえて自己主張をすることにしている。
reading: アメリカでは黙っていると損をするので、私は日本人としてあえて自己<ruby title="主張(しゅちょう)"><rb>主張</rb><rt>しゅちょう</rt></ruby>をすることにしている。
english: In the U.S., if I keep silent I lose out, so as a Japanese, I'm making a point of asserting myself.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 委員会の賛同を得るのは難しいとは知りつつも、あえて新機軸の計画を提案した。
reading: 委員会の賛同を得るのは難しいとは知りつつも、あえて<ruby title="新(しん)"><rb>新</rb><rt>しん</rt></ruby> <ruby title="機軸(きじく)"><rb>機軸</rb><rt>きじく</rt></ruby>の計画を提案した。
english: Although I knew that it was hard to get approval from the committee, I dared to propose a brand new plan.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 彼の両親があえて住居を変えたのは彼の教育を考えた上であった。
reading: 彼の両親があえて 住居[じゅうきょ]を変えたのは彼の教育を考えた上であった。
english: It was after his parents thought about his education that they made the bold move to change their residence.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 悪いとは思いつつも、あえて先輩の非をとがめたら、やっぱりそれ以後、その先輩は私と口をきかなくなった。
reading: 悪いとは思いつつも、あえて先輩の非をとがめたら、やっぱりそれ以後、その先輩は私と口をきかなくなった。
english: While I knew I shouldn't have done so, I ventured to criticize my senior partner's wrongdoings. And, sure enough, he's stopped talking to me since.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 私はあえて人とは違った道を進みたいと思っている。
reading: 私はあえて人とは違った道を進みたいと思っている。
english: I'm thinking of daring to follow a path different from others.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: 時代の流れにあえて抗おうとしたが、徒労に終わった。
reading: 時代の流れにあえて<ruby title="抗(あらが)"><rb>抗</rb><rt>あらが</rt></ruby>おうとしたが、徒労に終わった。
english: I dared to resist the flow of the times, but it was all in vain.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: あの男は能力がないけれど、あえて長所を拾えば、人のよさだろう。
reading: あの男は能力がないけれど、あえて長所を拾えば、人のよさだろう。
english: That man has no talent, but if I force myself to single out his strong point, it would be his fine personality.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: あえて日本の政治を一言で批判すろと、派閥の行動ということになるだろう。
reading: あえて日本の政治を<ruby title="一言(ひとこと)"><rb>一言</rb><rt>ひとこと</rt></ruby>で批判すろと、派閥の行動ということになるだろう。
english: If I ventured to find fault with current Japanese politics, it would be to criticize the behaviour of factions.

translation: Daringly; boldly; dare to ~; venture to ~; force oneself to ~
explanation: An adverb that expresses the speaker's/writer's desire or will to dare to do something in spite of difficulty, danger or opposition.
japanese: でもいいことばかりでもなかったです。あえて今言いませんが、いやなことも沢山ありました。
reading: でもいいことばかりでもなかったです。あえて今言いませんが、いやなことも沢山ありました。
english: Not everything went well. I won't venture to say now what, but there were many unpleasant things.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: さんざん考えたあげく（に）大学院へ進学することにした。
reading: さんざん考えたあげく（に）大学院へ進学することにした。
english: After thinking for a long time, I decided to go on to graduate school.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 彼女の離婚は数年悩んだあげくの決断だった。
reading: 彼女の離婚は数年悩んだあげくの決断だった。
english: Her divorce was a decision she made after agonizing for several years.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 私はさんざん悩んだあげくに最初に勤めていた会社を辞めた。
reading: 私はさんざん悩んだあげくに最初に勤めていた会社を辞めた。
english: I quit the company where I first worked after thinking very hard (about what to do).

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 彼はアジア、ヨーロッパ、北米などいろいろな国の女性とつき合ったあげくに、結局は生涯独身で過ごした。
reading: 彼はアジア、ヨーロッパ、北米などいろいろな国の女性とつき合ったあげくに、結局は生涯独身で過ごした。
english: He dated women from various countries in Asia, Europe and North America, but in the end he spent his entire life single.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 妻はあの靴がいい、この靴がいいと、いろいろと履いてみたあげくに、どれも買わずに店を出た。
reading: 妻はあの靴がいい、この靴がいいと、いろいろと履いてみたあげくに、どれも買わずに店を出た。
english: Saying "I like this one" or "I like that one," my wife tried on all sorts of shoes, but after all that, she left the store without buying any of them.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 山田は私の車を一か月も使ったあげく、返す時お礼の一言も言わなかった。
reading: 山田は私の車を一か月も使ったあげく、返す時お礼の<ruby title="一言(ひとこと)"><rb>一言</rb><rt>ひとこと</rt></ruby>も言わなかった。
english: After using my car for a whole month, Yamada didn't even say a word of thanks when he returned it.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: さんざん迷ったあげく、一年休職してアメリカに留学することにした。
reading: さんざん迷ったあげく、一年休職してアメリカに留学することにした。
english: After weighing my options for a long time, I finally decided to take a one-year leave from my company to study abroad in the U.S.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: どのテレビを買おうかと迷ったあげく、何も買わずに帰ってしまった。
reading: どのテレビを買おうかと迷ったあげく、何も買わずに帰ってしまった。
english: I couldn't decide which television I should buy, so (in the end) I went home without buying any.

translation: in the end; finally; eventually; after
explanation: An adverb/conjunction indicating that one spends an extended period of time before reaching a result.
japanese: 無料のネットサービスには、登録時に住所、氏名、電話番号、生年月日、あげくの果てには学歴、年収、家族構成など、様々な個人情報を要求してくるものがある。
reading: 無料のネットサービスには、登録時に住所、氏名、電話番号、生年月日、あげくの果てには学歴、年収、家族構成など、様々な個人情報を要求してくるものがある。
english: There are some free Internet services that require at the time of registration your address, name, telephone number, date of birth, and at the end, all sorts of personal information such as educational background, annual income and family size, etc.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 江本氏はあくまでも自説を変えなかった。
reading: <ruby title="江本(えもと)"><rb>江本</rb><rt>えもと</rt></ruby>氏はあくまでも自説を変えなかった。
english: Mr. Emoto persistently maintained (literally: didn't change) his opinion.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: これはあくまでも小説であって実話ではない。
reading: これはあくまでも小説であって実話ではない。
english: This is strictly fiction and not a true story.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 彼女はあくまでも自分に正直だった。
reading: 彼女はあくまでも自分に正直だった。
english: She was true to herself to the end.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 私はあくまでも彼の無実を信じる。
reading: 私はあくまでも彼の無実を信じる。
english: I will believe in his innocence to the end.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 彼はあくまでも日本の参戦に反対を唱え続けた。
reading: 彼はあくまでも日本の参戦に反対を唱え続けた。
english: He kept opposing Japan's entry into the war up to the end.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: あくまで一人でやると言うのならあえて手助けはしない。
reading: あくまで一人でやると言うのならあえて手助けはしない。
english: If you insist on doing it by yourself, I won't venture to assist you.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 反乱軍はあくまでも抵抗を続けた。
reading: 反乱軍はあくまでも抵抗を続けた。
english: The insurgent troops continued their resistance to the end.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: ケイトはあくまでも自分の外見にこだわった。
reading: ケイトはあくまでも自分の外見にこだわった。
english: Kate was always particular about the way she looked.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 理論はあくまでも理論であって、現実がその通りになるという保証はどこにもない。
reading: 理論はあくまでも理論であって、現実がその通りになるという保証はどこにもない。
english: Theories are strictly theories; there is no guarantee that reality turns out the way they predict.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: ここに書かれた費用はあくまでも目安であり、サービスによっては異なる場合があります。
reading: ここに書かれた<ruby title="費用(ひよう)"><rb>費用</rb><rt>ひよう</rt></ruby>はあくまでも目安であり、サービスによっては異なる場合があります。
english: The cost written here is strictly an estimate. It may differ depending on the service (you choose).

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: これはあくまでも私の直感なんですが、山田さんは近々この会社を辞めるんじゃないかと思います。
reading: これはあくまでも私の直感なんですが、山田さんは近々この会社を辞めるんじゃないかと思います。
english: This is just what my sixth sense tells me, but I think Mr. Yamada will quit this company soon.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 少しお金を貸していただきたいのですが、家族にはあくまで内緒にしていただきたいのです。
reading: 少しお金を貸していただきたいのですが、家族にはあくまで内緒にしていただきたいのです。
english: I'd like to borrow some money from you, but I'd appreciate it if you would keep it absolutely secret from my family.

translation: to the end; persistently; insist; strictly; just; under any circumstance; absolutely; never; completely; ultimately
explanation: An adverb that represents the idea of "to the utmost degree".
japanese: 空があくまでも青く澄みきっていた。
reading: 空があくまでも青く澄みきっていた。
english: The sky was completely blue and clear.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: 彼の推理もあながち間違っていないのかもしれない。
reading: 彼の推理もあながち間違っていないのかもしれない。
english: His reasoning may not necessarily be wrong.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: バーチャル指揮者ソフトが売れているところを見ると、一度は指揮者になってみたいというのは、あながち僕だけの願望ではないらしい。
reading: バーチャル指揮者ソフトが売れているところを見ると、一度は指揮者になってみたいというのは、あながち僕だけの願望ではないらしい。
english: Judging by how well virtual conducting software has been selling, apparently I'm not necessarily the only one who'd like to try orchestra conducting at least once in my life.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: 最後の一章はやや蛇足とも思えるが、そのエピソードは読んでいて気分がいい。ということはあながち蛇足とは言えないということか。
reading: 最後の<ruby title="一章(いっしょう)"><rb>一章</rb><rt>いっしょう</rt></ruby>はやや蛇足とも思えるが、そのエピソードは読んでいて気分がいい。ということはあながち蛇足とは言えないということか。
english: I felt like the last chapter wasn't quite necessary, but it feels good to read it. So, I guess it's not so superﬂuous after all.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: 皮膚のpHが体調によっても変わるとすれば、「気分次第で色が変わる口紅」というのもあながち嘘ではない。
reading: 皮膚のpHが体調によっても変わるとすれば、「気分次第で色が変わる口紅」というのもあながち嘘ではない。
english: If it's true that the pH of your skin changes depending on your health, then “lipstick that changes its colour depending on your mood” isn't necessarily a lie.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: 完全に男女平等な社会が来るのは困るというのも、あながち偽った気持ちではない。
reading: 完全に男女平等な社会が来るのは困るというのも、あながち偽った気持ちではない。
english: It wouldn't be a total lie for me to say I would have difﬁculty with a society in which men and women are completely equal.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: この俳優の演技はうまいが、時々違和感を覚えるのは、あながち演出のせいとばかりは言えない。
reading: この俳優の演技はうまいが、時々違和感を覚えるのは、あながち演出のせいとばかりは言えない。
english: This actor is talented, but sometimes his performances come off a little strange, and I don't think it's necessarily always the fault of the producer.

translation: (not) necessarily; (not) always
explanation: A structure that indicates that something is not necessarily the way the speaker/writer thought.
japanese: 生死の境をさまよっていた人が手術中の会話を鮮明に覚えていたりすることから、幽体離脱現象もあながち否定できない。
reading: 生死の境をさまよっていた人が手術中の会話を鮮明に覚えていたりすることから、幽体離脱現象もあながち否定できない。
english: Since some people who've come close to dying say that they can clearly recall what was being said around them while they were on the operating table, we can't simply deny the occurrence of out-of-body experiences.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: ボールペン(か)あるいは万年筆でお書き下さい。
reading: ボールペン(か)あるいは<ruby title="万年筆(まんねんひつ)"><rb>万年筆</rb><rt>まんねんひつ</rt></ruby>でお書き下さい。
english: Please write either with a ballpoint pen or a fountain pen.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 日本のような少子化社会では、大学の数を少なくするか、あるいは外国人の学生を増やすかしなければなるまい。
reading: 日本のような少子化社会では、大学の数を少なくするか、あるいは外国人の学生を増やすかしなければなるまい。
english: In a society like Japan where the number of children is decreasing, we may have to either reduce the number of colleges or increase the number of foreign students.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: すべての宗教は、あるいはアニミズムから来ている（の）かもしれない。
reading: すべての<ruby title="宗教(しゅうきょう)"><rb>宗教</rb><rt>しゅうきょう</rt></ruby>は、あるいはアニミズムから来ている（の）かもしれない。
english: Perhaps all religions originate from animism.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 社長は朝ご飯にはトーストかあるいはオートミールを召し上がる。
reading: 社長は朝ご飯にはトーストかあるいはオートミールを召し上がる。
english: For breakfast, the company president has either toast or oatmeal.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 政治学あるいは経済学を専攻した学生を採用します。
reading: 政治学あるいは経済学を専攻した学生を採用します。
english: We will hire a student who has majored in either political science or economics.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: ご注文は電話か、あるいはインターネットでお願いします。
reading: ご注文は電話か、あるいはインターネットでお願いします。
english: Please place your order either by phone or by Internet.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: この会社は大規模なリストラをするか、あるいは、倒産するかしかない。
reading: この会社は大規模なリストラをするか、あるいは、倒産するかしかない。
english: The only choice left for this company is to execute a large-scale restructuring or else go bankrupt.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 定年になったら毎日川で釣りをするか、あるいはゴルフをしようと思っています。
reading: 定年になったら毎日川で釣りをするか、あるいはゴルフをしようと思っています。
english: Once I retire, I'm thinking of ﬁshing at the river or playing golf every day.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 人々の大統領の評価は好きか、あるいは、嫌いかのどちらかだ。
reading: 人々の大統領の<ruby title="評価(ひょうか)"><rb>評価</rb><rt>ひょうか</rt></ruby>は好きか、あるいは、嫌いかのどちらかだ。
english: People's assessment of the president is split: They either love him or hate him.

translation: or; either ~ or; perhaps
explanation: A conjunction that marks alternatives
japanese: 現在日本の政党は乱立しているが、将来あるいはアメリカのように二大政党になるかもしれない。
reading: 現在日本の政党は乱立しているが、将来あるいはアメリカのように二大政党になるかもしれない。
english: Right now there are too many political parties in Japan, but in the future, perhaps there will be two big parties like in the States.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 彼はあたかも責任者のように振る舞っている。
reading: 彼はあたかも責任者のように振る舞っている。
english: He behaves as if he were the person in charge.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: リニアモーターカーはあたかも氷の上をすべる（かの）ように走る。
reading: リニアモーターカーはあたかも氷の上をすべる（かの）ように走る。
english: The linear motor car runs as if it were gliding on ice.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: この装置を使って、あたかも現場にいる(かの)ような感覚で現場にいるロボットを操縦できる。
reading: この装置を使って、あたかも現場にいる(かの)ような感覚で現場にいるロボットを操縦できる。
english: Using this device you can operate a robot at the site as if you were actually there.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: リモートコントロールソフトは遠くのPCのデスクトップ画面をそのまま手元のPCに映し出し、あたかも自分のデスクトップのように操作することができる。
reading: リモートコントロールソフトは遠くのPCのデスクトップ画面をそのまま手元のPCに映し出し、あたかも自分のデスクトップのように 操作[そうさ]することができる。
english: A remote control software program displays the desktop of a remote personal computer on the computer in front of you and enables you to operate it as if it were your own computer's desktop.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 彼女はあたかも自分のうちにいるように振る舞っている。
reading: 彼女はあたかも自分のうちにいるように振る舞っている。
english: She behaves as if she were in her own house.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 上手な説明文は、あたかも目の前にその光景が広がっているように鮮明にイメージできるものです。
reading: 上手な説明文は、あたかも目の前にその<ruby title="光景(こうけい)"><rb>光景</rb><rt>こうけい</rt></ruby>が広がっているように鮮明にイメージできるものです。
english: With well-written explanatory sentences, the reader can get vivid images, as if the scenes were spread out in front of his eyes.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 彼はあたかも自分が上司であるかのように私に仕事を言いつける。
reading: 彼はあたかも自分が上司であるかのように私に仕事を言いつける。
english: He gives me assignments as if he were my boss.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 連結納税制度とは、企業グループがあたかも一つの法人であるかのように捉えて、納税させる仕組みです。
reading: 連結納税制度とは、企業グループがあたかも一つの<ruby title="法人(ほうじん)"><rb>法人</rb><rt>ほうじん</rt></ruby>であるかのように<ruby title="捉(とら)"><rb>捉</rb><rt>とら</rt></ruby>えて、納税させる仕組みです。
english: The linked tax payment system is a mechanism by which a group of companies is viewed and made to pay taxes as if they were a single corporation.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: この映画はコンピュータ・グラフィクスによって、あたかも人間が実際に人の体の中に入って活動しているような効果を生み出している。
reading: この映画はコンピュータ・グラフィクスによって、あたかも人間が実際に人の体の中に入って活動しているような効果を生み出している。
english: Using computer graphics, this movie creates the effect of people actually working and playing inside someone's body

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: 私はあたかも空を飛んでいるかのような錯覚を覚えた。
reading: 私はあたかも空を飛んでいるかのような錯覚を覚えた。
english: I felt as if I were ﬂying (literally: I had the illusion of ﬂying) through the air.

translation: (just) as if ~ were; (just) as if ~ did ~; just like; just; exactly
explanation: An adverb used to present a counter-factual statement emphatically
japanese: この文章はあたかも我々が不正を行っているかのごとき印象を与える。
reading: この文章はあたかも我々が 不正[ふせい]を行っているかのごとき印象を与える。
english: These sentences give people the impression that we are doing  something dishonest.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 僕が一言変なことを言ったばかりに彼女との関係は悪くなってしまった。
reading: 僕が一言変なことを言ったばかりに彼女との関係は悪くなってしまった。
english: Just because I said one nasty thing to her, my relationship with her deteriorated.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: あの子は、体が弱いばかりにクラスメートにいじめられている。
reading: あの子は、体が弱いばかりにクラスメートにいじめられている。
english: That child is being bullied by his classmates simply because he  is (physically) weak.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: あの日たまたま休んでいたばかりに、大事な連絡を聞きそびれた。
reading: あの日たまたま休んでいたばかりに、大事な連絡を聞きそびれた。
english: I missed a really important announcement just because I happened to be absent that day.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 彼女が会いたいと言ってきた時に会いに行かなかったばかりに、それが最後のチャンスになってしまった。
reading: 彼女が会いたいと言ってきた時に会いに行かなかったばかりに、それが最後のチャンスになってしまった。
english: Simply because I didn't go see her when she wanted to see me, it turned out to be my last chance to see her.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 遺言がないばかりに相続人の間で遺産争いに発展するということがよくある。
reading: 遺言がないばかりに相続人の間で遺産争いに<ruby title="発展(はってん)"><rb>発展</rb><rt>はってん</rt></ruby>するということがよくある。
english: Disputes among heirs over an inheritance often develop simply  because there is no will.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: お金がなかったばかりに、映画もろくに見られなかった。
reading: お金がなかったばかりに、映画もろくに見られなかった。
english: I couldn't even go to the movies just because I didn't have any money.
extra_notes: ろくに here means sufficient

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 医者の処置が不適切であったばかりに、助かる患者を死なせてしまった。
reading: 医者の処置が不適切であったばかりに、助かる患者を死なせてしまった。
english: Simply because the doctor's treatment wasn't appropriate, the  patient, who could have been helped, lost his life.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 彼女は黒人女性であったばかりに人種差別と性差別を受けた。
reading: 彼女は黒人女性であったばかりに人種差別と性差別を受けた。
english: She suffered from racial and sexual discrimination simply because she was a black woman.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 姑との関係が悪いばかりに嫁はストレスが溜まり、よく病気になった。
reading: 姑との関係が悪いばかりに<ruby title="嫁(よめ)"><rb>嫁</rb><rt>よめ</rt></ruby>はストレスが溜まり、よく病気になった。
english: Just because her relationship with her mother-in-law was so bad, she often fell ill from the stress.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 両親が甘かったばかりに子供たちは自立心がない。
reading: 両親が甘かったばかりに子供たちは<ruby title="自立(じりつ)"><rb>自立</rb><rt>じりつ</rt></ruby><ruby title="心(しん)"><rb>心</rb><rt>しん</rt></ruby>がない。
english: Those children don't have a sense of independence just because they are spoiled so much by their parents.

translation: Simply because; just because; simply on account of ~
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a single factor causes a negative situation.
japanese: 高校時代の教育がよくなかったばかりに、大学に入ってから苦労している。
reading: 高校時代の教育がよくなかったばかりに、大学に入ってから苦労している。
english: I'm having a difﬁcult time in college all because my high school education wasn't good.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 環境保護を支持していればこそ植林に力を入れているのだ。
reading: 環境保護を支持していればこそ植林に力を入れているのだ。
english: It is only because I support environmental protection so much that I put my efforts into planting trees.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 「愛」があればこそ生きる喜びがある。
reading: 「愛」があればこそ生きる喜びがある。
english: Only because there is love is there joy for living.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 膨大な電力の需要があればこそ原子力発電を開発せざるを得ないのだ。
reading: 膨大な電力の需要があればこそ原子力発電を開発せざるを得ないのだ。
english: It is precisely because of the enormous demand for electricity that we cannot help but develop atomic power.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 中近東の和平を熱望すればこそ、国連の役割を強化しなければならないと思う。
reading: 中近東の和平を熱望すればこそ、国連の役割を強化しなければならないと思う。
english: It is only because I hope for peace in the Middle East as much  as I do that I think we have to strengthen the role of the UN.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 親友であればこそ君にこんなにずけずけとものが言えるんだよ。
reading: 親友であればこそ君にこんなにずけずけとものが言えるんだよ。
english: It is precisely because I'm your close friend that I can talk straight to you like this.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: ビジョンを持った社長であればこそ社員は張り切って仕事をしているのだ。
reading: ビジョンを持った社長であればこそ社員は張り切って仕事をしているのだ。
english: It is precisely because he is a president with vision that his employees are working with high spirits.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 人は一人でいるのが寂しければこそペットを飼うのだ。
reading: 人は一人でいるのが寂しければこそペットを飼うのだ。
english: To the extent a person feels lonely when he/she is alone, he/she will keep a pet.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 言論が自由であればこそ民主主義は育っていくのである。
reading: 言論が自由であればこそ民主主義は育っていくのである。
english: To the extent that there is freedom of speech, democracy will keep growing.

translation: it is precisely because ~ that ~; only because ~; to the extent that ~
explanation: A conjunction that emphasizes a reason
japanese: 僕がこんなことを言うのも君を心配すればこそだ。
reading: 僕がこんなことを言うのも君を心配すればこそだ。
english: It is because I am really anxious about you that I am telling you such a thing.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 芝生に入るべからず。
reading: 芝生に入るべからず。
english: Keep off the lawn. (literally: Don't enter the lawn.)

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 原子力はエネルギー源として欠くべからざるものとなっている。
reading: 原子力はエネルギー源として欠くべからざるものとなっている。
english: Atomic energy has become indispensable as a source of energy.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 電車の中で携帯電話を使うべからず。
reading: 電車の中で携帯電話を使うべからず。
english: You ought not to use your cell phone in the train.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: ここで犬に糞をさせるべからず。
reading: ここで犬に糞をさせるべからず。
english: Don't let your dog go (to the bathroom) here.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 授業中に隣の者と私語をするべからず。
reading: 授業中に隣の者と私語をするべからず。
english: You shouldn't whisper in class with your neighbours.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 無用の者、入るべからず。
reading: 無用の者、入るべからず。
english: No trespassing. (literally: Don't enter if you aren't on business.)

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 虚言を吐くべからず。
reading: 虚言を吐くべからず。
english: Don't tell a lie.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: インターネットを使う時の「べからず集」からいくつか引用してみよう。プライバシーを公開するべからず。怪しげなファイルに触れるべからず。インターネットの向こうに人間がいることを忘れるべからず。
reading: インターネットを使う時の「べからず<ruby title="集(しゅう)"><rb>集</rb><rt>しゅう</rt></ruby>」からいくつか引用してみよう。プライバシーを公開するべからず。怪しげなファイルに触れるべからず。インターネットの向こうに人間がいることを忘れるべからず。
english: Let me quote some of the Internet don'ts from this collection: Don't make private matters public. Don't touch suspicious-looking files. Don't forget that there are people on the other end of the Internet.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 彼は学生として許すべからざる行為を行ったとして大学を退学させられた。
reading: 彼は学生として許すべからざる行為を行ったとして大学を退学させられた。
english: He was expelled from college because he committed an unpardonable act for a student.

grammar_point: べからず・べからざる
translation: Shouldn’t; must not; ought not to ~; cannot; don’t ~
explanation: An auxiliary verb that indicates a strong prohibition.
japanese: 奇跡とは一言にしていえば、起こり得べからざる事実が起こる場合のことである。
reading: 奇跡とは一言にしていえば、<ruby title="起(お)"><rb>起</rb><rt>お</rt></ruby>こり<ruby title="得(え)"><rb>得</rb><rt>え</rt></ruby>べからざる<ruby title="事実(じじつ)"><rb>事実</rb><rt>じじつ</rt></ruby>が起こる場合のことである。
english: In a nutshell, a miracle is when a thing that should not be able to occur happens.

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: この大学では、二学期制に変えるべく今準備が進められている。
reading: この大学では、<ruby title="二(に)"><rb>二</rb></ruby><ruby title="学期(がっき)"><rb>学期</rb></ruby><ruby title="制(せい)"><rb>制</rb><rt>せい</rt></ruby>に変えるべく今準備が進められている。
english: At this university, preparation is under way for changing (the current system) to a semester system.

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: K社は人件費を削減すべく大規模なリストラを行う予定だ。
reading: K社は人件費を削減すべく大規模なリストラを行う予定だ。
english: K Company plans to execute large-scale restructuring in order  to reduce personnel expenses.

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: 当社はいち早くお客さまの多様なニーズに対応すべく、最新の設備を導入してまいりました。
reading: 当社はいち早くお客さまの多様なニーズに対応すべく、最新の設備を<ruby title="導入(どうにゅう)"><rb>導入</rb><rt>どうにゅう</rt></ruby>してまいりました。
english: We (literally: our company) have installed the newest facilities so that we can quickly respond to our customers' various needs.

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: 二児の母親ですが、現在フットセラピストとして独立すべく勉強中です。
reading: <ruby title="二(に)"><rb>二</rb><rt>に</rt></ruby><ruby title="児(じ)"><rb>児</rb><rt>じ</rt></ruby>の母親ですが、現在フットセラピストとして独立すべく勉強中です。
english: I am a mother of two children and am currently studying to start my own practice as a foot therapist (literally: to become independent as a foot therapist).

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: 本学は、経済的な理由で大学教育を受けられない海外の優秀な学生にその機会を与えるべく、奨学金を供与している。
reading: 本学は、経済的な理由で大学教育を受けられない海外の<ruby title="優秀(ゆうしゅう)"><rb>優秀</rb><rt>ゆうしゅう</rt></ruby>な学生にその機会を与えるべく、奨学金を供与している。
english: Our university provides scholarships to give educational opportunities to excellent students from overseas who cannot go on to higher education for ﬁnancial reasons.

translation: In order to; to; for the purpose of; for; so that ~ (can)
explanation: The verb modification form of the auxiliary bekida, which is used to indicate a purpose or aim.
japanese: 重大な事故が発生した場合、お客様の安全確保を最優先として迅速な対応を行うべく、社内システムの見直しを行いました。
reading: 重大な事故が発生した場合、お客様の安全確保を最優先として迅速な対応を行うべく、社内システムの見直しを行いました。
english: We have re-examined our internal systems so that we can rapidly respond to major accidents in a manner that gives highest priority to customer safety.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 私が一億円の家を買うなど、望むべくもない。
reading: 私が一億円の家を買うなど、望むべくもない。
english: It is impossible for me to hope to buy a hundred million yen house.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 十年前に別れた女性の居どころなど知るべくもない。
reading: 十年前に別れた女性の居どころなど知るべくもない。
english: There is no way for me to know the whereabouts of the woman I split up with 10 years ago.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 終戦後は海外旅行など望むべくもなかった。
reading: 終戦後は海外旅行など望むべくもなかった。
english: In the post-war era, one could not even hope to make a trip abroad.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 初日は雨で山頂は望むべくもなかったが、翌日はすっかり晴れ、白銀に輝く山は神々しい美しさだった。
reading: 初日は雨で山頂は望むべくもなかったが、翌日はすっかり晴れ、白銀に輝く山は神々しい美しさだった。
english: On the ﬁrst day, it was impossible to view the summit because  of rain, but on the following day, the weather was perfect, and the mountain was shining silvery white. It was sublimely beautiful.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 我々のような弱いチームが優勝候補のTチームに勝つべくもない。
reading: 我々のような弱いチームが優勝候補のTチームに勝つべくもない。
english: A weak team like ours simply cannot be expected to beat Team T, one of the competitors for the championship.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: その事件が起きた時私は海外旅行中で知るべくもなかった。
reading: その事件が起きた時私は海外旅行中で知るべくもなかった。
english: The incident occurred when I was traveling abroad, so there was no way for me to know about it.

translation: Impossible; there is no way for someone to ~; cannot be expected to
explanation: A phrase meaning “it is impossible to do something”
japanese: 最近は多忙で本を読む時間など期待すべくもない。
reading: 最近は多忙で本を読む時間など期待すべくもない。
english: Lately I've been so busy that it is impossible to ﬁnd (literally: to expect to have) time to read books.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: 第二次世界大戦は起こるべくして起こった。
reading: 第二次世界大戦は起こるべくして起こった。
english: World War II occurred, exactly as expected.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: 彼は大統領になるべくしてなった。
reading: 彼は<ruby title="大統領(だいとうりょう)"><rb>大統領</rb><rt>だいとうりょう</rt></ruby>になるべくしてなった。
english: He became president, exactly as expected.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: 真知子は高校の時から成績が抜群によく、東大に入るべくして入ったという感じである。
reading: <ruby title="真知子(まちこ)"><rb>真知子</rb><rt>まちこ</rt></ruby>は高校の時から成績が抜群によく、東大に入るべくして入ったという感じである。
english: Machiko distinguished herself as an excellent academic achiever in her high school days. As expected, she got into the University of Tokyo.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: 二人は性格、趣味、学歴がすべて一致している。二人は結婚するべくして結婚したのだ。
reading: 二人は性格、趣味、学歴がすべて一致している。二人は結婚するべくして結婚したのだ。
english: Their personalities, hobbies and academic backgrounds match.  Just as (we) expected, those two got married.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: ゆみの運転はいつも荒っぽいし、エンジンもブレーキも調子が悪かった。事故は起こるべくして起こった。
reading: ゆみの運転はいつも荒っぽいし、エンジンもブレーキも調子が悪かった。事故は起こるべくして起こった。
english: Yumi's driving was always wild, and her car's engine and brakes weren't in good condition. An accident occurred, exactly as expected.

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: あの会社は経営がずさんだったから倒産するべくして倒産したのだ。
reading: あの会社は経営が杜撰だったから倒産するべくして倒産したのだ。
english: The management of the company has been so careless that it went bankrupt, exactly as expected

translation: Exactly as expected
explanation: A phrase used when something occurs/occured exactly as expected
japanese: 私は自宅が海のすぐ近くのため、釣り好きになるべくしてなったと言っていいでしょう。
reading: 私は自宅が海のすぐ近くのため、釣り好きになるべくしてなったと言っていいでしょう。
english: You could say that I became fond of ﬁshing, exactly as expected, because my home is so close to the ocean.

translation: Incidentally; in this connection
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that what follows is additional information related to the previously stated main theme
japanese: 彼の小説はポストモダン的で大変気に入ってる。解釈が読み手にゆだねられているところがよい。ちなみに、去年の作品はベストセラー第一位だった。
reading: 彼の小説はポストモダン的で大変気に入ってる。解釈が読み手にゆだねられているところがよい。ちなみに、去年の作品はベストセラー第一位だった。
english: I love his postmodern novels. I like the way he leaves the interpretation to the reader. Incidentally, his work published last year topped the bestseller list.

translation: Incidentally; in this connection
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that what follows is additional information related to the previously stated main theme
japanese: 先週から上野の美術館で印象派の絵画展が開かれており、ルノアール、モネ、マネなどの代表作が出品されている。ちなみに、入場料は大人三千五百円、子供千円である。
reading: 先週から上野の<ruby title="美術館(びじゅつかん)"><rb>美術館</rb><rt>びじゅつかん</rt></ruby>で印象派の絵画展が開かれており、ルノアール、モネ、マネなどの代表作が出品されている。ちなみに、入場料は大人三千五百円、子供千円である。
english: An exhibit of Impressionists' paintings opened last week at an art museum in Ueno and representative works of Renoir, Monet and Manet, among others, are displayed there. Incidentally, the admission fee is 3,500 yen for adults and 1,000 yen for children.

translation: Incidentally; in this connection
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that what follows is additional information related to the previously stated main theme
japanese: 先月の26日と２７日に東京で国際建築学会が開かれた。建築の人間化というのがテーマだった。ちなみに参加者数は約千五百人だった。
reading: 先月の26日と27日に東京で国際<ruby title="建築(けんちく)"><rb>建築</rb><rt>けんちく</rt></ruby>学会が開かれた。建築の人間化というのがテーマだった。ちなみに参加者数は約千五百人だった。
english: On the 26th and 27th of last month, there was an international conference on architecture in Tokyo. The theme of the conference was "The humanization of architecture." Incidentally, about 1,500 people attended.

translation: Incidentally; in this connection
explanation: A conjunction to indicate that what follows is additional information related to the previously stated main theme
japanese: アメリカの大学教授は7年に一度、研究休暇をとることができる。その期間中に研究を集中的にやるわけである。ちなみにその間の給料は、休暇が一年間なら半額、半年ならば全額が支給される。
reading: アメリカの大学教授は7年に一度、<ruby title="研究(けんきゅう)"><rb>研究</rb></ruby><ruby title="休暇(きゅうか)"><rb>休暇</rb><rt>きゅうか</rt></ruby>をとることができる。その期間中に研究を集中的にやるわけである。ちなみにその間の給料は、休暇が一年間なら半額、半年ならば全額が支給される。
english: A professor in the U.S. can take a sabbatical every seventh year. During that period the professor concentrates on research. Incidentally, professors are paid half their salary for a year's sabbatical or their full salary for half a year.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 若いうちに本を読めるだけ読んでおいた方がよい。
reading: 若いうちに本を読めるだけ読んでおいた方がよい。
english: You'd better read as many books as you can while you are young.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 食べるだけ食べると、礼も言わずに帰ってしまった。
reading: 食べるだけ食べると、礼も言わずに帰ってしまった。
english: After he had eaten as much as he wanted, he went home without even thanking me.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 食べたいだけ食べるのが僕の主義です。
reading: 食べたいだけ食べるのが僕の主義です。
english: My principle is to eat as much as I want to.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: うちの子は背が伸びるだけ伸びた感じです。
reading: うちの子は背が伸びるだけ伸びた感じです。
english: It looks like my child has grown as much as he is going to.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 修士論文の内容についてできるだけ詳しく話して下さい。
reading: 修士論文の内容についてできるだけ詳しく話して下さい。
english: Tell me about your MA thesis in as much detail as possible.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 昨日は寿司屋で寿司を食べられるだけ食べた。
reading: 昨日は寿司屋で寿司を食べられるだけ食べた。
english: Yesterday I ate as much sushi as I could at a sushi restaurant.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 学生のうちに海外に行けるだけ行ってみたいと思います。
reading: 学生のうちに海外に行けるだけ行ってみたいと思います。
english: I think I want to go abroad as often as I can while I'm a student.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 運転手さん、飛行機に遅れてしまうので、飛ばせるだけ飛ばして下さい。
reading: 運転手さん、飛行機に遅れてしまうので、飛ばせるだけ飛ばして下さい。
english: Driver, I may miss my plane, so please go as fast as you can.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 前から抱いていた不服を言うだけ言ったらすうっとした。
reading: 前から抱いていた不服を言うだけ言ったらすうっとした。
english: When I freely gave vent to my longstanding complaints (literally: complained as much as I wanted to) I felt so relieved.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: お金は使うだけ使っても故障の少ない車が買いたい。
reading: お金は使うだけ使っても故障の少ない車が買いたい。
english: I'd like to buy a trouble-free car no matter how much it costs.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 昨日は寝たいだけ寝たので、心も体もすっきりした。
reading: 昨日は寝たいだけ寝たので、心も体もすっきりした。
english: Yesterday I slept as much as I wanted, so my mind and body are refreshed.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 痛風になった時、私の足の親指は腫れるだけ腫れてしまいました。
reading: 痛風になった時、私の足の親指は腫れるだけ腫れてしまいました。
english: When I got gout my big toe really swelled up (literally: as much as it could swell).

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: 今まで都会の真ん中でとてもうるさかったので、今度はできるだけ静かなところに住みたいです。
reading: 今まで都会の真ん中でとてもうるさかったので、今度はできるだけ静かなところに住みたいです。
english: Until now, we have lived in the midst of a noisy town, so now we would like to live in as quiet a place as possible.

translation: As much as; as ~ as possible; as much as one wants
explanation: A particle meaning “to the extent that someone (can/wants to) do something or something can happen”.
japanese: この会社に入りたい理由、また入社したらやりたいことは何ですか。できるだけ具体的にお書き下さい。
reading: この会社に入りたい理由、また入社したらやりたいことは何ですか。できるだけ具体的にお書き下さい。
english: Why do you want to join this company and what do you want to do once you join the company? Please write down your answers in as much detail as possible.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: 彼女は人気女優だけあってすごいうちに住んでいる。
reading: 彼女は人気女優だけあってすごいうちに住んでいる。
english: She is a popular actress and, as one would expect, she lives in  a splendid house.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: 聡子は小さい時からバレエをしているだけあって体が柔らかい。
reading: 聡子は小さい時からバレエをしているだけあって体が柔らかい。
english: Satoko has practiced ballet since she was a child, so naturally  she is limber.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: 彼が自慢するだけあって、彼のオフィスからの眺めはちょっとほかでは見られないものだった。
reading: 彼が自慢するだけあって、彼のオフィスからの眺めはちょっとほかでは見られないものだった。
english: He is proud of his ofﬁce for good reason: the view is something  you could never see from other ofﬁces.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: 日本は火山国だけあって年中地震が絶えない。
reading: 日本は火山国だけあって年中地震が絶えない。
english: Japan is a volcanic country, and, as one would expect, earthquakes occur constantly throughout the year.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: この壷はさすが名工の作品だけあって色や形に気品がある
reading: この壷はさすが名工の作品だけあって色や形に気品がある。
english: This pot was made by a master craftsman, so naturally its colours and shape are graceful.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: オーストラリア南端の地だけあって八月のメルボルンは実に寒い。
reading: オーストラリア南端の地だけあって八月のメルボルンは実に寒い。
english: Melbourne, as one would expect from its location in the southern comer of Australia, is really cold in August.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: さすが日本一の花火大会と言われるだけあって、規模も芸術性も素晴らしいものだった。
reading: さすが日本一の花火大会と言われるだけあって、規模も芸術性も素晴らしいものだった。
english: As one would expect from what people call the best fireworks in Japan, the scale and artistry were both amazing. (ii) People call it the best ﬁreworks show in Japan for good reason: Its scale and artistic quality were both excellent.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: あのレストランは笠原さんのお薦めだけあって美味しかったです。
reading: あのレストランは 笠原[かさはら]さんのお薦めだけあって美味しかったです。
english: Ms. Kasahara recommended that restaurant, and, as one would expect, the food was delicious. (ii) Ms. Kasahara recommended that restaurant for good reason: The food was delicious. [Ms. Kasahara is known as a gourmet.]

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: この鞄は高いだけあって材料もいいし作りもしっかりしている。
reading: この鞄は高いだけあって材料もいいし作りもしっかりしている。
english: As one would expect from the (high) price of this bag, the material is good and it's also well made. (ii) This bag is expensive for good reason: The material is good and it's well made.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); for good reason
explanation: A phrase that means “and as one would expect” or “for good reason”.
japanese: あのうるさい社長が信頼するだけあって、彼の秘書は実に有能だ。
reading: あのうるさい社長が信頼するだけあって、彼の秘書は実に有能だ。
english: As you can guess from the way that president, who is so critical, relies on his secretary, she is truly capable. (ii) That president, who is so critical, relies on his secretary for good reason: She is truly capable.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: ビルは元フットボール選手だけに足が速い。
reading: ビルは元フットボール選手だけに足が速い。
english: Bill used be a football player and, as one would expect, he runs fast.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: ホワイトさんは長い間日本に住んでいただけに日本のことをよく知っている。
reading: ホワイトさんは長い間日本に住んでいただけに日本のことをよく知っている。
english: Mr. White lived in Japan for a long time, so naturally he is very  familiar with things related to Japan.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 彼は元アナウンサーだけに声がよく通る。
reading: 彼は元アナウンサーだけに声がよく 通[とお]る。
english: He used to be an announcer, so naturally his voice carries well.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 山内先生は英語の先生だっただけに英語の文法をよく知っている。
reading: 山内先生は英語の先生だっただけに英語の文法をよく知っている。
english: As one would expect from her having been an English teacher,  Ms. Yamauchi is very knowledgeable about English grammar.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 雅人は一人っ子だけについ甘やかしてしまう。
reading: 雅人[まさと]は一人っ子だけについ甘やかしてしまう。
english: Masato is our only child and, as you might expect, we tend to spoil him (without meaning to).

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 孝夫は学生時代に相撲をやっていただけに体が大きい。
reading: 孝夫[たかお]は学生時代に相撲をやっていただけに体が大きい。
english: Takao was a sumo wrestler when he was a student, so naturally he is big.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: チェンさんはアメリカの大学を卒業しただけに英語が上手だ。
reading: チェンさんはアメリカの大学を卒業しただけに英語が上手だ。
english: Ms. Chen graduated from an American university, so naturally her English is good.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: ハリスさんは日本の大学で長い間教えていただけに日本の大学の問題をよく知っている。
reading: ハリスさんは日本の大学で長い間教えていただけに日本の大学の問題をよく知っている。
english: Mr. Harris taught at a university in Japan for a long time so, as one would expect, he knows a lot about the problems of Japanese universities.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 春樹はジャズが何よりも好きなだけにジャズ・ミュージシャンの名前をよく知っている。
reading: 春樹はジャズが何よりも好きなだけにジャズ・ミュージシャンの名前をよく知っている。
english: Haruki likes jazz more than anything, so naturally he knows the  names of many jazz musicians.

translation: And as one would expect; so (naturally); because
explanation: A phrase that carries the idea “as one would expect”.
japanese: 彼女がとても忙しいことをよく知っているだけに、彼女にはこの仕事を頼みにくい。
reading: 彼女がとても忙しいことをよく知っているだけに、彼女にはこの仕事を頼みにくい。
english: Because we know she's very busy, it's hard to ask her to do this job.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 明子は韓国語がとても上手だ。さすがに二年間ソウル大学に留学していただけのことはある。
reading: 明子[あきこ]は韓国語がとても上手だ。さすがに二年間ソウル大学に留学していただけのことはある。
english: Akiko is very good at Korean. She didn't study at Seoul National University for two years for nothing.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 毎日一キロ以上水泳をしてきただけのことはあって、彼は九十歳の今もかくしゃくとしている。
reading: 毎日一キロ以上水泳をしてきただけのことはあって、彼は九十歳の今もかくしゃくとしている。
english: He has been swimming more than 1 kilometre every day. No wonder he is still in such good shape at 90 (years old).

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 山田先生は日本語の教え方が上手だ。アメリカの大学で二十年近く日本語を教えていらしただけのことはある。
reading: 山田先生は日本語の教え方が上手だ。アメリカの大学で二十年近く日本語を教えていらしただけのことはある。
english: Professor Yamada is good at teaching Japanese. She didn't teach it at a U.S. university for nearly 20 years for nothing.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: チャンさんは世界の経済状況をよくつかんでいる。経済コンサルタントとして世界を飛び回っているだけのことはある。
reading: チャンさんは世界の経済状況をよくつかんでいる。経済コンサルタントとして世界を飛び回っているだけのことはある。
english: Ms. Chang has a ﬁrm grip on the world economic situation. She doesn't ﬂy around the world as a ﬁnance consultant for nothing.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 隣の家の子供達は実に行儀がいい。親のしつけが厳しいだけのことはある。
reading: 隣の家の子供達は実に行儀がいい。親のしつけが厳しいだけのことはある。
english: The kids next door have very good manners. Strict parental discipline explains it.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 田中はさして才能もないのに昇進が早い。上司への気配りが巧みなだけのことはある。
reading: 田中はさして才能もないのに昇進が早い。上司への気配りが巧みなだけのことはある。
english: Tanaka's rise has been quick, although he isn't that talented. His careful attention to his boss explains it.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: アインシュタインの理論は二十一世紀の現在でも死んでいない。さすがに二十世紀最大の物理学者と言われるだけのことはある。
reading: アインシュタインの理論は二十一世紀の現在でも死んでいない。さすがに二十世紀最大の物理学者と言われるだけのことはある。
english: Einstein's theory is still alive, even in the 21st century. No wonder he is called the greatest physicist of the 20th century.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 幸い日本で日本語を勉強して、かなり話せるようになりました。日本に行っただけのことはありました。
reading: 幸い日本で日本語を勉強して、かなり話せるようになりました。日本に行っただけのことはありました。
english: Fortunately, I studied Japanese in Japan and now I can speak it fairly well. I didn't go to Japan for nothing.

translation: Don’t do something for nothing; ~ explains it; no wonder; it’s no surprise
explanation: A phrase expressing an evaluative comment regarding how something is contributing to an expected, remarkable result.
japanese: 彼は若いころから俳句を作ってきただけのことはあって、さすがに自然に対する観察眼が鋭い。
reading: 彼は若いころから俳句を作ってきただけのことはあって、さすがに自然に対する観察眼が鋭い。
english: He has been composing haiku since his younger days. No wonder he has such a sharp eye for nature.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: あの時の大きな失敗は思い出すだに恥ずかしい。
reading: あの時の大きな失敗は思い出すだに恥ずかしい。
english: Just remembering the big mistake I made at that time makes me feel embarrassed.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: 私の体脂肪率は今どれくらいあるんだろうか。考えるだに、恐ろしい。
reading: 私の体脂肪率は今どれくらいあるんだろうか。考えるだに、恐ろしい。
english: I wonder what my percentage of body fat is right now? Just the thought of it scares me.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: 私が父の真似をしていたら、どんなことになったか。想像するだに心細いものがあります。
reading: 私が父の真似をしていたら、どんなことになったか。想像するだに心細いものがあります。
english: What would have happened if I had followed in my father's footsteps? Just imagining it makes me feel uneasy.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: この猛暑の中、友人は避暑地で休日を楽しんでいるとは、思うだにうらやましい。
reading: この猛暑の中、友人は避暑地で休日を楽しんでいるとは、思うだにうらやましい。
english: It makes me envious just to think that my friend is enjoying her holiday at a summer resort while I'm stuck here in this scorching heat.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: アメリカの指導者たちの大多数は9.11のようなテロが発生する可能性を考慮だにしなかったらしい。
reading: アメリカの指導者たちの大多数は9/11のようなテロが発生する可能性を考慮だにしなかったらしい。
english: It appears that the majority of U.S. leaders didn't even consider the possibility that terrorism like 9/11 could occur.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: 若者たちは毎晩スケートボードで駅前のロータリーを走り回っているのに、警官は注意だにしない。
reading: 若者たちは毎晩スケートボードで駅前のロータリーを走り回っているのに、警官は注意だにしない。
english: Every night the young men skateboard around the rotary in front of the station, but the police don't even warn them not to.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: 小林は何か心配事があるのか、青い顔をして、こちらを一瞥だにしなかった。
reading: 小林は何か心配事があるのか、青い顔をして、こちらを一瞥だにしなかった。
english: Kobayashi looked pale and didn't even cast a glance in my direction, seeming as if something was bothering him.

translation: Just; (not) even
explanation: A particle indicating that something expressed by the preceding verb alone produces a certain feeling or the meaning “(not) even doing something; doesn’t even occur”.
japanese: 人間は他の種を絶滅させるような環境を作り出しても一顧だにしない。
reading: 人間は他の種を<ruby title="絶滅(ぜつめつ)"><rb>絶滅</rb><rt>ぜつめつ</rt></ruby>させるような環境を作り出しても一顧だにしない。
english: Even though humans have created an environment that drives other species into extinction, they don't give it a second thought.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 庭にはすみれだのチューリップだのつつじだの、花がたくさん咲いていた。
reading: 庭にはすみれだのチューリップだのつつじだの、花がたくさん咲いていた。
english: In the garden, many ﬂowers such as violets, tulips, azaleas and others, were in bloom.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 学生たちは食堂のご飯がまずいだの、授業がつまらないだのと、いつも不平を言っている。
reading: 学生たちは食堂のご飯がまずいだの、授業がつまらないだのと、いつも不平を言っている。
english: The students are always complaining that the food at the cafeteria isn't good, or their classes are boring and so on.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 僕はそばだの、うどんだの、ラーメンだのといった麺類が大好きだ。
reading: 僕はそばだの、うどんだの、ラーメンだのといった麺類が大好きだ。
english: I like noodles such as soba, udon and ramen.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 今の高校生は携帯電話だのコンピュータゲームだのにはまっている。
reading: 今の高校生は携帯電話だのコンピュータゲームだのにはまっている。
english: High school students now are addicted to things like cell phones and computer games.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 彼は僕が飲みに行こうかと誘っても、いつも頭が痛いだの、約束があるだのと言い訳をする。
reading: 彼は僕が飲みに行こうかと誘っても、いつも頭が痛いだの、約束があるだのと言い訳をする。
english: Whenever I invite him to go out for a drink, he has an excuse: he's got a headache or another appointment or something.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 彼女は仕事が好きだから結婚しても仕事を続けるだの、家庭生活と職業を両立できるだのと主張していた。
reading: 彼女は仕事が好きだから結婚しても仕事を続けるだの、家庭生活と職業を両立できるだのと<ruby title="主張(しゅちょう)"><rb>主張</rb><rt>しゅちょう</rt></ruby>していた。
english: She used to claim that she would keep working after she got married because she liked her work and could manage both family life and her career.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 彼女は自分がテニスが上手だの、ピアノがうまいだのと自慢ばかりしている。
reading: 彼女は自分がテニスが上手だの、ピアノがうまいだのと自慢ばかりしている。
english: She's always boasting that she's good at tennis and (also good  at) piano, and things like that.

translation: And (~ and); or (~ or); and things like that
explanation: A conjunction that lists nouns/quotes inexhaustively.
japanese: 受験生たちは塾だのテストだのと忙しい毎日を送っている。
reading: 受験生たちは塾だのテストだのと忙しい毎日を<ruby title="送(おく)"><rb>送</rb><rt>おく</rt></ruby>っている。
english: Students preparing for the examination are spending busy days  stuffed with cram school and tests.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: A:どうして会ってくれないの？B:だって、僕、今日忙しいんだ。
reading:
A:どうして会ってくれないの？
B:だって、僕、今日忙しいんだ。
english:
A: Why won't you see me? 
B: 'Cause I'm busy today.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese:
A:母：さや、どうしてもっとご飯食べないの。
B:さや：だっておなか、空いていないもん。
reading:
A:母：さや、どうしてもっとご飯食べないの。
B:さや：だっておなか、空いていないもん。
english:
Mother: Saya, how come you aren't eating more? 
 Saya: 'Cause I'm not hungry.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: A:妻：健太さん、今日はどうしてゴルフに行かないの。B:夫：だって、今日は客と銀座で昼食をとらなきゃならないんだ。
reading:
A:妻：健太さん、今日はどうしてゴルフに行かないの。
B:夫：だって、今日は客と銀座で昼食をとらなきゃならないんだ。
english: Wife: Kenta, how come you're not going golﬁng today? Husband: 'Cause I have to have lunch with a client in Ginza.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: A:路子、笑い事じゃないよ。B:だって二人の話しているのを聞いていると面白いんだもん。
reading:
A:路子みちこ、笑い事じゃないよ。
B:だって二人の話しているのを聞いていると面白いんだもん。
english:
A: Michiko, it's no laughing matter! 
B: But it's so funny just listening to you guys talk.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: もう３５度じゃ驚かないね。だって連日気温は３５度、３６度、３７度が当たり前の状態なんだもの。
reading: もう３５度じゃ驚かないね。だって連日気温は３５度、３６度、３７度が当たり前の状態なんだもの。
english: 35°(C) isn't anything surprising, because the temperature is normally 35°(C), 36°(C), 37°(C) every day.

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: A:なんで、僕だけ烏龍茶なんですか？ B:だって、お前はまだ未成年だろう？
reading:
A:なんで、僕だけ烏龍茶なんですか？ 
B:だって、お前はまだ未成年だろう？
english:
A: How come you put oolong tea only in my glass? 
B: Because you are not an adult yet, are you?

explanation: A conjunction that indicates a reason
japanese: 彼がいるはずの店にやってきたが、入るべきかどうか迷っていた。だって、ここに来るとろくなことがない。
reading: 彼がいるはずの店にやってきたが、入るべきかどうか迷っていた。だって、ここに来るとろくなことがない。
english: I came to the restaurant where I knew he'd be, but I wondered whether I should go in or not, because something bad always occurs there.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: この翻訳なら私にだってできます。
reading: この翻訳なら私にだってできます。
english: (i) I could do this translation, too. (literally: If it's this translation, I can do it, too. (ii) Even I could do this translation.  (literally: If it's this translation, even I can do it.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: 数多いお客さんの中には難しい人だっている。
reading: 数多いお客さんの中には難しい人だっている。
english: In a large group of customers, there will be difficult people(, too).

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: 今からだって遅くないから、彼に電話してみたら?
reading: 今からだって遅くないから、彼に電話してみたら?
english: It's not too late now (literally: It is not late, even from now), so why don't you call him?

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: そんないい仕事だったら誰だってやりたい。
reading: そんないい仕事だったら誰だってやりたい。
english: Anyone would want a good job like that.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: 君だって子供のことは考えているだろう。
reading: 君だって子供のことは考えているだろう。
english: You're thinking about your children, too, aren't you? (ii) Even you are thinking about your children, aren't you?

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: それは部長だって知らないことだ。
reading: それは部長だって知らないことだ。
english: This is something the division head doesn't know, either. (ii) This is something even the division head doesn't know.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: 最近は忙しいので日曜だって休めないことが多い。
reading: 最近は忙しいので日曜だって休めないことが多い。
english: Because I have been very busy recently, often I haven't been able to take a day off on Sunday, either. (ii) Because I've been very busy recently, often I haven't even taken Sunday off.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: もういい加減に許してやれよ。彼だって悪気があってやったわけじゃないんだから。
reading: もういい加減に許してやれよ。彼だって悪気があってやったわけじゃないんだから。
english: Why don't you forgive him now? He didn't mean anything bad when he did it.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: これからだって彼には色々頼まないといけないんだから、そんなに彼のことを悪く言うもんじゃないよ。
reading: これからだって彼には色々頼まないといけないんだから、そんなに彼のことを悪く言うもんじゃないよ。
english: We're going to have to ask a lot of favours from him from now  on, too, so don't talk so ill of him.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: この間だってそうだ。僕のノートを借りたまま言われるまで返さないんだ。
reading: この間だってそうだ。僕のノートを借りたまま言われるまで返さないんだ。
english: It happened the other day, too. He borrowed my notebook and  didn't return it until I asked him to.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: 一度だって僕が君に嘘をついたことがあるかい。
reading: 一度だって僕が君に嘘をついたことがあるかい?
english: Have I ever lied to you, even once?

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: それだけ日本語を知っていたら一人だってできるからやってごらん。
reading: それだけ日本語を知っていたら一人だってできるからやってごらん。
english: If you know that much Japanese, you can do it even on your own, so give it a try.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
