japanese: 私は子供が欲しがるものは何だって買い与えた。今から思えばそれは間違いだったかもしれない。
reading: 私は子供が欲しがるものは何だって買い与えた。今から思えばそれは間違いだったかもしれない。
english: I bought my child anything he wanted. When I think about it now, I feel that might have been the wrong thing to do.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: どっちだって同じだろう。早く決めちゃえよ。
reading: どっちだって同じだろう? 早く決めちゃえよ。
english: lt's the same either way, isn't it (literally: Any one of which is the same, isn't it)? Make up your mind, quick.

explanation: A particle meaning “too” or “even”.
japanese: いつだってあなたのやりたいことを優先してきたじゃないの。
reading: いつだってあなたのやりたいことを優先してきたじゃないの。
english: Haven't I always given priority to what you want to do?

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: たとえ社長であれ、そのような行為は許されない。
reading: たとえ社長であれ、そのような行為は許されない。
english: Even the (company) president shouldn't be allowed to do things like that. (literally: Even if it is the president, such conduct should not be allowed.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: どんな問題であれ、必ず私に報告して下さい。
reading: どんな問題であれ、必ず私に報告して下さい。
english: Whatever kind of problem it may be, please report it to me without fail.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 通勤がいかに不便であれ、今の家を変わるつもりはない。
reading: 通勤がいかに不便であれ、今の家を変わるつもりはない。
english: No matter how inconvenient my commute is, I do not intend to move (literally: from our current house).

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: いかに難しい問題であれ、彼ならきっと解決できるはずだ。
reading: いかに難しい問題であれ、彼ならきっと解決できるはずだ。
english: No matter how difficult the problem may be, he certainly should  be able to solve it.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: この練習は、たとえ数分間であれ、毎日することが大切です。
reading: この練習は、たとえ数分間であれ、毎日することが大切です。
english: It is important to practice this every day, even if it is only for a few minutes.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 彼の提言は、たとえそれが実行不可能であれ、聞くに値する。
reading: 彼の提言は、たとえそれが実行不可能であれ、聞くに値する。
english: His suggestions are worth listening to even if they cannot be carried out.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 暗号技術については、たとえ短期間の使用であれ、その輸出入を規制している国があります。
reading: 暗号技術については、たとえ短期間の使用であれ、その輸出入を規制している国があります。
english: Some countries regulate the export and import of cryptographic technology, even when it is intended for short-term use.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 何事であれ、その仕事で生活するとなれば楽なものはない。
reading: 何事であれ、その仕事で生活するとなれば楽なものはない。
english: Whatever kind it may be, if you make a living from it, there is no such thing as easy work.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: どのような理由であれ、著作物を複製する時は、著作権の侵害に注意しなければならない。
reading: どのような理由であれ、著作物を複製する時は、著作権の侵害に注意しなければならない。
english: Whatever the reason (for making copies) may be, when you duplicate copyrighted materials, you have to be careful not to infringe on the copyright.

translation: Even; even if; even though; no matter what/who/how/etc.~ may be; whatever/whoever/etc.~ may be
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 当時の軍隊では上官の命令がいかに理不尽であれ、下級兵はそれに従うしかなかったのだ。
reading: 当時の軍隊では上官の命令がいかに理不尽であれ、下級兵はそれに従うしかなかったのだ。
english: In the army in those days, no matter how unreasonable the senior ofﬁcers' commands, the soldiers under them had no choice but to obey them.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 男性であれ、女性であれ、人間としての権利は同じはずだ。
reading: 男性であれ、女性であれ、人間としての権利は同じはずだ。
english: Whether one is a man or a woman, one's rights as a human being should be the same.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 有名であれ、無名であれ、人生は短い。
reading: 有名であれ、無名であれ、人生は短い。
english: No matter if one is famous or nameless, life is short.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: ここは春であれ秋であれ美しいから観光に向いている。
reading: ここは春であれ秋であれ美しいから観光に向いている。
english: Whether spring or fall, this place is beautiful, so it is a good sightseeing spot.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: イスラエル人であれ、パレスチナ人であれ、平和を望んでいることでは同じはずだ。
reading: イスラエル人であれ、パレスチナ人であれ、平和を望んでいることでは同じはずだ。
english: Whether an Israeli or a Palestinian, their hope for peace should be the same.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 彼は和食であれ、洋食であれ、何でも食べてしまう。
reading: 彼は和食であれ、洋食であれ、何でも食べてしまう。
english: He eats anything, Japanese- or Western-style food.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: あの学者は哲学であれ、言語学であれ、人類学であれ、同じように精通している。
reading: あの学者は哲学であれ、言語学であれ、人類学であれ、同じように精通している。
english: That scholar is well-versed in a number of subjects, whether it be philosophy, linguistics or anthropology.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 平日であれ、週末であれ、健太は仕事に追われている。
reading: 平日であれ、週末であれ、 健太[けんた]は仕事に追われている。
english: Whether weekday or weekend, Kenta is always pressed by work.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 写真であれ、コンピュータグラフィックスであれ、求められたイメージを表現するのは大変難しい。
reading: 写真であれ、コンピュータグラフィックスであれ、求められたイメージを表現するのは大変難しい。
english: Whether in photography or in computer graphics, it is hard to produce an image as requested.

translation: Whether X or Y; be it X or Y; or
explanation: A structure that means “no matter which one is the case”
japanese: 場所が便利であれ、不便であれ、マイホームが持ちたい。
reading: 場所が便利であれ、不便であれ、マイホームが持ちたい。
english: Whether the location is convenient or inconvenient, I'd like to have my own house.

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 幼稚園児｛でも/じゃ｝あるまいし一人で学校に行きなさい。
reading: 幼稚園児｛でも/じゃ｝あるまいし一人で学校に行きなさい。
english: You are not a kindergarten pupil. Go to school by yourself.

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: フランスに行けるわけ｛でも/じゃ｝あるまいし、どうしてそんなにフランス語を勉強しているの。
reading: フランスに行けるわけ｛でも/じゃ｝あるまいし、どうしてそんなにフランス語を勉強しているの。
english: There's no way you can get to France. How come you're studying French so hard?

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 学生じゃあるまいし、仕事でも探したらどうだ。
reading: 学生じゃあるまいし、仕事でも探したらどうだ。
english: You are not a student; why don't you look for a job or something?

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 政治家でもあるまいし、嘘をつかないで下さい。
reading: 政治家でもあるまいし、嘘をつかないで下さい。
english: You aren't a politician. Don't tell a lie

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 犬じゃあるまいし、そんなに人にじゃれるようなことはやめなさい。
reading: 犬じゃあるまいし、そんなに人にじゃれるようなことはやめなさい。
english: You aren't a dog, you know. Stop being so playful with me

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: お葬式でもあるまいし、そんなにしゅんとしないで下さい。
reading: お葬式でもあるまいし、そんなにしゅんとしないで下さい。
english: It's not a funeral service. Don't be depressingly quiet!

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 現地の英語学校に入ったら、日本人の女の子が英語で「分からないことがあったら聞いて」と言ってきた。授業中じゃあるまいし、日本語で言えばいいのに。
reading: 現地の英語学校に入ったら、日本人の女の子が英語で「分からないことがあったら聞いて」と言ってきた。授業中じゃあるまいし、日本語で言えばいいのに。
english: When I went inside an English language school there, a Japanese girl said to me in English, “If you have anything you don't understand, ask me.” It wasn't even a class. She could have talked to me in Japanese!

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: このうどん屋では注文してから、うどんがくるまで長く待たされ、いらいらする。フランス料理でもあるまいし…。
reading: このうどん屋では注文してから、うどんがくるまで長く待たされ、いらいらする。フランス料理でもあるまいし…。
english: At this noodle shop it takes so long from the time you order noodles to the time they bring them to the table that I get annoyed. It's not French cuisine, you know.

grammar_point: でも・じゃあるまいし
translation: You are not ~, so; it isn’t ~, so
explanation: A phrase expressing the speaker’s belief that someone’s action is based on mistaken identity of himself/herself and also expressing the speaker’s critical comments about someone’s behaviour.
japanese: 息子は音楽を専攻しているんじゃあるまいし、ギターばかり弾いていて卒業できるんだろうか。
reading: 息子は音楽を専攻しているんじゃあるまいし、ギターばかり弾いていて卒業できるんだろうか。
english: My son isn't majoring in music, but he's always playing the guitar. I wonder if he can ﬁnish school.

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: そんなことは子供でも誰でも知っているよ。
reading: そんなことは子供でも誰でも知っているよ。
english: That sort of thing is known even to a child or to anybody.

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: 私って漫画でも何でも読み出すと止まらないタイプなの。
reading: 私って漫画でも何でも読み出すと止まらないタイプなの。
english: I'm the type of person who cannot stop reading manga or whatever once I start.

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: Tシャツの大きさはMでもLでも、どちらでもかまいません。
reading: Tシャツの大きさはMでもLでも、どちらでもかまいません。
english: It doesn't matter to me whether (the size of) the T-shirt is M or L (literally: or whichever).

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: 欧米では、バスでも地下鉄でも、車椅子でどこへでも行ける。どうしても助けが必要な時は、誰かに頼めばたとえ日本人にでも誰にでも手を貸してくれる。
reading: 欧米では、バスでも地下鉄でも、車椅子でどこへでも行ける。どうしても助けが必要な時は、誰かに頼めばたとえ日本人にでも誰にでも手を貸してくれる。
english: In Europe and America you can go anywhere in a wheelchair by bus or by subway. When you ﬁnd you need help, just ask anyone. People there will lend a hand to anyone who asks, Japanese or otherwise.

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: 最近のパーティーは留学生でも日本人でも誰でも参加自由で、来る人は飲み物、音楽、自分の作った料理を持ってくるというようにしています.
reading: 最近のパーティーは留学生でも日本人でも誰でも参加自由で、来る人は飲み物、音楽、自分の作った料理を持ってくるというようにしています.
english: At our recent parties we've made it so all students, whether Japanese or from abroad, can freely participate and ask everyone to bring drinks, music or food they've made.

translation: ~ whatever; ~ whoever; ~ whenever; ~ whichever
explanation: A structure indicating that what is expressed in the main/subordinate clause is applicable to anyone, anything, any place or any time.
japanese: A:すみませんが、来週、検査の結果が出たら、もう一度来ていただけますか。B:分かりました。来週でもいつでも伺います。
reading:
A:すみませんが、来週、検査の結果が出たら、もう一度来ていただけますか。
B:分かりました。来週でもいつでも伺います。
english:
A: Can you come back next week when we get the result of the examination? 
B: Yes, I can come next week or whenever.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 彼はどちらかと言うと教育者というより（は）研究者だ。
reading: 彼はどちらかと言うと教育者というより（は）研究者だ。
english: He is more like a researcher than an educator.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 私はどちらかと言うと外向的というより（は）内向的だ。
reading: 私はどちらかと言うと外向的というより（は）内向的だ。
english: I'm more of an introvert than an extrovert.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 母はどちらかと言うと、大人しい方です。
reading: 母はどちらかと言うと、大人しい方です。
english: My mother is rather on the quiet side.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 洋食も悪くはないが、どちらかと言うと、和食の方がいい。
reading: 洋食も悪くはないが、どちらかと言うと、和食の方がいい。
english: It's not that Western-style food is bad, but I prefer Japanese-style food.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 山本は決して呑気な男ではない。どちらかと言うと神経質な男だ。
reading: 山本は決して呑気な男ではない。どちらかと言うと神経質な男だ。
english: Yamamoto is far from easy-going. He's more of a nervous type of guy.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 君はどちらかと言うと楽観的というよりは悲観的だね。
reading: 君はどちらかと言うと楽観的というよりは悲観的だね。
english: You're more pessimistic than optimistic, aren't you?

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 彼女はどちらかと言うと、仕事に生きるタイプで、精神的にも強い人間だと思う。
reading: 彼女はどちらかと言うと、仕事に生きるタイプで、精神的にも強い人間だと思う。
english: More than anything, I think she's the type who lives to work, and is quite mentally strong.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: あの大学はどちらかと言うと入学がやさしい方だ。
reading: あの大学はどちらかと言うと入学がやさしい<ruby title="方(ほう)"><rb>方</rb><rt>かた</rt></ruby>だ。
english: Entering that college is rather easy.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 私はパーティーなどの集まりでは、どちらかと言うと、話し役ではなく、聞き役の方だ。
reading: 私はパーティーなどの集まりでは、どちらかと言うと、話し役ではなく、聞き役の方だ。
english: At parties or other gatherings I am more of a listener than a speaker.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: どちらかと言うと、夏目漱石よりは芥川龍之介の方が私の趣味に合っている。
reading: どちらかと言うと、夏目漱石よりは芥川 龍之介[りゅうのすけ]の方が私の趣味に合っている。
english: If I had to choose I'd say Ryunosuke Akutagawa matches my tastes better than Soseki Natsume.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: この大学の日本語の学生は、どちらかと言うと目的を持って勉強しているというよりは趣味として日本語を勉強している。
reading: この大学の日本語の学生は、どちらかと言うと目的を持って勉強しているというよりは趣味として日本語を勉強している。
english: At this university the students of Japanese are studying it more as a hobby than for a certain objective.

translation: Rather; more like ~; more of ~; rather on the ~ side; rather than otherwise; more ~ than ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker/writer chooses one alternative over another in a tentative way.
japanese: 彼はどちらかと言うと話すより書く方が得意だ
reading: 彼はどちらかと言うと話すより書く方が得意だ。
english: He is better at writing than speaking.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうか私の言い分を聞いて下さい。
reading: どうか私の言い分を聞いて下さい。
english: Please listen to what I have to say.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうか私を見捨てないで下さい。
reading: どうか私を見捨てないで下さい。
english: Please don't abandon me.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうかお許し下さい。
reading: どうかお許し下さい。
english: Please forgive me.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうか本当のことを話して下さい。
reading: どうか本当のことを話して下さい。
english: Please tell me the truth.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうかお体を大切に（して下さい）。
reading: どうかお体を大切に（して下さい）。
english: Please take good care of yourself.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: どうかお気を使わないで下さい。
reading: どうかお気を使わないで下さい。
english: Please don't bother.

translation: Please
explanation: An adverb indicating a polite yet very strong request.
japanese: 向寒の折から、どうかお体にお気をつけ下さい。
reading: 向寒の折から、どうかお体にお気をつけ下さい。
english: It's getting cold, so please take good care of yourself.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 自分のことで精一杯で、人のことなど考えるどころではない。
reading: 自分のことで精一杯で、人のことなど考えるどころではない。
english: I'm so busy with my own things that I simply can't think of other people's matters (right now).

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 年末なのに多忙で、海外旅行（をする）どころではなかった。
reading: 年末なのに多忙で、海外旅行（をする）どころではなかった。
english: I was so busy toward the end of the year that there was no way I could travel abroad.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 津波で愛する娘を亡くしたので、悲しいどころではない。死にたい気持ちだ。
reading: 津波で愛する娘を亡くしたので、悲しいどころではない。死にたい気持ちだ。
english: I lost my beloved daughter in the tsunami. I'm not just sad. I feel like killing myself.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 定年になっても暇どころではない。毎日野菜作りに精を出している。
reading: 定年になっても暇どころではない。毎日野菜作りに精を出している。
english: I have retired, but I can't say I have any free time. Every day I put all my energy into vegetable gardening.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 毎日の生活に汲々としていて、株を買うどころではありません。
reading: 毎日の生活に汲々としていて、株を買うどころではありません。
english: My everyday life is so tight financially that I simply can't consider buying stocks.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 私はテニスが大好きだが、最近大怪我をしてテニスどころではない。
reading: 私はテニスが大好きだが、最近大怪我をしてテニスどころではない。
english: I love tennis, but I sustained a severe injury recently, and playing tennis is now out of the question.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: A:おい、今晩、飲みに行こうか。B:それどころじゃないんだ。妻が入院したんだ.
reading:
A:おい、今晩、飲みに行こうか。
B:それどころじゃないんだ。妻が入院したんだ。
english:
A: Hey, why don't we go drinking tonight?
B: No way. My wife has been hospitalized.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 目下寝たきりの母の介護で、外出どころではないんです。
reading: 目下寝たきりの母の介護で、外出どころではないんです。
english: Right now I'm taking care of my bed-ridden mother, so I simply  don't have time to leave the house.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: このところ学生の修論指導で研究どころじゃないんだよ。
reading: このところ学生の修論指導で研究どころじゃないんだよ。
english: I've been advising MA students on their theses lately and I simply don't have time to do research.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: A:妻：あなた、この週末に熱海の温泉にでも行かない？ B:夫：それどころじゃないんだよ。原稿の締め切りが来週の月曜日なんだ。
reading:
A:妻：あなた、この週末に 熱海[あたみ]の温泉にでも行かない？ 
B:夫：それどころじゃないんだよ。原稿の締め切りが来週の月曜日なんだ。
english:
Wife: Honey, why don't we go to the hot springs in Atami this weekend?

Husband: No way! The deadline for the manuscript is next Monday.
extra_notes: Atami onsen in Shizuoka is a major onsen resort town near Tokyo

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: スイカマラソンは、レース中やレース後にスイカが食べられる。でも、走り終わったら、へとへとで、とてもスイカを食べるどころではないそうだ。
reading: スイカマラソンは、レース中やレース後にスイカが食べられる。でも、走り終わったら、へとへとで、とてもスイカを食べるどころではないそうだ。
english: In the watermelon marathon, runners can eat watermelon during or after the race, but I hear that when they're done running they're so tired that there's no way they can eat the watermelon.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: 今日は非常に暑かった。もう暖かいどころではない。
reading: 今日は非常に暑かった。もう暖かいどころではない。
english: It was extremely hot today. You can't just call it warm anymore.

translation: Cannot; be simply impossible; simply don’t/doesn’t have time; be far from ~; anything but ~; no way; far from; be out of question
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action/state is simply impossible due to an adverse situation.
japanese: ものすごい排気ガスを吸っているから、健康どころではない。
reading: ものすごい排気ガスを吸っているから、健康どころではない。
english: I am breathing in all these awful exhaust fumes, so I am far from being healthy.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: この二つの文章は言い方は違えども、言おうとしていることは同じだ。
reading: この二つの文章は言い方は違えども、言おうとしていることは同じだ。
english: Although the way in which these two compositions are written is different, their claims are the same.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 行けども行けども人家が見えてこない。
reading: 行けども行けども人家が見えてこない。
english: No matter how far we go, we still can't see houses.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 私は知識はあれども学才がなく、今後学問の世界でやっていけるとは思えない。
reading: 私は知識はあれども学才がなく、今後学問の世界でやっていけるとは思えない。
english: Although I have (a good amount of) knowledge, I have no scholastic talent, so I don't think I can survive in academia (in the future).

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 汲めども尽きぬ泉のように、彼は次々と美しい曲を書き続けた。
reading: 汲めども尽きぬ泉のように、彼は次々と美しい曲を書き続けた。
english: Just like a spring which never dries up no matter how much water is taken out, he kept writing beautiful songs, one after another.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 見慣れているものというのは、視れども見えずで、毎日見ていてもその問題に気がつかないものである。
reading: 見慣れているものというのは、視れども見えずで、毎日見ていてもその問題に気がつかないものである。
english: Regarding things you are used to seeing, even though you look at them, you don't really see them. So, you don't notice their problems even if you see them every day.
extra_notes: 視る = 見る

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 親といえども子供に対してそんな横暴は許されない。
reading: 親といえども子供に対してそんな横暴は許されない。
english: Even parents shouldn't be allowed to exercise such tyranny over their children.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 老いたりといえども、伊藤先生はまだ動きも速く、この剣道場の人は誰も先生に勝つことができない。
reading: 老いたりといえども、伊藤先生はまだ動きも速く、この剣道場の人は誰も先生に勝つことができない。
english: Although Master Ito is old, he still moves swiftly, and no one at this Japanese fencing school can beat him.

translation: Even though; although; though; no matter how much/often/hard/etc.
explanation: A conjunction that indicates concession based on an actual state or action.
japanese: 走れども走れども雪原が続いているだけだった。
reading: 走れども走れども雪原が続いているだけだった。
english: No matter how far I drove, the snow (literally: snowﬁelds) never ended.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: 私には小説などはどうにも書けない。
reading: 私には小説などはどうにも書けない。
english: I’d never be able to write something like a novel, no matter how hard I try.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: この作文は間違いがひどくてどうにも直しようがない。
reading: この作文は間違いがひどくてどうにも直しようがない。
english: This composition has such awful mistakes that there is no way to ﬁx it.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: 最近は携帯がないとどうにも仕事にならない。
reading: 最近は携帯がないとどうにも仕事にならない。
english: Lately we can’t work without a cell phone.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: この書類は印刷が悪くてどうにも読めない。
reading: この書類は印刷が悪くてどうにも読めない。
english: This document is printed so poorly, there’s no way we can read it.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: あの人はあまりにも内気でどうにも好きになれない。
reading: あの人はあまりにも内気でどうにも好きになれない。
english: He is so introverted, I don’t think I’ll ever grow to like him.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: 人の悪口をかげで言うなどということはどうにも許せない。
reading: 人の悪口をかげで言うなどということはどうにも許せない。
english: I can’t possibly tolerate someone speaking ill of me behind my back.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: 会社経営で破綻寸前まで来るとどうにも救いようがない。
reading: 会社経営で破綻寸前まで来るとどうにも救いようがない。
english: When a company’s management is on the verge of bankruptcy, there is no way to salvage it.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: これだけストレスが溜まると、どうにも解消しようがない。
reading: これだけストレスが溜まると、どうにも解消しようがない。
english: When stress piles up this much, there’s no way to relieve it.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: バブル経済崩壊後の日本の経済の低迷ぶりはひどいものだけれど、どうにもならない。
reading: バブル経済崩壊後の日本の経済の低迷ぶりはひどいものだけれど、どうにもならない。
english: The Japanese economic slump since the bubble economy burst is terrible, but there is no help for it.

translation: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all
explanation: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
japanese: 色々お礼の言葉を書こうと思っていたのですが、どうにも言葉になりません。今まで本当にありがとうございました。
reading: 色々お礼の言葉を書こうと思っていたのですが、どうにも言葉になりません。今まで本当にありがとうございました。
english: I was going to send you a thank-you note but I just couldn’t ﬁnd the words to say what I meant. Thank you very much!

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 磁石のN極（またはS極）同士は反発する。
reading: 磁石のN極（またはS極）同士は反発する。
english: North poles (or south poles) of magnets repel each other.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 高校時代の友達同士で海外旅行に行くことになった。
reading: 高校時代の友達同士で海外旅行に行くことになった。
english: We’ve decided that we high school friends will travel abroad together.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 決勝戦はアルゼンチン選手同士の対決になった。
reading: 決勝戦はアルゼンチン選手同士の対決になった。
english: The ﬁnal turned out to be a battle between (two) Argentine players.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: このケーブルを使うと、パソコン同士を直接つないで高速ファイル転送をすることができる。
reading: このケーブルを使うと、パソコン同士を直接つないで高速ファイル転送をすることができる。
english: With this cable, you can connect personal computers directly and transfer files (from one computer to another) at high speed.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: タバコを吸う者同士は、何となく相手に親しみを感じやすい。
reading: タバコを吸う者同士は、何となく相手に親しみを感じやすい。
english: Smokers somehow ﬁnd it easier to feel close to each other.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 面白いことに、隣り合った国同士は仲が悪いことが多い。
reading: 面白いことに、隣り合った国同士は仲が悪いことが多い。
english: Interestingly, adjacent countries often have poor relations with each other.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 茨城沖で貨物船同士が衝突、二人死亡四人行方不明。
reading: 茨城沖で貨物船同士が衝突、二人死亡四人行方不明。
english: [Newspaper headline] Two cargo ships collide off (the coast of) Ibaraki; two killed, four missing.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: これは分子同士が衝突して起こる現象だ。
reading: これは分子同士が衝突して起こる現象だ。
english: This is a phenomenon caused by molecules colliding with each other.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 男同士で旅行に行ってもつまらない。
reading: 男同士で旅行に行ってもつまらない。
english: It’s boring if we travel together as a group of all men.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 韓国では１９９７年に法律が変わり同姓同士でも自由に結婚できるようになった。
reading: 韓国では１９９７年に法律が変わり同姓同士でも自由に結婚できるようになった。
english: In South Korea the laws changed in 1997, and people with the same family name can freely marry each other now.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: この国ではいとこ同士の結婚は法的に認められている。
reading: この国ではいとこ同士の結婚は法的に認められている。
english: In this country, marriage between cousins is legally recognized.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 何も知らない者同士が話し合ってもいい答えは出てこない。
reading: 何も知らない者同士が話し合ってもいい答えは出てこない。
english: Discussions among those who don’t know anything will never lead to a good solution.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: 日本ではバレンタインデーに女の子が男の子にチョコレートを渡して愛を告白するのが一般的になっていますが、アメリカでは夫婦や恋人同士はもちろんのこと、友達や家族同士でもこの日、愛を言葉にします。
reading: 日本ではバレンタインデーに女の子が男の子にチョコレートを渡して愛を告白するのが一般的になっていますが、アメリカでは夫婦や恋人同士はもちろんのこと、友達や家族同士でもこの日、愛を言葉にします。
english: It is common in Japan for girls to confess their love to boys on St. Valentine’s Day by giving them chocolates. However, in America, not only married couples and lovers but also friends and family members verbally express  their love to each other.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: このタンパク質は細胞同士を結びつけるセメントのような役割をする。
reading: このタンパク質は細胞同士を結びつけるセメントのような役割をする。
english: This protein acts like cement in joining cells.

translation: Each other; between/among (things/people of the same kind, group, etc.); together; with
explanation: A sufﬁx that adds the meaning of “the same things/people”.
japanese: モンスター同士を戦わせるコンピュータゲームが間もなく発売される。
reading: モンスター同士を戦わせるコンピュータゲームが間もなく<ruby title="発売(はつばい)"><rb>発売</rb><rt>はつばい</rt></ruby>される。
english: A computer game in which monsters fight against each other (literally: which makes monsters fight against each other) will be on sale soon.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 彼は朝起きるが早いか、シャワーを浴びた。
reading: 彼は朝起きるが早いか、シャワーを浴びた。
english: As soon as he woke up he took a shower.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 彼女は日本に着くが早いか友人に電話をかけた。
reading: 彼女は日本に着くが早いか友人に電話をかけた。
english: The moment she arrived in Japan she called her friend.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 彼は私がいるのを見るが早いか、部屋を出て行ってしまった。
reading: 彼は私がいるのを見るが早いか、部屋を出て行ってしまった。
english: As soon as he saw me, he left the room.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 猫は鼠を捕まえるが早いか、食べ始めた。
reading: 猫は鼠を捕まえるが早いか、食べ始めた。
english: The moment the cat caught the mouse, it started to eat it.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 電車はジョンが乗るが早いか、動き始めた。
reading: 電車はジョンが乗るが早いか、動き始めた。
english: As soon as John got on the train, it started to move.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: ディーンは奇麗な女の子を見かけるが早いか、近寄って行って話しかけた。
reading: ディーンは奇麗な女の子を見かけるが早いか、近寄って行って話しかけた。
english: No sooner did Dean see the pretty girl than he approached her and started talking to her.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: 子供たちはパンが焼けるが早いか、全部食べてしまった。
reading: 子供たちはパンが焼けるが早いか、全部食べてしまった。
english: As soon as the bread was baked, the children ate it all.

translation: As soon as; the moment; no sooner ~ than
explanation: A conjunction indicating that as soon as something happens, something else happens.
japanese: ひったくりは金を奪うが早いか、自転車で逃げた。
reading: ひったくりは金を奪うが早いか、自転車で逃げた。
english: As soon as the thief (literally: snatcher) snatched my money, he ﬂed by bike.

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 社が会社ならもう少しましな給料を出してくれるのだろうが。
reading: 社が会社ならもう少しましな給料を出してくれるのだろうが。
english: If my company were a really good one, it would probably pay a bit better salary, but…

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 大学が大学ならもっといい教育が受けられて、いい就職もできたのだろう。
reading: 大学が大学ならもっといい教育が受けられて、いい<ruby title="就職(しゅうしょく)"><rb>就職</rb><rt>しゅうしょく</rt></ruby>もできたのだろう。
english: If the university had been a really good one, it would have given me a much better education, and I could have gotten a good job.

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 友人が友人なら、役に立つ助言をしてくれたかもしれません。
reading: 友人が友人なら、役に立つ助言をしてくれたかもしれません。
english: If your friend were a true friend, he might have given you useful advice.

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 季節が季節なら、ここは素晴らしい観光地なんですが、今は寒すぎて観光には向いていないんですよ。
reading: <ruby title="季節(きせつ)"><rb>季節</rb><rt>きせつ</rt></ruby>が季節なら、ここは素晴らしい観光地なんですが、今は寒すぎて観光には向いていないんですよ。
english: If we were here in the right season, this place would be a wonderful sightseeing spot, but now it's not a good place to take tourists because it is too cold.

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 時代が時代なら、そんな服装も悪くはないのかもしれないが、今ではおよそ古臭い。
reading: 時代が時代なら、そんな服装も悪くはないのかもしれないが、今ではおよそ古臭い。
english: At the appropriate time, that sort of clothing would not have looked so bad, but now it is too old-fashioned looking.

translation: If someone/something were a really good/appropriate one; if something is right
explanation: A structure presenting a counterfactual situation which indicates that things would be better if something were really good or appropriate.
japanese: 世が世なら、こんな情けない生活はしなくても済んだのに。
reading: 世が世なら、こんな情けない生活はしなくても済んだのに。
english: If I were living in a really good time, I wouldn't need to live such a miserable life.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 人生は旅のごとし。
reading: 人生は旅のごとし。
english: Life is like a journey.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: その無謀な行為は火中に飛び込む｛が/かの｝ごとし。
reading: その無謀な行為は火中に飛び込む｛が/かの｝ごとし。
english: Acting recklessly like that is like jumping into the ﬁre.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 彼女はモナリザのごとくいつも微笑んでいる。
reading: 彼女はモナリザのごとくいつも微笑んでいる。
english: She is like Mona Lisa, always smiling.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: x氏は超人のごとき人だ。
reading: x氏は超人のごとき人だ。
english: Mr. X is like a superman.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 彼女は僕のことを全然覚えていないかのごとき様子だった。
reading: 彼女は僕のことを全然覚えていないかのごとき様子だった。
english: She looked as if she didn't remember me at all.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 光陰矢のごとし。
reading: 光陰矢のごとし。
english: Time ﬂies like an arrow. (literally: Time is like an arrow.)

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 人生は航海のごとし。
reading: 人生は航海のごとし。
english: Life is like a voyage.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 東京人は万人走っているかのごとし。
reading: <ruby title="東京(とうきょう)"><rb> 東京</rb><rt>とうきょう</rt></ruby><ruby title="人(じん)"><rb>人</rb><rt>じん</rt></ruby>は 万人[ばんにん]走っているかのごとし。
english: Tokyoites all look as if they were always running.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 日本の経済は、上述のごとく、今後しばらくは回復しない見込みである。
reading: 日本の経済は、上述のごとく、今後しばらくは回復しない見込みである。
english: As stated above, the Japanese economy is not expected to recover for some time.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 彼女は女王のごとく芸能界に君臨している。
reading: 彼女は女王のごとく芸能界に君臨している。
english: She dominates the show business world as if she were a queen.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 課長は当然のごとく女性の職員にお茶くみをさせている。
reading: 課長は当然のごとく女性の職員にお茶汲みをさせている。
english: The section chief has (literally: makes) female staff members serve tea as if it were it were a matter of course.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 夢のごとき新婚生活の後に悲劇が訪れた。
reading: 夢のごとき新婚生活の後に悲劇が<ruby title="訪(おとず)"><rb>訪</rb><rt>おとず</rt></ruby>れた。
english: Their dream-like, newly-wedded bliss was followed by tragedy.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 彼は平社員なのに社長であるかのごとき言動をするのでみんなに嫌われている。
reading: 彼は平社員なのに社長であるかのごとき言動をするのでみんなに嫌われている。
english: He is just a regular employee, but he talks and acts as if he were the president, so nobody likes him.

translation: Like; look like
explanation: An auxiliary adjective that indicates a resemblance of something/someone to something/someone or indicates how something/someone appears to speaker/writer.
japanese: 子供が大人のような犯罪を犯すがごとき風潮は何が原因なのだろうか。
reading: 子供が大人のような犯罪を犯すがごとき風潮は何が原因なのだろうか。
english: I wonder what causes trends such as children committing adult crimes.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: 携帯電話は便利な反面、わずらわしいこともある。
reading: 携帯電話は便利な反面、煩わしいこともある。
english: While cell phones are convenient, they are also sometimes annoying.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: この国は個人の意思が尊重される反面、グループとしてのまとまりが弱い。
reading: この国は個人の<ruby title="意思(いし)"><rb>意思</rb><rt>いし</rt></ruby>が<ruby title="尊重(そんちょう)"><rb>尊重</rb><rt>そんちょう</rt></ruby>される反面、グループとしての纏まりが弱い。
english: In this society, while the individual's will is respected, group unity is weak.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: この仕事は面白くて収入もいいが、(その)反面、忙しくて自分の時間がなかなか持てないという問題もある。
reading: この仕事は面白くて収入もいいが、(その)反面、忙しくて自分の時間がなかなか持てないという問題もある。
english: This job is interesting and pays well; on the other hand, being so busy, I hardly ever (literally: cannot) have time for myself and that is a problem.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: ここは海産物が安く、また種類も多くて本土では食べられない魚もあります。（しかし、）（その）反面、野菜や果物は高いです。
reading: ここは海産物が安く、また種類も多くて本土では食べられない魚もあります。（しかし、）（その）反面、野菜や果物は高いです。
english: Seafood is cheap and plentiful in variety here, and there are also ﬁsh that you cannot eat on the mainland. On the other hand, fruits and vegetables are expensive.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: この仕事は厳しい反面、勉強になることも多い。
reading: この仕事は厳しい反面、勉強になることも多い。
english: While this job is tough, it teaches me a lot.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: 外食は手軽な反面、栄養が偏る恐れがある。
reading: 外食は手軽な反面、栄養が偏る恐れがある。
english: While eating out is easy, it can lead to an unbalanced diet.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: この地域は商業や医療、文化施設などの利用が便利な反面、自然環境はあまり望めない。
reading: この地域は<ruby title="商業(しょうぎょう)"><rb>商業</rb><rt>しょうぎょう</rt></ruby>や医療、文化施設などの利用が便利な反面、<ruby title="自然(しぜん)"><rb>自然</rb><rt>しぜん</rt></ruby> <ruby title="環境(かんきょう)"><rb>環境</rb><rt>かんきょう</rt></ruby>はあまり<ruby title="望(のぞ)"><rb>望</rb><rt>のぞ</rt></ruby>めない。
english: In this region, while the commercial, medical and cultural facilities are convenient to use, you cannot expect much in terms of the natural environment.
extra_notes: 望む here means, "expect; hope (for…); look for…; look forward to sth."

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: アメリカンタイプのホテル建物も比較的新しく部屋が機能的な反面、雰囲気に欠けるところがあります。
reading: アメリカンタイプのホテル建物も比較的新しく部屋が機能的な反面、雰囲気に欠けるところがあります。
english: While American-style hotels provide functional rooms in relatively new buildings, they are somehow lacking in (good) atmosphere.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: ポリエステルのカーテンは縮みにくく、熱にも強いが、反面、静電気が発生して汚れがつきやすい。
reading: ポリエステルのカーテンは縮みにくく、熱にも強いが、反面、静電気が発生して<ruby title="汚(よご)"><rb>汚</rb><rt>よご</rt></ruby>れがつきやすい。
english: While polyester curtains do not shrink easily and are heat-resistant, they attract dirt easily because of static electricity.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: この磁石は優れた磁気特性を持ち、機械強度が大きい。反面、錆びやすく、高温での便用には適さない。
reading: この磁石は優れた磁気特性を持ち、機械強度が大きい。反面、錆びやすく、高温での使用には適さない。
english: This magnet has superb magnetic properties and excellent mechanical strength. On the other hand, it rusts easily and should not be used at high temperatures.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: 理想主義はある面ではすばらしいが、その反面、それが行きすぎていろいろな問題が起こることもある。
reading: 理想主義はある面ではすばらしいが、その反面、それが行きすぎていろいろな問題が起こることもある。
english: Idealism is wonderful in some ways; on the other hand, when it goes too far, it can cause problems.

translation: While; on the other hand
explanation: A conjunction used to contrast the positive and negative sides of something/someone.
japanese: インターネットの恋人探しサービスを使う場合、出会いという観点から見ると、こちらから積極的にアプローチをする方法はかなり効果的です。その反面、個人情報の流出という危険性もあります。
reading: インターネットの恋人探しサービスを使う場合、出会いという<ruby title="観点(かんてん)"><rb>観点</rb><rt>かんてん</rt></ruby>から見ると、こちらから積極的にアプローチをする方法はかなり効果的です。その反面、個人情報の流出という危険性もあります。
english: When you use online services to search for a boyfriend or girlfriend, taking the active approach is quite effective in terms of meeting people. On the other hand, there is the danger that your personal information will be leaked.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: 今年の冬も暖冬だと言われていたが、はたして暖冬だった。
reading: 今年の冬も暖冬だと言われていたが、はたして暖冬だった。
english: They said this would be a warm winter, and indeed it has been.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: はたして日本の教育は改革される(の)だろうか。
reading: はたして日本の教育は改革される(の)だろうか。
english: I wonder if Japanese education will really be reformed at all.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: はたして女性の地位が改憲されるとしても時間がかかるだろう。
reading: はたして女性の地位が改憲されるとしても時間がかかるだろう。
english: Even if women's status improves, as expected, it may take time.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: 東西ドイツ統一はいずれは起こると思っていたが、はたして予想通り起きた。
reading: 東西ドイツ統一はいずれは起こると思っていたが、はたして予想通り起きた。
english: I thought that sooner or later East and West Germany would be united, and, just as I expected, it happened.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: 二人の仲は周知の事実で、いつかはゴールインすると思っていたら、はたしてその通りになった。
reading: 二人の仲は周知の事実で、いつかはゴールインすると思っていたら、はたしてその通りになった。
english: Everyone knew about their relationship, and, just as we expected, they got married.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: そこのレストランは魚料理で有名だったが、はたして思った通りの美味しい料理が出てきた。
reading: そこのレストランは 魚料理[さかなりょうり]で有名だったが、はたして思った通りの美味しい料理が出てきた。
english: That restaurant was famous for its ﬁsh dishes, and the food really was as good as we had expected.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: イスラエルをパレスチナ両国の間にはたして真の平和が訪れるのだろうか。
reading: イスラエルをパレスチナ両国の間にはたして真の平和が訪れるのだろうか。
english: I wonder if real peace will indeed come to Israel and the Palestinian territories.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: はたして日本経済は近い将来に復興するだろうか。
reading: はたして日本経済は近い将来に復興するだろうか。
english: I wonder if the Japanese economy really will revive in the near future.

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: ２１世紀ははたしてどの国の世紀になるのだろうか。
reading: ２１世紀ははたしてどの国の世紀になるのだろうか。
english: To which country will the 21st century really belong?

translation: Just as ~ though; as expected; really; in fact; sure enough; indeed; at all; lo and behold
explanation: An adverb indicating that something occurred as the writer expected, or expressing in a concession clause the writer’s strong doubt.
japanese: はたして政治家たちの言うことがうわべだけのことであるとしても、多少の真実はあると考えたい。
reading: はたして政治家たちの言うことが上辺だけのことであるとしても、多少の真実はあると考えたい。
english: Even if what politicians say really is just lip service, I would like to think that there is some truth in it.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: イラクへの攻撃はアメリカの孤立を招き、ひいてはイスラム社会全体との戦争に発展していく恐れがある。
reading: イラクへの攻撃はアメリカの孤立を招き、ひいてはイスラム社会全体との戦争に発展していく恐れがある。
english: There is fear that an attack against Iraq will bring about American isolation, and eventually will lead to a war with Muslim society as a whole.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 彼は同僚にライバル意識、ひいては殺意すら抱いていた。
reading: 彼は同僚にライバル意識、ひいては殺意すら抱いていた。
english: He regarded his colleague as a rival, even to the point of considering murder.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 東京の産業構造を適切に転換していくことが、東京の産業を活性化させ、ひいては日本の経済力の強化につながっていく。
reading: 東京の産業構造を適切に転換していくことが、東京の産業を活性化させ、ひいては日本の経済力の強化につながっていく。
english: Addressing the appropriate restructuring of Tokyo's industrial structure will revitalize Tokyo's industry and eventually lead to the strengthening of the Japanese economy.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 「誰もが自分自身の能力を最大限に活かして、自ら積極的に新しいことにチャレンジして、よりよく生きていく」という考えを、日本国内、ひいては世界に波及させたいと思っています。
reading: 「誰もが自分自身の能力を最大限に活かして、自ら積極的に新しいことにチャレンジして、よりよく生きていく」という考えを、日本国内、ひいては世界に波及させたいと思っています。
english: Life will improve when everyone uses their abilities to the greatest extent and actively takes on new challenges. I would like this idea to spread within Japan, and, eventually, in the world.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 世間では、企業経営から、教育、ひいては犯罪まで、話題はインターネットが独占しているという感じです。
reading: 世間では、企業経営から、教育、ひいては犯罪まで、話題はインターネットが独占しているという感じです。
english: Throughout society, in business management and education, and even crime, it seems like the Internet is the dominant topic of discussion.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 道を歩いていて、奇妙な姿の人が向こうから歩いてくると、不安な気持ちになる。これは人間、ひいては動物の防衛機能の一つだろう。
reading: 道を歩いていて、奇妙な姿の人が向こうから歩いてくると、不安な気持ちになる。これは人間、ひいては動物の防衛機能の一つだろう。
english: If a person with a strange ﬁgure walks towards you on the street, you might start to feel uneasy. This is a human defence mechanism, and is used even by animals.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: 栄養価が高い旬のものをおいしく食べることは、ひいては病気を予防する。
reading: 栄養価が高い旬のものをおいしく食べることは、ひいては病気を予防する。
english: Food eaten in season is richer in nutrition, and thus can help prevent disease.

translation: Eventually (lead to) ~; even
explanation: An adverb indicating that something is perceived to eventually lead to a signiﬁcant result.
japanese: マスメディアが個人の名誉やプライバシーを不当に侵害する状況が続けば、ひいては報道に対して権力が介入する口実を与えることになる。
reading: マスメディアが個人の名誉やプライバシーを不当に侵害する状況が続けば、ひいては報道に対して権力が介入する口実を与えることになる。
english: If the media continues to violate people's reputations and privacy unjustly, some day it could provide an excuse for the government to intervene.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: うちの課には一人として英語を話せる者がいない。
reading: うちの課には一人として英語を話せる者がいない。
english: Not a single person in my section can speak English.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: この資料室には一冊として役に立つ本がない。
reading: この資料室には一冊として役に立つ本がない。
english: There's not a single useful book in this library.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: 私が困っていた時、一人として私を助けてくれる者がいなかった。
reading: 私が困っていた時、一人として私を助けてくれる者がいなかった。
english: Not a single person helped me when I was having trouble.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: この宗教は、この世の中には一つとして自分のものはないと教えている。
reading: この宗教は、この世の中には一つとして自分のものはないと教えている。
english: This religion teaches that nothing in this world belongs to you.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: 剣道の審判は一秒として気を抜くことは許されない。
reading: 剣道の審判は一秒として気を抜くことは許されない。
english: A kendo (Japanese fencing) judge will not be forgiven for losing his concentration for even a second.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: 単身赴任中、一日として家族のことを思わない日はなかった。
reading: 単身赴任中、一日として家族のことを思わない日はなかった。
english: While I was assigned to another city (literally: When I lived on my own away from my family for business), there was not a single day I didn't think of my family.

translation: Not a single ~; not even one; not any ~
explanation: A structure that means “not a single one".
japanese: 彼女の演奏は一音としておろそかに弾かれることはなく、どの曲も聴く者に深い感銘を与えないではおかない。
reading: 彼女の演奏は一音としておろそかに弾かれることはなく、どの曲も聴く者に深い感銘を与えないではおかない。
english: In her performances, she never plays a single note carelessly, and no matter what the piece, her audience can't help being deeply impressed.

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつ日本の小説の英訳をやってみょう。
reading: ひとつ日本の小説の英訳をやってみよう。
english: I will try to translate a Japanese novel into English.

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつゴルフでもやったらどうですか。
reading: ひとつゴルフでもやったらどうですか。
english: How about giving golf a try?

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつインターネットでもやってみよう。
reading: ひとつインターネットでもやってみよう。
english: I will try the Internet or something.

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつ東大を受けてみたいと思います。
reading: ひとつ東大を受けてみたいと思います。
english: I'd like to give the entrance exam for the University of Tokyo a try.
extra_notes: 受ける (うける) here means "to take a test."

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: 「Shall we ダンス？」という面白い映画を見たので、ひとつ社交ダンスでもやってみようかという気になった。
reading: 「Shall we ダンス？」という面白い映画を見たので、ひとつ社交ダンスでもやってみようかという気になった。
english: Now that I've seen the (interesting) movie Shall We Dance?, I want to give social dancing a try.

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつ映画でも見に行きませんか。
reading: ひとつ映画でも見に行きませんか。
english: Why don't we go see a movie?

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: ひとつ株でもやってみませんか。
reading: ひとつ株でもやってみませんか。
english: Don't you want to try stocks?

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese:
A：君の言うことなど聞きたくないよ。　
B：まあ、そう言わないで、ひとつ聞いて下さいよ。
reading:
A：君の言うことなど聞きたくないよ。
B：まあ、そう言わないで、ひとつ聞いて下さいよ。
english:
A: I don't want to listen to what you have to say. 
B: Don't say that. Just give me a chance (lit, please try to listen).

translation: Give something a try
explanation: An adverb used when the speaker intends to do something, or asks someone a favour, or makes a suggestion or gives advice to someone.
japanese: じゃあ、この仕事をひとつやってもらいましょうか。
reading: じゃあ、この仕事をひとつやってもらいましょうか。
english: So, can I ask for your help with this work?

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 彼が外国語を好んで勉強しているのは、一つには、異文化学習が好きだからだ。
reading: 彼が外国語を<ruby title="好(この)"><rb>好</rb><rt>この</rt></ruby>んで勉強しているのは、一つには、異文化学習が好きだからだ。
english: One reason he likes studying foreign languages is because he likes to learn about different cultures.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 彼がよく家族と旅行に出かけるのは、一つには自分のため、一つには家族のためだ。
reading: 彼がよく家族と旅行に出かけるのは、一つには自分のため、一つには家族のためだ。
english: He travels so frequently with his family, partly for himself and partly for his family.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 日本人が大人まで漫画を読んでいるのは、一つには、大人が十分味わえるような漫画があるからだ。
reading: 日本人が大人まで漫画を読んでいるのは、一つには、大人が十分味わえるような漫画があるからだ。
english: The reason even Japanese adults read comics is because there are comics that adults can fully enjoy.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 私がアメリカに来た理由は、一つには、そこに学問の自由があると思ったからだ。
reading: 私がアメリカに来た理由は、一つには、そこに学問の自由があると思ったからだ。
english: One reason I came to the U.S. was because I thought there was academic freedom here.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 政治家が嫌われる理由は、一つには、選挙の時には魅力的な公約を言うのに、当選するとそれを実行しないからだ。
reading: 政治家が嫌きらわれる理由は、一つには、選挙の時には魅力的な公約を言うのに、当選とうせんするとそれを実行しないからだ。
english: Part of the reason politicians are disliked is because they make attractive promises when campaigning but don't put them into practice once they are elected.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 日本に来た外国人が体験するカルチャーショックには色々あると思うが、一つには、日本人が彼らをガイジン、つまりソトの人と呼ぶということがある。
reading: 日本に来た外国人が体験するカルチャーショックには色々あると思うが、一つには、日本人が彼らをガイジン、つまりソトの人と呼ぶということがある。
english: Foreigners experience a variety of culture shocks when they come to Japan, one of which is being called gaijin, or “outside people,” by the Japanese.

translation: Partly; for one thing
explanation: An adverb meaning “partly” in a context where someone gives one or two objectives, benefits, examples or reasons for something.
japanese: 「十年日記」をやってみたいとよく思うが、まだ始めていない。それは一つには、前の年の方がいい年だったらいやだからだ。
reading: 「十年日記」をやってみたいとよく思うが、まだ始めていない。それは一つには、前の年の方がいい年だったらいやだからだ。
english: I've often thought of keeping a “10-year diary,” but I've never gotten around to doing it. That's partly because I wouldn't like it if the previous year was better.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: 会議の日取りを一応来週の水曜日と決めておきましょう。
reading: 会議の日取りを一応来週の水曜日と決めておきましょう。
english: Let's tentatively set our meeting date for next Wednesday.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: 私は一応トムにその仕事を担当させることにした。
reading: 私は一応トムにその仕事を担当させることにした。
english: I've put Tom in charge of the project for the time being.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: この問題についてはまだ議論の余地はあるとは思うが、一応ここでけりをつけたいと思う。
reading: この問題についてはまだ議論の余地はあるとは思うが、一応ここでけりをつけたいと思う。
english: I believe that on this issue there is still a lot to be discussed, but I'd like to bring it to a close for the time being.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: 一応大学を出ておいた方が都合がいいと思い、大学に進学したんです。
reading: 一応大学を出ておいた方が都合がいいと思い、大学に進学したんです。
english: I thought it would be better for me to graduate from college, to keep up appearances. That's why I went on to college.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: A:あなたは情報技術の研究者ですか。 B:まあ、一応そういうことです。
reading:
A:あなたは情報技術の研究者ですか。 
B:まあ、一応そういうことです。
english:
A: Are you an IT researcher? 
B: Yes, sort of.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: A:このお金どうするの? B:俺が一応銀行に入れておくよ。
reading:
A:このお金どうするの? 
B:俺が一応銀行に入れておくよ。
english:
A: What are you going to do with this money? 
B: I will put it in the bank for now.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: 二人は兄弟と言うだけに頭は、まあ、一応似ている。しかし気性はかなり違う。
reading: 二人は兄弟と言うだけに頭は、まあ、一応似ている。しかし気性はかなり違う。
english: The two are brothers, so their faces do sort of resemble each other. But, their temperaments are quite different.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: すみません。これでも一応大学教師なんです。
reading: すみません。これでも一応大学教師なんです。
english: Sorry, (I know I don't look like one,) but I am in fact a college professor.

translation: For the time being; for the present; for now; tentatively; for formality’s sake; nominally; kind of; sort of
explanation: An adverb indicating that an action or state is only temporary or tentative or is superﬁcially conceived.
japanese: 滅多に買わない店だけど、名前くらいは一応覚えてもらっているから安くしてくれるかもしれない。
reading: 滅多に買わない店だけど、名前くらいは一応覚えてもらっているから安くしてくれるかもしれない。
english: It's a store where I seldom buy things, but they sort of know my name, so they might discount the price for me.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 私がこの会社に採用されるかどうかは、面接の結果如何だ。
reading: 私がこの会社に採用されるかどうかは、面接の結果如何だ。
english: Whether or not I'll be hired by this company depends on the results of my interview.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 今年の新車の売れ行き如何｛で/によって｝この会社の将来が決まりそうだ。
reading: 今年の<ruby title="新車(しんしゃ)"><rb>新車</rb><rt>しんしゃ</rt></ruby>の売れ行き如何｛で/によって｝この会社の将来が決まりそうだ。
english: It looks like this company's future will be determined by this year's new car sales (literally: how new car sales are this year).

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: このテストの結果如何によっては今年卒業できないかもしれない。
reading: このテストの結果如何によっては今年卒業できないかもしれない。
english: Depending on the results of this test, I may not be able to graduate this year.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 納入した学費は、理由の如何｛を問わず/に関わらず｝返却しません。
reading: 納入した学費は、<ruby title="理由(りゆう)"><rb>理由</rb><rt>りゆう</rt></ruby>の如何｛を問わず/に関わらず｝返却しません。
english: The tuition and fees you have paid will not be returned, no matter what the reason.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 燃料電池自動車が普及するかどうかは価格とパワー如何である。
reading: <ruby title="燃料(ねんりょう)"><rb>燃料</rb><rt>ねんりょう</rt></ruby>電池自動車が<ruby title="普及(ふきゅう)"><rb>普及</rb><rt>ふきゅう</rt></ruby>するかどうかは<ruby title="価格(かかく)"><rb>価格</rb><rt>かかく</rt></ruby>とパワー如何である。
english: Whether fuel-cell cars spread or not depends on their price and power.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 子供の失敗をやる気に結びつけ成長への糧にできるかどうかは、その時の親の態度如何だ。
reading: 子供の失敗をやる気に結びつけ成長への糧にできるかどうかは、その時の親の態度如何だ。
english: Whether or not children's failures can be connected to their motivation and used as food for growth depends on their parents' attitude at the time.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 国や組織の将来はリーダーの知的能力如何で決まると言える。
reading: 国や組織の将来はリーダーの知的能力如何で決まると言える。
english: We can say that the future of a country or organization is determined by how strong the intellectual ability of its leader is.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 実験の結果如何によっては、大発見になる可能性もある。
reading: 実験の結果如何によっては、大発見になる可能性もある。
english: Depending on the result of the experiment, this could be a great discovery.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 生活排水などの汚水は、その処理方法如何によっては、周辺環境の悪化を招くこととなります。
reading: 生活排水などの汚水は、その処理方法如何によっては、周辺環境の<ruby title="悪化(あっか)"><rb>悪化</rb><rt>あっか</rt></ruby>を招くこととなります。
english: Depending on the treatment method, residential sewage and other wastewater can lead to the worsening of the surrounding environment.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: 賞味期限のある食品類は開封・未開封の如何に関わらず返品対象外となります。
reading: 賞味期限のある食品類は開封・未開封の如何に関わらず返品対象外となります。
english: Food products with an expiration date are not returnable (literally: outside those which may be returned), regardless of whether the package has been opened or not.

translation: How; what; (depending on) how/what; (according to) how/what; depend on
explanation: A classic form of the adverb どのように “in what way”.
japanese: このコンテンツの複製は、方法、媒体の如何を問わず禁止されている。
reading: このコンテンツの複製は、方法、媒体の如何を問わず禁止されている。
english: Copying this content is prohibited, regardless of the method or the medium.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 生物社会学とはいかなる学問分野（なの）か。
reading: 生物社会学とはいかなる学問分野（なの）か。
english: What kind of academic ﬁeld is bio-sociology?

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 彼はいかなる忠告（に）も耳を貸さなかった。
reading: 彼はいかなる忠告（に）も耳を貸さなかった。
english: He didn't lend an ear to any kind of advice.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: いかなる理論｛でも/であれ/であろうと（も）｝穴はあるものだ。
reading: いかなる理論｛でも/であれ/であろうと（も）｝穴はあるものだ。
english: No matter what the theory is, it will have holes in it.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 父はいかなる事態になっても常に沈着だった。
reading: 父はいかなる<ruby title="事態(じたい)"><rb>事態</rb><rt>じたい</rt></ruby>になっても<ruby title="常(つね)"><rb>常</rb><rt>つね</rt></ruby>に沈着だった。
english: My father was always calm no matter what situation he found himself in.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 重要なことは、いかなる結果が出ようと（も）自分で決めたい。
reading: 重要なことは、いかなる結果が出ようと（も）自分で決めたい。
english: I would like to make my own decisions about important matters, no matter what happens as a result.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 日本語運用能力はいかなる基準で測るべきか。
reading: 日本語運用能力はいかなる基準で測るべきか。
english: By what kind of standards should we assess proﬁciency in Japanese?

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: 厳しい父はいかなる口実も許してくれなかった。
reading: 厳しい父はいかなる口実も許してくれなかった。
english: My strict father never allowed me to make any kind of excuse.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: いかなる文化にも宗教は存在する。
reading: いかなる文化にも宗教は存在する。
english: There is religion in any culture.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: あの男はいかなる失敗にも負けず、不死鳥のように蘇る。
reading: あの男はいかなる失敗にも負けず、不死鳥のように蘇る。
english: No matter what the failure, he is undefeated, rising like a phoenix.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: いかなる外国語学習でもその国の文化が好きになってくるものだ。
reading: いかなる外国語学習でもその国の文化が好きになってくるものだ。
english: When learning any foreign language, one will begin to like the country's culture.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: スポーツはいかなるスポーツであれ、肉体だけではなく精神をも鍛えてくれる。
reading: スポーツはいかなるスポーツであれ、肉体だけではなく精神をも鍛えてくれる。
english: Sports, no matter what kind, train not only your body but also your spirit.

translation: What kind of ~; no matter what ~; whatever; any kind of
explanation: A noun modifier that means either “what kind of” or “no matter what”.
japanese: いかなるアイディアでも、みんなで討議する価値がある。
