translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: 人間はその人の考えそのものである。
reading: 人間はその人の考えそのものである。
english: The epitome of a person is his or her thinking. (literally: A human being is his or her thought itself.)

translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: 私にとってバレーボールは人生そのものでした。
reading: 私にとってバレーボールは人生そのものでした。
english: For me, volleyball was life itself.

translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: 土地は、それそのものは富を生み出さないが、その上で生産、販売などの経済活動を行うことで富を生み出す。
reading: 土地は、それそのものは富を生み出さないが、その上で生産、販売などの経済活動を行うことで富を生み出す。
english: The land itself does not produce wealth, but wealth is produced when people conduct economic activities, such as production and sales, on it.

translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: お年寄りを狙い、強引な方法で家屋の修理契約を結ぶ手口は卑劣そのものだ。
reading: お年寄りを狙い、強引な方法で家屋の修理契約を結ぶ手口は卑劣そのものだ。
english: Their method of targetting the elderly and forcing them to sign a house repair contract is utterly contemptible.

translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: そのマニュアルは説明も図も明快そのもので、画像処理の知識がない者にもよく分かる。
reading: そのマニュアルは説明も図も明快そのもので、画像処理の知識がない者にもよく分かる。
english: The manual's explanations and figures are perfectly clear, so even people with no knowledge of image processing will be able to understand them well.

translation: Itself; themselves; very; perfect; the definition of; the picture of; absolutely; totally; utterly; perfectly
explanation: A phrase used to refer strictly to the preceding noun (phrase) or adjective.
japanese: 米倉さんは誠実そのものの人柄で知られている。
reading: 米倉[よねくら]さんは誠実そのものの<ruby title="人柄(ひとがら)"><rb>人柄</rb><rt>ひとがら</rt></ruby>で知られている。
english: Mr. Yonekura is known for his totally sincere personality.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 株式投資は当たった時の利益は大きいが、それだけリスクも大きい。
reading: 株式投資は当たった時の利益は大きいが、それだけリスクも大きい。
english: You can make a big proﬁt when you invest in the right stocks, but the risk (of loss) is just as big.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: この仕事は苦労も多いが、それだけやりがいもある。
reading: この仕事は苦労も多いが、それだけやりがいもある。
english: This job is hard work, but to the same extent I also ﬁnd it rewarding.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 彼らは同じ宗教内の派閥だから、それだけ憎しみも大きいのかもしれない。
reading: 彼らは同じ宗教内の派閥だから、それだけ憎しみも大きいのかもしれない。
english: It might be that they hate each other that much more because they are in different sects of the same religion.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 期待が大きいとそれだけ失望も大きくなってしまう。
reading: 期待が大きいとそれだけ失望も大きくなってしまう。
english: If your expectations are high, your disappointment will be equally high.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 大きな仕事をまかされたということは、それだけ期待されているということだろう。
reading: 大きな仕事をまかされたということは、それだけ期待されているということだろう。
english: That he was assigned a big job just shows what high hopes people have for him.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: たくさんのオプションがあるのはいいのだが、それだけ選択に悩むことにもなる。
reading: たくさんのオプションがあるのはいいのだが、それだけ選択に悩むことにもなる。
english: It is good to have many options, but it means that it's that much harder to choose.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 花粉症の薬は、眠くなるからそれだけ効くというわけではありません。
reading: 花粉症の薬は、眠くなるからそれだけ効くというわけではありません。
english: It's not true of pollen allergy drugs that the sleepier they make you, the more effective they are.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: できるだけ多く条件を指定すると、それだけ理想に近い人が検索されるはずです。
reading: できるだけ多く条件を指定すると、それだけ理想に近い人が検索されるはずです。
english: If you specify as many conditions as you can, your search should turn up someone that is much closer to your ideal.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 情報の内容が二つのソースで一致するのなら、それだけ信用できるということではないだろうか。
reading: 情報の内容が二つのソースで一致するのなら、それだけ信用できるということではないだろうか。
english: If information from two sources is consistent, don't you think the information is that much more reliable?

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 子供にお金をかければそれだけ愛情を注いだことになる、という間違った思い込みがしばしばあるようだ。
reading: 子供にお金をかければそれだけ愛情を注いだことになる、という間違った思い込みがしばしばあるようだ。
english: It seems that it's a common, and mistaken, assumption that the  amount of money you spend on your children equals the amount of affection you've given them.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: これに関する読者からの投書が最近増えているということは、それだけこの問題が注目されてきたということでしょう。
reading: これに関する読者からの投書が最近増えているということは、それだけこの問題が注目されてきたということでしょう。
english: The fact that we have been getting more letters from readers recently about this problem shows how much more it is drawing people's attention.

translation: That much; to the same extent; to the same degree; equally
explanation: An adverbial phrase indicating that the degree of something is proportionate to the degree of the state, action or event mentioned in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 販売経験が豊富な営業マンは、それだけ顧客の信頼も多く勝ち取るはずだ。
reading: 販売経験が豊富な営業マンは、それだけ顧客の信頼も多く勝ち取るはずだ。
english: (Compared with those who are less experienced,) Sales representatives with a lot of experience should be all the more able to win their customers' trust.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 天才と言われる人にはそれなりの苦しみがあると思う。
reading: 天才と言われる人にはそれなりの苦しみがあると思う。
english: I think people who are called geniuses suffer in their own way.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: クラシックもジャズもロックも、聞いてみればみなそれなりに面白い。
reading: クラシックもジャズもロックも、聞いてみればみなそれなりに面白い。
english: If you (really) listen to classical music, jazz and rock, each of them is interesting in its own way.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 外国で仕事をするのは面白いが、それなりの苦労は覚悟しなければならない。
reading: 外国で仕事をするのは面白いが、それなりの苦労は覚悟しなければならない。
english: Working abroad is interesting, but you must expect a certain amount of hardship, too.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 買った参考書はどれもみなそれなりに役に立っている。
reading: 買った参考書はどれもみなそれなりに役に立っている。
english: All the reference books I have bought have been helpful in their own way.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 選手たちはみんなそれなりに精一杯やっている。ただ結果が出ないだけだ。
reading: 選手たちはみんなそれなりに精一杯やっている。ただ結果が出ないだけだ。
english: All the players are giving it their best in their own way. We just haven't had the (expected) result.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: お金がなくてもそれなりに余暇を楽しむ方法はある。
reading: お金がなくてもそれなりに余暇を楽しむ方法はある。
english: Even if you don't have money, there are ways to enjoy your leisure in your own way.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: ほとんどの人は、悩みや問題があってもそれなりに暮らしているのだと思います。
reading: ほとんどの人は、悩みや問題があってもそれなりに暮らしているのだと思います。
english: I think that even though most people have worries and problems, they are living the best they can (literally: in their own ways).

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 上の地位にいればそれなりの責任がかかってくる。
reading: 上の地位にいればそれなりの責任がかかってくる。
english: If you are in a high-ranking position, you have to assume the responsibilities that come with it.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: きつい仕事にはそれなりの報酬を払うべきだ。
reading: きつい仕事にはそれなりの報酬を払うべきだ。
english: For a tough assignment we should pay appropriate compensation.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 今年それなりの成績を上げることができれば、来年支店長に昇進できそうだ。
reading: 今年それなりの成績を上げることができれば、来年支店長に昇進できそうだ。
english: If I can achieve the expected performance this year, it looks like I'll be promoted to branch manager next year.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: それなりの収入があるのなら、結婚相手はすぐ見つかるはずです。
reading: それなりの収入があるのなら、結婚相手はすぐ見つかるはずです。
english: If you have a reasonable income, you should be able to ﬁnd someone to marry soon.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 彼が準決勝まで残ったということは、それなりの実力があるということだ。
reading: 彼が準決勝まで残ったということは、それなりの実力があるということだ。
english: The fact that he made it to the semiﬁnals means that he had the right skills to take him that far.

translation: In one’s own way; accompanying; proportionate; suitable; expected; agreeable; reasonable; one’s own; proper to
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone/something does something or is in a state in his/her/its own way, or in a way suitable to the situation or generally expected from the situation.
japanese: 彼女がみんなに好かれていないのはそれなりの理由がある。
reading: 彼女がみんなに好かれていないのはそれなりの理由がある。
english: There's a reason no one likes her (literally: she is not liked by everyone).

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: さんざん迷った末に、友達の結婚祝いはコーヒーカップのセットを贈ることにした。
reading: さんざん迷った末に、友達の結婚祝いはコーヒーカップのセットを贈ることにした。
english: After much hesitation, I decided to give my friends a set of coffee cups as a wedding present.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 試行錯誤の末(に)、やっと車に使える燃料電池ができた。
reading: 試行錯誤の末(に)、やっと車に使える燃料電池ができた。
english: After much trial and error, we ﬁnally made a fuel cell battery that can be used in cars.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 一週間悩んだ末(に)、家族をおいて単身赴任することにした。
reading: 一週間悩んだ末(に)、家族をおいて単身赴任することにした。
english: After considering it for a week, I decided to leave my family behind and transfer to my new job alone.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 両者は8時間にわたる交渉の末に、ついに合意に達した。
reading: 両者は8時間にわたる交渉の末に、ついに合意に達した。
english: After eight hours of negotiation, both parties ﬁnally came to an agreement.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 5時間を超える熱戦の末、タイガースが勝った。
reading: 5時間を超える熱戦の末、タイガースが勝った。
english: After a close game lasting more than ﬁve hours, the Tigers won.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: M銀行とU銀行の合併交渉は１年以上も難航した末、やっと成立した。
reading: M銀行とU銀行の合併交渉は１年以上も難航した末、やっと成立した。
english: After more than a year of difﬁcult merger negotiations, M Bank  and U Bank ﬁnally came to an agreement.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 下書きを20枚近く失敗した末に、やっとなんとか気に入った絵ができた。
reading: 下書きを20枚近く失敗した末に、やっとなんとか気に入った絵ができた。
english: After almost twenty bad sketches, I finally managed to draw one I liked.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 再就職は、苦労した末、過去のコンピュータ経験を評価してくれたIT関係の会社に決まりました。
reading: 再就職は、苦労した末、過去のコンピュータ経験を評価してくれたIT関係の会社に決まりました。
english: After much trouble looking for a new job, I found one with an IT-related company that valued my previous computer experience.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: 男は走って逃げ、最後には暴れ回って抵抗した末に逮捕された。
reading: 男は走って逃げ、最後には暴れ回って抵抗した末に逮捕された。
english: The man tried to run away and, in the end, he was arrested after resisting violently.

translation: After; at the end of
explanation: A noun that indicates the end of a period or the time after long, hard mental or physical work.
japanese: この案は、各国の意見が衝突した末の「妥協の産物」だった。
reading: この案は、各国の意見が衝突した末の「妥協の産物」だった。
english: This plan was a product of compromise, reached after working  through a clash of opinions between the countries.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: ちょっと顔を見せるだけで済むと思う。
reading: ちょっと顔を見せるだけで済むと思う。
english: I think just showing up for a while will be enough.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 面接は20分で済んだ。
reading: 面接は20分で済んだ。
english: The interview took only 20 minutes.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: あまり難しい日本語ではなかったので、辞書なしで済んだ。
reading: あまり難しい日本語ではなかったので、辞書なしで済んだ。
english: Because the Japanese (in it) was not very difﬁcult, I managed (to read it) without a dictionary.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 旅行先ではどこでもクレジットカードが使えたので、現金がなくても済んだ。
reading: 旅行先ではどこでもクレジットカードが使えたので、現金がなくても済んだ。
english: Everywhere I travelled I was able to use my credit card, so I could travel without cash.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: これは黙っていて済む問題ではない。
reading: これは黙っていて済む問題ではない。
english: This is not the kind of problem where you can get away with staying silent.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 奨学金をもらったので、お金を借り{ずに/なくて(も)/ないで}済むと思う。
reading: 奨学金をもらったので、お金を借り{ずに/なくて(も)/ないで}済むと思う。
english: I've been given a scholarship, so I think I can get by without borrowing money.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 解約したい時は、入会金だけ損をすれば済む。
reading: 解約したい時は、入会金だけ損をすれば済む。
english: When you want to cancel the agreement, all you will lose is the  enrolment fee.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: この程度の翻訳なら3日で済むだろう。
reading: この程度の翻訳なら3日で済むだろう。
english: Three days should be enough for a translation like this.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: この方法だと今のシステムの大部分がそのまま使えるので、新たな投資が最小で済む。
reading: この方法だと今のシステムの大部分がそのまま使えるので、新たな投資が最小で済む。
english: Because this approach would allow us to use most of the current system, we could get by with a minimal new investment.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 徒歩あるいは自転車で済むところへ車で行く無駄をしていませんか。
reading: 徒歩あるいは自転車で済むところへ車で行く無駄をしていませんか。
english: Aren't you being wasteful by driving places where you could walk or go by bicycle?

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 15キロオーバーだったが、幸い警告だけで済んだ。
reading: 15キロオーバーだったが、幸い警告だけで済んだ。
english: It was 15 km/hr above (the speed limit), but fortunately I got off with just a warning.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: こんな大きな失敗をして「ごめん」「知らなかった」では済まない。
reading: こんな大きな失敗をして「ごめん」「知らなかった」では済まない。
english: You can't excuse a major mistake like this just by saying, "Sorry," or "I didn't know."

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 電動自転車はモーターの力だけで動くことはないから、法律上「自転車」とされ、運転免許もヘルメットもなしで済む。
reading: 電動自転車はモーターの力だけで動くことはないから、法律上「自転車」とされ、運転免許もヘルメットもなしで済む。
english: Because electric bicycles are not powered solely by motor, the  law classiﬁes them as bicycles, so you can ride them without either a driver's license or a helmet.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: ここからは地下鉄でどこへでも行けるから車がなくても済む。
reading: ここからは地下鉄でどこへでも行けるから車がなくても済む。
english: From here we can go anywhere by subway, so we don't need a car.

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: 謝って済むことと済まないことがある。
reading: 謝って済むことと済まないことがある。
english: Sometimes an apology is not enough. (literally: There are things that can be settled by apologizing and things that cannot.)

translation: Take/cost/need/etc. only ~; do/manage (without/only with); get by/get away (without/only with); be let off (without/only with); be enough (if); be all right (if); not to have to: there is no need for
explanation: A verb that means “to be finished; to do (in the sense of being enough)”.
japanese: ヘルメットをかぶっていたので、怪我が軽くて済んだ。
reading: ヘルメットをかぶっていたので、怪我が軽くて済んだ。
english: Because I was wearing a helmet, I suffered only minor injuries.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: この辺りは駅にもスーパーにも近くて便利だ。ただ環境があまりよくない。
reading: この辺りは駅にもスーパーにも近くて便利だ。ただ環境があまりよくない。
english: This area is close to both the station and a supermarket, so it's convenient, but the environment is not very good.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: とてもいいコンピュータだと思います。ただ値段が問題ですね。
reading: とてもいいコンピュータだと思います。ただ値段が問題ですね。
english: I think this is a very good computer. But, the price is a problem.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: 彼はいい人だ{が/けど}、ただちょっと考えが浅いところが気になる。
reading: 彼はいい人だ{が/けど}、ただちょっと考えが浅いところが気になる。
english: He is a nice person, only I'm concerned that he is a little shallow.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: この故障は直せないことはないと思います。ただ時間がかかると思います。
reading: この故障は直せないことはないと思います。ただ時間がかかると思います。
english: It's not impossible to repair this problem, only I think it'll take time.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: とても静かでいいうちだ。ただ近くに店がないので買い物は不便だ。
reading: とても静かでいいうちだ。ただ近くに店がないので買い物は不便だ。
english: It is a very quiet and nice house, only there are no shops nearby, so it's inconvenient for shopping.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: このデジカメ優れた機能をたくさん持っている。ただユーザーインターフェースが悪くて使いにくいのが難点だ。
reading: このデジカメ優れた機能をたくさん持っている。ただユーザーインターフェースが悪くて使いにくいのが難点だ。
english: This digital camera has many outstanding functions. However, the problem is that it's hard to use because the user interface is bad.

translation: But; however; only; the only thing is that ~
explanation: A conjunction that introduces a supplementary remark.
japanese: たいていのことは私がいなくても他の者が代わりにやってくれるが、ただこの仕事は他の者に頼むわけにはいかない。
reading: たいていのことは私がいなくても他の者が代わりにやってくれるが、ただこの仕事は他の者に頼むわけにはいかない。
english: For most things, if I'm not available others can do it for me; however, as far as this job is concerned, I cannot ask someone else to do it for me.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: この部屋にある雑誌や本はどれを見てもいいです。但し、部屋からは持ち出さないで下さい。
reading: この部屋にある雑誌や本はどれを見てもいいです。但し、部屋からは持ち出さないで下さい。
english: You may look at any of the magazines or books in this room. However, please do not take them out of the room.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 当館の開館時間は午前9時から午後６時まで。但し、特別行事がある場合はこの限りではない。
reading: 当館の開館時間は午前9時から午後６時まで。但し、特別行事がある場合はこの限りではない。
english: This hall is open from 9 a.m. to 6 pm. However, for special events, the hall is not limited to these hours.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 試験の時、辞書を見てもいいです。但し、和英辞典だけです。
reading: 試験の時、辞書を見てもいいです。但し、和英辞典だけです。
english: You may consult dictionaries during the exam. However, (you may use) only Japanese-English dictionaries.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: この製品は定価の3割引きで販売しています。但し、返品はできません。
reading: この製品は定価の3割引きで販売しています。但し、返品はできません。
english: We sell this product at 30 percent off the list price. But we cannot accept returns.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 問題があったらいつでも相談して下さい。但し、お金の問題は相談に乗れません。
reading: 問題があったらいつでも相談して下さい。但し、お金の問題は相談に乗れません。
english: Please (feel free to) talk to me whenever you have a problem. However, I cannot help you with money matters.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 発表のトピックは何でもかまいません。但し、発表時間は20分以内です。
reading: 発表のトピックは何でもかまいません。但し、発表時間は20分以内です。
english: You can choose any topic for your presentation. However, the presentation should be 20 minutes or fewer.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 実習時間は午前8時30分から午後5時30分まで。但し、12時から1時までは休憩時間とする。
reading: 実習時間は午前8時30分から午後5時30分まで。但し、12時から1時までは休憩時間とする。
english: The hours of the internship are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. However, there will be a break from 12:00 to 1:00.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 総会の議決は会員の過半数を以って決定される。但し、規定改定はこの限りではない。
reading: 総会の議決は会員の過半数を以って決定される。但し、規定改定はこの限りではない。
english: Decisions at the general meeting are passed by a majority of the members. However this does not apply to revisions of the regulations.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: 第７条(出張の経路等)出張の経路とその利用交通機関は、経済性を重視して選ぶことを原則とする。但し、特別の理由がある場合はこの限りではない。
reading: 第７条(出張の経路等)出張の経路とその利用交通機関は、経済性を重視して選ぶことを原則とする。但し、特別の理由がある場合はこの限りではない。
english: Article 7 (Routes of business trips, etc.): As a rule, for business travel, choose routes and means of transportation with economy in mind (literally: placing the most importance on economy). However, there can be  exceptions when there is a special reason.

translation: However; but; only; here; provided that
explanation: A conjunction indicating that there is a condition, restriction, proviso, etc., to the preceding statement.
japanese: V＝IR但し、VはAB間の電位差、Iは電流、Rは抵抗
reading: V＝IR但し、VはAB間の電位差、Iは電流、Rは抵抗
english: V=IR where V is the potential difference between Points A and B, I is the electric current, and R is the resistance.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが子供の言ったことだ。そんなに深刻に考えることはない。
reading: たかが子供の言ったことだ。そんなに深刻に考えることはない。
english: It's just something a child told you. You don't have to take it so seriously.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが漫画(くらい)と馬鹿にしてはいけない。
reading: たかが漫画(くらい)と馬鹿にしてはいけない。
english: You shouldn't make light of it saying it's just a cartoon.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが車の故障(くらい)でそんなに大騒ぎする必要はない。
reading: たかが車の故障(くらい)でそんなに大騒ぎする必要はない。
english: You don't need to make such a big fuss over a little car trouble.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが無断で自転車を借りたくらい(のこと)でそんなに怒らなくてもいいでしょう。
reading: たかが無断で自転車を借りたくらい(のこと)でそんなに怒らなくてもいいでしょう。
english: You don't have to get so mad at me just for borrowing your bicycle without asking.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: 人間一人の知恵などたかが知れている。
reading: 人間一人の知恵などたかが知れている。
english: One person's wisdom doesn't amount to much.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが喫煙じゃないか。どうしてそんなに犯罪者のように言われなきゃならないんだ。
reading: たかが喫煙じゃないか。どうしてそんなに犯罪者のように言われなきゃならないんだ。
english: It's only smoking. Why do they have to talk about us as if we were criminals?

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかがノートくらいと言われるかもしれませんが、僕にとってはとても大事なものなんです。
reading: たかがノートくらいと言われるかもしれませんが、僕にとってはとても大事なものなんです。
english: You may say it's just a notebook, but to me it's very important.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが１０万円で何ができると言うのですか。
reading: たかが１０万円で何ができると言うのですか。
english: What do you expect us to do with only 100,000 yen?

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかがアパート探しくらいで君に面倒をかけたくない。
reading: たかがアパート探しくらいで君に面倒をかけたくない。
english: I don't want to bother you with just apartment hunting.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが転んだくらいで救急車を呼ぶなんて大げさだ。
reading: たかが転んだくらいで救急車を呼ぶなんて大げさだ。
english: It is overreacting to call an ambulance just for falling down.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: 公共事業によって景気が回復する領域などたかが知れている。
reading: 公共事業によって景気が回復する領域などたかが知れている。
english: There's hardly any area in which the economy can be improved through public projects.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが椅子。しかし、これによって仕事の能率が大きく左右されるし健康にも影響する。
reading: たかが椅子。しかし、これによって仕事の能率が大きく左右されるし健康にも影響する。
english: It's just (a matter of) a chair. But it can affect your productivity at work and inﬂuence your health.

translation: Only; just; mere
explanation: A noun modiﬁer used when the speaker thinks little of the referent of the modiﬁed noun or noun phrase.
japanese: たかが風邪、されど風邪。
reading: たかが風邪、されど風邪。
english: It's just a cold, but it is a cold.
extra_notes: “たかが X, されど X (X is a noun)” is an advanced Japanese expression that means “It’s just X, but it’s still X”. It is usually used to emphasise that, even though something is often regarded as frivolous, it still has some nontrivial values/importance. For instance, “たかが１００円, されど１００円” means “It’s just/only 100 yen, but still 100 yen (, which has a nontrivial value)”.

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 彼は椅子に腰掛けたなり(で)、ずっと黙っていた。
reading: 彼は椅子に腰掛けたなり(で)、ずっと黙っていた。
english: He sat in the chair and stayed there, silent the whole time.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 片足を上げたなりの格好で、数秒間目をつぶるように言われた。
reading: 片足を上げたなりの格好で、数秒間目をつぶるように言われた。
english: I was told to close my eyes for a few seconds while I kept lifting one foot off the ground.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 純一は17歳の時にフランスに行ったなりで、日本には帰らず画家になって、今ではモンマルトルに住みついている。
reading: 純一は17歳の時にフランスに行ったなりで、日本には帰らず画家になって、今ではモンマルトルに住みついている。
english: Junichi went to France when he was 17 and never came back to Japan; he became a painter and now has settled in Montmartre.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: エリサは『源氏物語』を買ったなり、一ページも読まず、本棚に置きっぱなしだった。
reading: エリサは『源氏物語』を買ったなり、一ページも読まず、本棚に置きっぱなしだった。
english: Elisa bought The Tale of Genji, but she left it on the bookshelf without reading a single page.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 彼は私の部屋の入り口に突っ立ったなりでニヤニヤ笑っていた。
reading: 彼は私の部屋の入り口に突っ立ったなりでニヤニヤ笑っていた。
english: My sweetheart stood at the entrance to my room, grinning.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 妻がドアを開けてくれたんですけど、私はもう倒れたなりで、体が動きませんでした。
reading: 妻がドアを開けてくれたんですけど、私はもう倒れたなりで、体が動きませんでした。
english: My wife opened the door for me, but I had fallen down and couldn't move an inch.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 腰をよじったなりの姿勢で長時間座っていたので、立てないほど腰が痛くなった。
reading: 腰をよじったなりの姿勢で長時間座っていたので、立てないほど腰が痛くなった。
english: Because I was sitting for a long time with my lower back twisted, it hurt so much I couldn't stand up.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: Without; while ~ staying; while ~ keep ~ing
explanation: A conjunction indicating that a situation or condition remains unaltered.
japanese: 人形がほこりをかぶったなりで棚に乗っかっている。
reading: 人形がほこりをかぶったなりで棚に乗っかっている。
english: The doll sits on a shelf, covered with dust.
extra_notes: Synonymous with まま

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: このATMは千円単位でお金を引き出すことができる。
reading: このATMは千円単位でお金を引き出すことができる。
english: You can withdraw money from this ATM in multiples of 1,000 yen.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: この社内調査では課単位でリサイクル実施率を調べる。
reading: この社内調査では課単位でリサイクル実施率を調べる。
english: This in-house investigation will examine the recycling rate for each section.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: 日本では湯飲みは5個単位で売られることが多い。
reading: 日本では湯飲みは5個単位で売られることが多い。
english: In Japan, tea cups are often sold in sets of ﬁve.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: 我が社は今回のアジアからの労働者派遣が成功した場合には、次回から規模を大幅に拡大し、千人単位で派遣する予定だ。
reading: 我が社は今回のアジアからの労働者派遣が成功した場合には、次回から規模を大幅に拡大し、千人単位で派遣する予定だ。
english: If our company's plan to send labourers from Asia is successful this time, next time we will greatly expand the scale and send labourers in groups of 1,000.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: B社の新しいデータ通信サービスは、最低契約量である１５０時間分のデータ通信を１分単位で利用できる。
reading: B社の新しいデータ通信サービスは、最低契約量である１５０時間分のデータ通信を１分単位で利用できる。
english: B Company's new data communication service allows the user to transmit and receive data in one-minute units for a minimum contract amount of 150 hours.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: オンライン書店のZ社は、本をページまたは章単位で販売するそうだ。
reading: オンライン書店のZ社は、本をページまたは章単位で販売するそうだ。
english: They say the online bookstore Z is going to sell books by the page or the chapter.

translation: By the; in sets/groups/lots/etc. of; in multiples of; each; every
explanation: A phrase that indicates the smallest amount, number or unit of something (or people) involved.
japanese: このプロジェクト管理ソフトの新バージョンでは、これまで日単位で行われていた計画と管理を時間・分単位で行えるようになった。
reading: このプロジェクト管理ソフトの新バージョンでは、これまで日単位で行われていた計画と管理を時間・分単位で行えるようになった。
english: This new version of the project management software application allows us to plan and manage (our operations) by the hour and minute, instead of the day.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: これは単に文化の違いの問題だ。
reading: これは単に文化の違いの問題だ。
english: This is simply a matter/problem of cultural differences.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: この車は単にボディーのデザインを変えただけだ。
reading: この車は単にボディーのデザインを変えただけだ。
english: They did nothing more to this car than change the body design.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 仕事が難しいのではなく、単に私が不器用なだけです。
reading: 仕事が難しいのではなく、単に私が不器用なだけです。
english: It's not that the job is difficult; it's simply that I'm clumsy.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 円高の影響は単に輸出だけにとどまらない。
reading: 円高の影響は単に輸出だけにとどまらない。
english: The effects of the high yen are not limited to exports.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: これは単に私個人の意見に過ぎない。
reading: これは単に私個人の意見に過ぎない。
english: This is nothing more than my personal opinion.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: それは単に解釈の問題だ。
reading: それは単に解釈の問題だ。
english: It's simply an issue of interpretation.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: これは単にあなた一人の問題ではない。
reading: これは単にあなた一人の問題ではない。
english: This is not just a problem for you alone.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: この文章は単に原文を直訳しただけだ。
reading: この文章は単に原文を直訳しただけだ。
english: This text is simply something that was translated literally from the original.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 当ホテルは単に安いだけでなく、行き届いたサービスで快適にお過ごしいただけます。
reading: 当ホテルは単に安いだけでなく、行き届いたサービスで快適にお過ごしいただけます。
english: Our hotel is not simply inexpensive; with our comprehensive array of services, you can stay (with us) in comfort.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 今は単に多くの利益を上げているだけでは一流企業とは言えない。
reading: 今は単に多くの利益を上げているだけでは一流企業とは言えない。
english: Today, a company that simply racks up large proﬁts cannot be called a ﬁrst-class company.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: このカメラは、単に被写体にカメラを向けてシャッターを押すだけで高画質の写真を撮ることができる。
reading: このカメラは、単に被写体にカメラを向けてシャッターを押すだけで高画質の写真を撮ることができる。
english: With this camera you can take high quality pictures just by holding it toward an object and clicking the shutter.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 彼は考えが一貫しているのではなく、単に頑固なだけだ。
reading: 彼は考えが一貫しているのではなく、単に頑固なだけだ。
english: He is not consistent in his thinking; he's simply stubborn.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 私は単に生まれがドイツだっただけで、ドイツ語はもちろんドイツのことは何も知らない。
reading: 私は単に生まれがドイツだっただけで、ドイツ語はもちろんドイツのことは何も知らない。
english: Germany is no more than my birthplace (literally: It is simply that my birthplace is Germany), so I know nothing about Germany, let alone German.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: 雅夫は単に数学だけができないのではない。
reading: 雅夫[まさお]は単に数学だけができないのではない。
english: It's not that Masao is poor only at math.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: この場合、単にアグネスだけを非難するのは間違っている。
reading: この場合、単にアグネスだけを非難するのは間違っている。
english: In this case, it's wrong to blame only Agnes.

translation: Just; only; simply; no more than; nothing but; solely; merely; alone
explanation: An adverb that means “simply”
japanese: それは単に君の憶測に過ぎない。
reading: それは単に君の憶測に過ぎない。
english: It's nothing more than your speculation.

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: この湖にはここにしかいないという生物がおり、その数たるや50種類を超える。
reading: この湖にはここにしかいないという生物がおり、その数たるや50種類を超える。
english: There are creatures in this lake that exist only here; in fact, there are more than 50 species.

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: ノーベル文学賞はどうやって選考するのだろう。1年間に世界で発表される文学作品の数たるや膨大なものだと思うのだが。
reading: ノーベル文学賞はどうやって選考するのだろう。1年間に世界で発表される文学作品の数たるや膨大なものだと思うのだが。
english: How do they ever choose (who wins) the Nobel Prize in Literature? (I think) The number of works of literature published around the world in a year must be enormous.

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: １９８７年春、彼はついにデビューを果たした。しかし、その初戦の結果たるや散々なものだった。
reading: １９８７年春、彼はついにデビューを果たした。しかし、その初戦の結果たるや散々なものだった。
english: In the spring of 1987, he ﬁnally made his debut. But, the result of that ﬁrst match was so miserable.

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: 彼のバンジョーは最高だ。特にその速弾きテクニックたるやたぶん世界でも彼の右に出る者はいないのではないだろうか。
reading: 彼のバンジョーは最高だ。特にその速弾きテクニックたるやたぶん世界でも彼の右に出る者はいないのではないだろうか。
english: His banjo playing is the best. Particularly when it comes to his fast plucking technique, I can't imagine anyone in the world who could do it better.

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: このダイエット教室の参加費は決して安くはないが、その効果たるや絶大である。
reading: このダイエット教室の参加費は決して安くはないが、その効果たるや絶大である。
english: The fee for joining this diet class is certainly not cheap, but the results are tremendous!

translation: When it comes to ~; speaking of
explanation: A compound particle used to present a subtopic about which the writer provides surprising or impressive information.
japanese: ロボカップは、サッカーをするロボットの世界一を競う大会である。１９９７年に名古屋で第1回大会が開かれて以来、国際大会が毎年開かれてきたが、その間の「選手」の技量の向上たるや著しい。
reading: ロボカップは、サッカーをするロボットの世界一を競う大会である。１９９７年に名古屋で第1回大会が開かれて以来、国際大会が毎年開かれてきたが、その間の「選手」の技量の向上たるや著しい。
english: RoboCup is a competition where soccer-playing robots compete to be ﬁrst in the world. Since the ﬁrst championship was held in Nagoya in 1997, an international competition has been held every year, and the "players'" skills have shown remarkable improvement since the first tournament.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 一人で旅行に行ったって面白くない。
reading: 一人で旅行に行ったって面白くない。
english: It's not fun traveling (literally: if I travel) alone.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 私は少しくらい高く(っ)たって、質のいいものを買うことにしている。
reading: 私は少しくらい高く(っ)たって、質のいいものを買うことにしている。
english: I make it a rule to buy good quality things even if they are a little more expensive.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: いくら日本語が上手だって専門知識がなかったらこの翻訳はできないよ。
reading: いくら日本語が上手だって専門知識がなかったらこの翻訳はできないよ。
english: No matter how good someone's Japanese is, he/she cannot do this translation without technical knowledge (in this ﬁeld).

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: プロだって失敗することもある。
reading: プロだって失敗することもある。
english: Even professionals make mistakes. (literally: Even if he is a professional, there are times when he makes a mistake.)

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 仕事を変えたって問題は解決しない。
reading: 仕事を変えたって問題は解決しない。
english: Even if you change your job, it won't solve the problem.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 苦しくったって諦めちゃいけない。
reading: 苦しくったって諦めちゃいけない。
english: Even if it's a struggle, you shouldn't give up.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 古くたって新しくたって、よいものはよいのだ。
reading: 古くたって新しくたって、よいものはよいのだ。
english: Whether it's old or new, a good thing is good.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: いくら通勤に便利だってこの家賃は高すぎる。
reading: いくら通勤に便利だってこの家賃は高すぎる。
english: No matter how convenient (the location) is for commuting, the rent is too high.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 誰だってそんなことを言われたら腹が立つよ。
reading: 誰だってそんなことを言われたら腹が立つよ。
english: No matter who it is, anyone would get mad if you said that to him.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: コンピュータがなくったってこの仕事はできる。
reading: コンピュータがなくったってこの仕事はできる。
english: You can do this job even if you don't have a computer.

explanation: The informal form of ても.
japanese: 自分で料理しなくたって、お金さえ出せば食べたいものが簡単に手に入るようになった。
reading: 自分で料理しなくたって、お金さえ出せば食べたいものが簡単に手に入るようになった。
english: Even if you don't cook yourself, you can easily get what you want to eat now if you just pay for it.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 一人でしよう(っ)たって、それは無理だ。
reading: 一人でしよう(っ)たって、それは無理だ。
english: You'll never be able to do it alone! (literally: Even if you try to do it alone, that's impossible.)

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 今すぐ買いに行く(っ)たって、もう店はみんな閉まっている。
reading: 今すぐ買いに行く(っ)たって、もう店はみんな閉まっている。
english: Even if you wanted to go buy it right now, the stores are all already closed.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 高い(っ)たって、１００万円はしないだろう。
reading: 高い(っ)たって、１００万円はしないだろう。
english: Even though it's said to be expensive, my guess is it won't cost more than one million yen.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 日本語教育の経験者(だ)ったって、彼女はまだ日本以外で教えたことはない。
reading: 日本語教育の経験者(だ)ったって、彼女はまだ日本以外で教えたことはない。
english: Although she has experience teaching Japanese, she hasn't yet taught anywhere outside of Japan.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: あの家は君が買おうったって買えるようなものじゃない。
reading: あの家は君が買おうったって買えるようなものじゃない。
english: That house is not something you could buy even if you wanted to.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 僕を騙そうったってそうはいかない。
reading: 僕を騙そうったってそうはいかない。
english: It won't work if you try to cheat me.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 彼が何を言おうったってそれをとめようとは思わない。
reading: 彼が何を言おうったってそれをとめようとは思わない。
english: Whatever he may want to say, I don't think I'll stop it.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 今から帰るったってもう電車はないよ。
reading: 今から帰るったってもう電車はないよ。
english: There are no more trains even if (you say) you want to go home now.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 調べるったって、こんなたくさんある資料を一人で調べるのは無理だ。
reading: 調べるったって、こんなたくさんある資料を一人で調べるのは無理だ。
english: Even if you say you'll look through the materials, it's impossible for you to do it alone because there are so many.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 近いったってとても歩いて行ける距離じゃない。
reading: 近いったってとても歩いて行ける距離じゃない。
english: Although (I say) it's close, it's not a distance you can walk at all.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: いくら簡単ったって、やっぱり最低限のパソコン知識がなくては使えない。
reading: いくら簡単ったって、やっぱり最低限のパソコン知識がなくては使えない。
english: No matter how simple (they say) it is, in fact you won't be able to use it without a minimum knowledge of computers.

explanation: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
japanese: 「断食」ったって、全く何も口に入れないんじゃない。1日に2回、野菜ジュースを飲むことはできる。
reading: 「断食」ったって、全く何も口に入れないんじゃない。1日に2回、野菜ジュースを飲むことはできる。
english: Although I say "fasting," it's not like you can't put anything in your mouth. You can drink vegetable juice twice a day.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 過去の業績に安住してばかりはいられない。
reading: 過去の業績に安住してばかりはいられない。
english: We just cannot be content with our past performance.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 確かにこれは深刻な事態だが、議論ばかりしてはいられない。
reading: 確かにこれは深刻な事態だが、議論ばかりしてはいられない。
english: Indeed, this is a serious situation, but we cannot just keep discussing it.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 周りの人が助けてくれるからと言って、いつまでも人にばかり頼ってはいられない。
reading: 周りの人が助けてくれるからと言って、いつまでも人にばかり頼ってはいられない。
english: Just because the people around me have helped me out in the past, I can't depend on others endlessly.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: やっと長年の夢であったマイホーム手に入れたが、喜んでばかりはいられない。これから大きなローンを返していかなければならないのだ。
reading: やっと長年の夢であったマイホーム手に入れたが、喜んでばかりはいられない。これから大きなローンを返していかなければならないのだ。
english: I ﬁnally own a house, which I have hoped to do for years, but I can't remain excited for long. Now I have a huge loan to repay.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: リストラのショックからまだ完全に立ち直ったわけじゃないけど、いつまでも落ち込んでばかりもいられない。すぐに仕事探しを始めなければ。
reading: リストラのショックからまだ完全に立ち直ったわけじゃないけど、いつまでも落ち込んでばかりもいられない。すぐに仕事探しを始めなければ。
english: I haven't fully recovered from the shock of being laid off, but I cannot waste my time just feeling depressed. I have to start looking for a job right away.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 希望の学校に入れなかったからと言って、くじけてばかりはいられない。
reading: 希望の学校に入れなかったからと言って、挫けてばかりはいられない。
english: I just can't let it get me down because I didn't get into the school I wanted.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 人の成功に感心ばかりしてはいられない。我々ももっと頑張らなければ。
reading: 人の成功に感心ばかりしてはいられない。我々ももっと頑張らなければ。
english: We can't just sit around being impressed by someone else's success. We have to work harder, too.

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 障害の原因ばかり考えてもいられない。早急に失われたデータを回復する必要がある。
reading: 障害の原因ばかり考えてもいられない。早急に失われたデータを回復する必要がある。
english: We can't just keep thinking about what caused the trouble. We have to recover the lost data immediately.
extra_notes: 障害 = not just disorder--also means trouble, dysfunction, difficulty, obstruction)

grammar_point: てばかりはいられない
translation: Cannot just; cannot always; cannot just keep ~ing; cannot spend time just ~ing; cannot waste time just ~ing
explanation: A phrase representing the idea that someone cannot just keep doing something or waste time being consumed by some emotion.
japanese: 退職して悠々自適の生活ができるようになったが、家にばかりこもってもいられないのでボランティアの仕事を始めた。
reading: 退職して悠々自適の生活ができるようになったが、家にばかりこもってもいられないのでボランティアの仕事を始めた。
english: Now that I'm retired I can live as I like, but I just can't stay at home, so I've begun to do volunteer work.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 考えても考えても思い出せない。
reading: 考えても考えても思い出せない。
english: No matter how much/hard I try (literally: think), I cannot remember it.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 働いても働いてもお金が貯まらない。
reading: 働いても働いてもお金が貯まらない。
english: No matter how much/hard I work, I cannot save money.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 掘っても掘っても水は出てこなかった。
reading: 掘っても掘っても水は出てこなかった。
english: No matter how much/deep I dug, I didn't hit water.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 歩いても歩いても町が見えてこない。
reading: 歩いても歩いても町が見えてこない。
english: No matter how far I walk, I can't see (the next) town.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 練習しても練習してもゴルフがうまくならない。
reading: 練習しても練習してもゴルフがうまくならない。
english: No matter how hard I practice, my golf does not improve.

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 暑い上に湿度が高いので、拭っても拭っても汗が吹き出してくる。
reading: 暑い上に湿度が高いので、拭っても拭っても汗が吹き出してくる。
english: Because it's hot and humid (literally: it is humid on top of being hot), I sweat no matter how many times/much I wipe (my face).

translation: No matter how much/often/hard/etc.; no matter how many times
explanation: A structure meaning “even if someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: このクラスの学生は教えても教えても覚えないので、教えがいがない。
reading: このクラスの学生は教えても教えても覚えないので、教えがいがない。
english: Because the students in this class never learn no matter how many times I teach them (the same things), I feel like it's not worth teaching them.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: 会社の理不尽なリストラに腹が立って仕方がない。
reading: 会社の理不尽なリストラに腹が立って仕方がない。
english: I'm so mad at the company's unreasonable restructuring (and cannot control my anger).

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: 久しぶりに妻や子供たちに会えるので嬉しくて仕方がない。
reading: 久しぶりに妻や子供たちに会えるので嬉しくて仕方がない。
english: Because I get to see my wife and children for the ﬁrst time in a long while, I am so happy (and can hardly control my emotion).

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: ここは何もすることがないので退屈で仕方がない。
reading: ここは何もすることがないので退屈で仕方がない。
english: Because I have nothing to do here, I'm unbearably bored.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: アンディーがアメリカに帰ってまだ二日しか経っていないのに、寂しくて仕方がない。
reading: アンディーがアメリカに帰ってまだ二日しか経っていないのに、寂しくて仕方がない。
english: Although it's been only two days since Andy went back to America, I miss him so much (literally: I'm so lonely and can hardly control my emotion).

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: こんなすばらしい建物が取り壊されるのかと思うと残念で仕方がない。
reading: こんなすばらしい建物が取り壊されるのかと思うと残念で仕方がない。
english: I feel so bad when I think that such a wonderful building is going to be demolished.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: ボーイフレンドが一年の日本留学を終えて来週帰ってくる。早く会いたくて仕方がない。
reading: ボーイフレンドが一年の日本留学を終えて来週帰ってくる。早く会いたくて仕方がない。
english: My boyfriend is coming back next week after finishing his year of study in Japan. I'm dying to see him (literally: I want to see him soon so much)!

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: 悪い風邪を引いたらしい。咳が出て仕方がない。
reading: 悪い風邪を引いたらしい。咳が出て仕方がない。
english: I seem to have a bad cold. I cannot control my coughing.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: ここは空港のすぐ近くなので飛行機の音がうるさくて仕方がない。
reading: ここは空港のすぐ近くなので飛行機の音がうるさくて仕方がない。
english: Because this place is close to an airport, the noise from the airplanes is unbearable.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: この参考書は索引が不完全なので使いにくくて仕方がない。
reading: この参考書は索引が不完全なので使いにくくて仕方がない。
english: Because this reference book has an incomplete index, it is so hard to use.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: 私のうちは近くにスーパーもコンビニもないので不便で仕方がない。
reading: 私のうちは近くにスーパーもコンビニもないので不便で仕方がない。
english: Because there is neither a supermarket nor a convenience store near my house, it is unbearably inconvenient.

translation: Cannot help ~ing; cannot stop feeling; (so ~ and) cannot control ~; so ~ and ~ cannot bare it; so; unbearably
explanation: A phrase that represents emotions the speaker/writer cannot control or sensations/situations he/she cannot bear.
japanese: 先週、学会で会った女性が気になって仕方がない。
reading: 先週、学会で会った女性が気になって仕方がない。
english: I cannot stop thinking about the woman I met at the academic conference last week.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 将来のことを考えると、いつまでもこんな仕事をしてはいられない。
reading: 将来のことを考えると、いつまでもこんな仕事をしてはいられない。
english: When I think about the future, (I realise) I can't keep doing this kind of work forever.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 彼女があまりにも自分勝手だったので、一言言わないではいられなかった。
reading: 彼女があまりにも自分勝手だったので、一言言わないではいられなかった。
english: Because she was acting so selﬁshly, I couldn't resist saying something to her.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 彼が好きだと気づいた時から、もうただの友達ではいられなくなった。
reading: 彼が好きだと気づいた時から、もうただの友達ではいられなくなった。
english: Once I realised that I loved him, I couldn't be just a friend anymore.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: もうすぐ飛行機が出るのでぐずぐずしてはいられない。
reading: もうすぐ飛行機が出るのでぐずぐずしてはいられない。
english: My plane is departing soon, so I cannot afford to dawdle.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: やることがたくさんあるのでパーティーなんかに行ってはいられない。
reading: やることがたくさんあるのでパーティーなんかに行ってはいられない。
english: I have so many things to do that I can't spend my time going to parties.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 自分にも同じ口癖があるので人のことを笑ってはいられない。
reading: 自分にも同じ口癖があるので人のことを笑ってはいられない。
english: I have the same speech habits, so I can't afford to laugh at other people.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: あの教え方を見ていると時代錯誤を感じないではいられない。
reading: あの教え方を見ていると時代錯誤を感じないではいられない。
english: When I see that teaching method, I can't help thinking how outdated it is.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 忙しい時代に生まれ、時間に追われがちな今の子供たちを案じないではいられない。
reading: 忙しい時代に生まれ、時間に追われがちな今の子供たちを案じないではいられない。
english: I cannot help being concerned about today's children, who were born in such a busy age and who tend to be pressed for time.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 私は一日も本なしではいられない。
reading: 私は一日も本なしではいられない。
english: I can't go even a day without books.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: よその国の事件とは言え、同じようなことはこの国でも起きる可能性がある。とても無関心ではいられない。
reading: よその国の事件とは言え、同じようなことはこの国でも起きる可能性がある。とても無関心ではいられない。
english: Although that incident was in another country, it could happen in this country, too. I simply can't remain indifferent.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 彼女は日本中のみんなに期待されているので、もう普通の選手ではいられなくなった。
reading: 彼女は日本中のみんなに期待されているので、もう普通の選手ではいられなくなった。
english: With Japan's hopes riding on her, she can no longer be just an ordinary player.

translation: Cannot/shouldn’t be ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t keep ~ing; cannot/shouldn’t (stay/remain/etc.); cannot/shouldn’t waste time ~ing; cannot afford to; cannot help ~ing
explanation: A phrase that is used when someone cannot be doing something or be in some state due to a given situation.
japanese: 地球環境は急速に悪化している。いつまでもこのままではいられない。
reading: 地球環境は急速に悪化している。いつまでもこのままではいられない。
english: The earth's environment is worsening rapidly. We just can't continue to do nothing.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: ボーナス後の連休とあって、観光地はどこも人でいっぱいだ。
reading: ボーナス後の連休とあって、観光地はどこも人でいっぱいだ。
english: Because this is the series of holidays after the bonus season, (not surprisingly) all the tourist spots are crowded.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: 夏休みが始まったとあって、子供たちはみんな嬉しそうだ。
reading: 夏休みが始まったとあって、子供たちはみんな嬉しそうだ。
english: Summer vacation has begun, so the children all look happy.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: 優勝を争うチーム同士の対決とあって、スタジアムは超満員だ。
reading: 優勝を争うチーム同士の対決とあって、スタジアムは超満員だ。
english: Because this is the match between the teams competing for the championship, the stadium is packed beyond capacity.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: 人気作家のサイン会とあって、本屋にはサインを求める人たちが長い列を作った。
reading: 人気作家のサイン会とあって、本屋にはサインを求める人たちが長い列を作った。
english: Because it was the autograph session for a popular writer, people (who wanted his autograph) made a long line at the bookstore.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: レポートの締め切りがあさってとあって、学生たちはみんな焦っている。
reading: レポートの締め切りがあさってとあって、学生たちはみんな焦っている。
english: Because the deadline for the paper is the day after tomorrow, the students are all panicking.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: 掃除が終わったらお菓子がもらえるとあって、子供たちは一生懸命手伝っている。
reading: <ruby title="掃除(そうじ)"><rb>掃除</rb><rt>そうじ</rt></ruby>が終わったらお菓子がもらえるとあって、子供たちは一生懸命手伝っている。
english: Because they know they'll get sweets after they finish cleaning, the children are doing their very best to help out.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: 中途半端な訓練では実社会で通用しないとあって、この語学学校の指導は非常に厳しい。
reading: 中途半端な訓練では実社会で通用しないとあって、この語学学校の指導は非常に厳しい。
english: Because partial training does not help students function in the real world, the teaching at this language institution is very strict.

translation: Because ~, ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; because
explanation: A phrase that introduces a reason when the speaker/writer considers it natural that someone does something or is in some state, or that something takes place for that reason.
japanese: この社会人プログラムは、科目を低額で聴講できるだけでなく、自習室や図書館も自由に利用できるとあって、かなりの応募があります。
reading: この社会人プログラムは、科目を低額で聴講できるだけでなく、自習室や図書館も自由に利用できるとあって、かなりの応募があります。
english: Because this program for professionals not only allows students to audit courses cheaply but lets them use study rooms and the library freely, we receive quite a few applications.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: 社長の頼みとあっては断るわけにはいかない。
reading: 社長の頼みとあっては断るわけにはいかない。
english: If (it's true that) it's a favour for the president, I can't say no.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: 全商品が3割引きで買えるとあっては、遠方からわざわざ人が買いに来るのもうなずける。
reading: 全商品が3割引きで買えるとあっては、遠方からわざわざ人が買いに来るのもうなずける。
english: If (it's true that) you can buy everything at 30% off, I understand why people come from far away to shop (here).

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: この大学が他の大学に統合されるのは残念だが、国の方針とあっては致し方ない。
reading: この大学が他の大学に統合されるのは残念だが、国の方針とあっては致し方ない。
english: It is a pity that this university is going to be integrated into another university, but if that's the national policy, it cannot be helped.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: ブラジル・ドイツ戦のすぐ後とあっては国内チーム同士の試合が物足りなく感じられたのも仕方がない。
reading: ブラジル・ドイツ戦のすぐ後とあっては国内チーム同士の試合が物足りなく感じられたのも仕方がない。
english: Because it came right after the game between Brazil and Germany, it was inevitable that people did not feel the game between the domestic teams was very exciting.
extra_notes: 戦 = war, battle, match

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: 皆が多忙な身とあっては30人以上の家族が集まれるのはクリスマスの休みしかない。
reading: 皆が多忙な身とあっては30人以上の家族が集まれるのはクリスマスの休みしかない。
english: Since everyone is so busy, Christmas vacation is the only time our family of more than 30 can get together.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: スカイダイビングがここサイパンで楽しめるとあっては、挑戦してみない手はない。
reading: スカイダイビングがここサイパンで楽しめるとあっては、挑戦してみない手はない。
english: If it's true that we can enjoy skydiving here in Saipan, there's no reason not to try it.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: どんなに短い作文でも、他の人に読まれ、コメントがつくとあっては、書く時の真剣味が増す。
reading: どんなに短い作文でも、他の人に読まれ、コメントがつくとあっては、書く時の真剣味が増す。
english: No matter how short your composition is, if it is read by others and they make comments, it makes you think more seriously when you write.

translation: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; because; since
explanation: A conditional phrase that indirectly presents a factual situation as a reason.
japanese: 役人の飲食費に税金が使われたとあっては、誰もが腹立たしく思うのは当たり前だ。しかも、そのことが明るみに出そうになると、今度は圧力をかけて「口封じ」をやったとあっては、もう救いようがない。
reading: 役人の飲食費に税金が使われたとあっては、誰もが腹立たしく思うのは当たり前だ。しかも、そのことが明るみに出そうになると、今度は圧力をかけて「口封じ」をやったとあっては、もう救いようがない。
english: If tax money was used to pay for government officials' dining and drinking, of course people would be angry. But there's no hope if the ofﬁcials pressured those involved to keep their mouths shut when the practice was about to be exposed.

translation: As if; as if to say that; as if ~ were convinced that; as if ~ believed that; as if ~ decided that
explanation: A phrase that indicates that someone does something in order to convey something or in such a way that someone is convinced that something is the case.
japanese: 悟は「黙ってついてこい」とばかりに先に立って歩き出した。
reading: <ruby title="悟(さとる)"><rb>悟</rb><rt>さとる</rt></ruby>は「黙ってついてこい」とばかりに先に立って歩き出した。
english: Satoru started off (literally: began to walk ahead) as if to say: "Don't say anything and follow me."

translation: As if; as if to say that; as if ~ were convinced that; as if ~ believed that; as if ~ decided that
explanation: A phrase that indicates that someone does something in order to convey something or in such a way that someone is convinced that something is the case.
japanese: 課長は余計な質問はするなとばかりに私をにらみつけた。
reading: 課長は余計な質問はするなとばかりに私をにらみつけた。
english: My section chief glared at me as if to tell me not to ask any unnecessary questions.

translation: As if; as if to say that; as if ~ were convinced that; as if ~ believed that; as if ~ decided that
explanation: A phrase that indicates that someone does something in order to convey something or in such a way that someone is convinced that something is the case.
japanese: 霧が晴れたので、私は今がチャンスとばかりに写真を撮りまくった。
reading: 霧が晴れたので、私は今がチャンスとばかりに写真を撮りまくった。
english: The fog had cleared, so I took pictures furiously, as if it were my only chance.

translation: As if; as if to say that; as if ~ were convinced that; as if ~ believed that; as if ~ decided that
explanation: A phrase that indicates that someone does something in order to convey something or in such a way that someone is convinced that something is the case.
japanese: 竹本はこの時とばかりに日頃の不満を吐き出した。
reading: <ruby title="竹本(たけもと)"><rb>竹本</rb><rt>たけもと</rt></ruby>はこの時とばかりに日頃の不満を吐き出した。
english: Takemoto vented his long-held complaints as if he were convinced this was the time (to do so).
