explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 老眼が進んで眼鏡なしでは近くの字が読めないので、不便(と言)ったらない。
reading: 老眼が進んで眼鏡なしでは近くの字が読めないので、不便(と言)ったらない。
english: My farsightedness has gotten worse so I can't read words up close without my glasses—it's so inconvenient!

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 大きな書類を保存するのを忘れてコンピュータがフリーズした時の情けなさ(と言)ったらない。
reading: 大きな書類を保存するのを忘れてコンピュータがフリーズした時の情けなさ(と言)ったらない。
english: The miserable feeling you get when the computer freezes and you forgot to save a large ﬁle is indescribable.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この辞書は使いにくいこと(と言)ったらない。
reading: この辞書は使いにくいこと(と言)ったらない。
english: This dictionary is incredibly hard to use.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 5分ごとにジェット機が離陸するのでうるさいと言ったらない。
reading: 5分ごとにジェット機が離陸するのでうるさいと言ったらない。
english: There's a jet taking off every ﬁve minutes—I can't even describe (to you) how noisy it is.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: いつもよくしゃべる俊子が慎一の前で赤くなって何も言えないので、おかしいったらなかった。
reading: いつもよくしゃべる 俊子[としこ]が 慎一[しんいち]の前で赤くなって何も言えないので、おかしいったらなかった。
english: It was so funny to see Toshiko, who is usually talkative, blush and turn speechless in front of Shin'ichi.
extra_notes: おかしい can also mean funny, amusing, comical, laughable, ridiculous

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: ティムにデートをすっぽかされて頭に来るったらない。
reading: ティムにデートをすっぽかされて頭に来るったらない。
english: Tim stood me up, and that makes me so mad.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この仕事は一日中細かい字を見ているので目が疲れると言ったらない。
reading: この仕事は一日中細かい字を見ているので目が疲れると言ったらない。
english: Because I look at small print all day for this job, my eyes get awfully tired.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 出張したところはインターネットも携帯も使えず、不便と言ったらなかった。
reading: 出張したところはインターネットも携帯も使えず、不便と言ったらなかった。
english: In the area where I went on my business trip I couldn't use the Internet or my cell phone; I can't tell you how inconvenient it was.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: プロジェクトに変更があるたびに関係者全員に知らせた上で承認を得なければならないので、面倒と言ったらない。
reading: プロジェクトに変更があるたびに関係者全員に知らせた上で承認を得なければならないので、面倒と言ったらない。
english: Every time there is a change to the project, we have to notify everybody involved and get their approval, so it is incredibly tiresome.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 夏、暑い外から帰ってきた後の冷えたビールのうまさったらない。
reading: 夏、暑い外から帰ってきた後の冷えたビールのうまさったらない。
english: In summer, the taste of a cold beer is indescribably good after coming in from the heat outside.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この国ではインターネットが自由に使えないので、その不便さったらない。
reading: この国ではインターネットが自由に使えないので、その不便さったらない。
english: In this country we cannot use the Internet freely, so it's so inconvenient.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: ハイヒールで砂利道を歩かされたので歩きにくいことと言ったらなかった。
reading: ハイヒールで砂利道を歩かされたので歩きにくいことと言ったらなかった。
english: I had to walk on gravel in high heels, and I can't tell you how hard it was!

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 雪に覆われた山々が早朝の朝日を受けて宝石のように輝く姿の美しいことと言ったらない。
reading: 雪に覆われた山々が早朝の朝日を受けて宝石のように輝く姿の美しいことと言ったらない。
english: When the snow-covered mountains receive the early morning sun and sparkle like gems, they are indescribably beautiful.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 昔、痛風にかかったことがあるが、その痛みと言ったらなかった。
reading: 昔、痛風にかかったことがあるが、その痛みと言ったらなかった。
english: I've suffered from gout before; the pain was indescribable.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 学生がいいのは、学期が終わったら次の学期の始まりまでは自由なことだ。試験やレポートが全部終わった時の解放感と言ったらない。
reading: 学生がいいのは、学期が終わったら次の学期の始まりまでは自由なことだ。試験やレポートが全部終わった時の解放感と言ったらない。
english: One good thing about being a student is that after the term is over, you're free until the next term begins. The feeling of release after ﬁnishing all the exams and term papers is indescribable.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: インターフェースに若干の違いはあれ、この二つのプログラムは機能的には全く変わらない。
reading: インターフェースに若干の違いはあれ、この二つのプログラムは機能的には全く変わらない。
english: Although their interfaces are slightly different, these two programs are just the same in terms of their functions.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 歴史の違いはあれ、米国には１２０万を越す非営利団体(NPO)が存在します。
reading: 歴史の違いはあれ、米国には１２０万を越す非営利団体(NPO)が存在します。
english: Although their histories are different (literally: there are differences in their histories), there are more than 1,200,000 non-profit organizations in America.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: ほとんどの者が、程度の差はあれ、マスメディアの影響を受けていると言える。
reading: ほとんどの者が、程度の差はあれ、マスメディアの影響を受けていると言える。
english: One can say that most people are affected by mass media, although there are differences in degree.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: レベルに違いはあれ、この課にいる者は全員英語を話せる。
reading: レベルに違いはあれ、この課にいる者は全員英語を話せる。
english: Although their (skill) levels are different (literally: there are differences in their skill levels), everybody in this section can speak English.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 海外旅行に興味はあれ、先立つ費用がない。
reading: 海外旅行に興味はあれ、先立つ費用がない。
english: Even though I'm interested in traveling abroad, I don't have the money for it.
extra_notes: 先立つ = to be prerequisite

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 若干の不満はあれ、今の職場を離れるつもりはない。
reading: 若干の不満はあれ、今の職場を離れるつもりはない。
english: Even though I have some complaints (literally: dissatisfaction), I don't intend to leave my current job.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 今まで自分を使ってくれた上司に対して感謝する気持ちはあれ、非難する気持ちは全くありません。
reading: 今まで自分を使ってくれた上司に対して感謝する気持ちはあれ、非難する気持ちは全くありません。
english: I feel thankful for my boss, who has given me work to do all this time, and (literally: but) have no intention of criticizing him.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 特殊な場合は別として、手書きのレポートを書くことは少なくなった。
reading: 特殊な場合は別として、手書きのレポートを書くことは少なくなった。
english: Except for special cases, there are only a few occasions now in which we write hand-written reports.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 実施できるか(どうか)は別として、まず可能な解決策をすべてリストアップしてみよう。
reading: 実施できるか(どうか)は別として、まず可能な解決策をすべてリストアップしてみよう。
english: Putting aside the question of whether or not each one is feasible for us to carry out, let's list all possible solutions ﬁrst.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 上手か下手かは別としてその人にまず翻訳してもらおう。
reading: 上手か下手かは別としてその人にまず翻訳してもらおう。
english: Putting aside the question of whether he is good or bad, let's ask that person to translate it ﬁrst.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 面白い(か)面白くない(か)は別としてこの授業はきっと将来約に立つ。
reading: 面白い(か)面白くない(か)は別としてこの授業はきっと将来約に立つ。
english: Putting aside the question of whether it is interesting or not, this class will certainly beneﬁt you in the future.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 医師により薬として使用される場合は別として、麻薬は本質的に反社会的なものとされている。
reading: 医師により薬として使用される場合は別として、麻薬は本質的に反社会的なものとされている。
english: Except for cases in which they are prescribed by doctors as medicines, drugs are considered fundamentally anti-social.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 一部の過激派は別として、一般大衆は民主化を望んでいる。
reading: 一部の過激派は別として、一般大衆は民主化を望んでいる。
english: Except for a few extremists, the general public wants democratization.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: その映画は、ストーリーは別として、音楽やアクションは楽しめた。
reading: その映画は、ストーリーは別として、音楽やアクションは楽しめた。
english: Leaving the story aside, I did enjoy the music and action scenes in the movie.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 賛成していただけるかどうかは別として、私の率直な意見を述べさせていただきます。
reading: 賛成していただけるかどうかは別として、私の率直な意見を述べさせていただきます。
english: Setting aside the question of whether or not you will agree with me, let me present my frank opinion.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: そういうところが実際にあるかどうかは別として、自分の理想とする会社はどんなところかを書いて下さい。
reading: そういうところが実際にあるかどうかは別として、自分の理想とする会社はどんなところかを書いて下さい。
english: Putting aside the question of whether or not such a company actually exists, please describe your ideal company.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: ケーブル接続かワイヤレスかは別として、今時インターネットに接続されていないコンピュータはほとんどないと思う。
reading: ケーブル接続かワイヤレスかは別として、今時インターネットに接続されていないコンピュータはほとんどないと思う。
english: Putting aside the question of whether a wired connection or a wireless connection is used, there are hardly any computers that are not connected to the Internet now.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: いい悪いは別として、この国では患者本人に病状の事実を伝えるのが普通だ。
reading: いい悪いは別として、この国では患者本人に病状の事実を伝えるのが普通だ。
english: Whether it is good or bad, it is a common practice in this country to tell patients (directly) the facts about their conditions.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: この賞は、生活者の目に触れるか触れないかは別として、人々の生活を豊かにする技術や発明に対して与えられる。
reading: この賞は、生活者の目に触れるか触れないかは別として、人々の生活を豊かにする技術や発明に対して与えられる。
english: This award is given for technologies or inventions that make people's lives richer, whether or not they are readily recognizable (literally: to people in their ordinary daily lives).

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 単身赴任など仕事上の理由がある場合は別として、夫婦が5年間も別居しているのは尋常ではない。
reading: 単身赴任など仕事上の理由がある場合は別として、夫婦が5年間も別居しているのは尋常ではない。
english: Except for cases in which there is a business reason such as being sent on assignment alone, it is not ordinary for a married couple to live separately for as long as ﬁve years.

translation: Except for; putting/setting aside; whether X or Y
explanation: A phrase used to present an exception or an issue the speaker/writer does not intend to cover as part of a larger statement.
japanese: 掲示板やチャットで発言する際は、ごく親しい仲間内の場合は別として、丁寧な言葉遣いを心がけるべきだ。
reading: 掲示板やチャットで発言する際は、ごく親しい仲間内の場合は別として、丁寧な言葉遣いを心がけるべきだ。
english: When you express your opinions on (Internet) bulletin boards or in chat rooms, except for cases in which you are talking only amongst your close friends, you should try to use polite language.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 友達を助けようという動機はいいとしてもやり方が間違っている。
reading: 友達を助けようという動機はいいとしてもやり方が間違っている。
english: Your motivation for helping your friend is all right, but your way (of doing it) is wrong.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 私はいいとしても他の人がこの部屋では満足しないだろう。
reading: 私はいいとしても他の人がこの部屋では満足しないだろう。
english: Even if I accept it, other people wouldn't be satisﬁed with this room.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 部屋が狭いのはいいとしてもエアコンがないのは困る。
reading: 部屋が狭いのはいいとしてもエアコンがないのは困る。
english: I'd accept a small room, but not having an air-conditioner there is not acceptable.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 著作権のあるものは、個人用のコピーはいいとしても、それを他人に配付することは違法になります。
reading: 著作権のあるものは、個人用のコピーはいいとしても、それを他人に配付することは違法になります。
english: Regarding copyrighted materials, making copies for one's own use may be all right, but distributing them to others is illegal.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 街頭はいいとしても、電車やレストランなどの公共の場所で声高に携帯電話で話されるのは周りの者にとって極めて迷惑だ。
reading: 街頭はいいとしても、電車やレストランなどの公共の場所で声高に携帯電話で話されるのは周りの者にとって極めて迷惑だ。
english: Although it might be all right on the street, talking loudly on your cell phone in public places like trains and restaurants is extremely annoying to the people around you.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: このような結婚式では、結婚する本人たちはいいとしても両親が承知しないだろう。
reading: このような結婚式では、結婚する本人たちはいいとしても両親が承知しないだろう。
english: Even if it is all right with the couple getting married, their parents probably won't approve of this kind of wedding ceremony.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: この店は安いから味が少しくらい悪いのはまあいいとしても、古い材料を使うのはやめてもらいたい。
reading: この店は安いから味が少しくらい悪いのはまあいいとしても、古い材料を使うのはやめてもらいたい。
english: Because this restaurant is cheap, it's all right for the food to taste a little off, but they should stop using old ingredients (for cooking).

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: 今の社宅は一般の賃貸に比べて格段に安いのであまり文句は言えないのだが、建物が古いのはいいとしても、傷んだところをなかなか補修してもらえないのは問題だ。
reading: 今の社宅は一般の賃貸に比べて格段に安いのであまり文句は言えないのだが、建物が古いのはいいとしても、<ruby title="傷(いた)"><rb>傷</rb><rt>いた</rt></ruby>んだところをなかなか補修してもらえないのは問題だ。
english: The rent for the company house (we live in) now is much cheaper than that of ordinary houses, so we can't complain much. And even though we accept the old building, the fact that we can't get repairs done quickly when something is damaged is a problem.

translation: Be all right, but; might be all right, but; would be fine, but; would accept ~, but; even if ~ accept; even though ~ accept; although ~ accept
explanation: A phrase that conveys the meaning “even if I/we accept something, something else is not acceptable”.
japanese: ウイルスのために自分自身のコンピュータが使えなくなるのはいいとしても、何も対処しないで他の人にウイルスをまき散らすことは許されない。
reading: ウイルスのために自分自身のコンピュータが使えなくなるのはいいとしても、何も対処しないで他の人にウイルスをまき散らすことは許されない。
english: It's one thing to lose the use of your own computer (literally: It might be all right to lose the use of your own computer) because of a virus, but it's simply unforgivable to do nothing to get rid of it and thereby spread the virus to others.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: インターネットはおろか、パソコンも触ってことがないのだが、講習会についていけるだろうか。
reading: インターネットはおろか、パソコンも触ってことがないのだが、講習会についていけるだろうか。
english: Never having touched a computer, let alone used the Internet, I wonder if I will be able to keep up in the workshop.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: 最近は大学生はおろか、中学生でもかなりの者が海外旅行を経験している。
reading: 最近は大学生はおろか、中学生でもかなりの者が海外旅行を経験している。
english: Never mind college students, these days even junior and senior high school students often have experienced traveling abroad.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: アメリカでは、隣町まで１００マイル、途中ガソリンスタンドはおろか、民家さえないという場所がたくさんある。
reading: アメリカでは、隣町まで１００マイル、途中ガソリンスタンドはおろか、民家さえないという場所がたくさんある。
english: In America there are many places where the next town is 100 miles away and there are no houses, let alone a gas station, in between.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: ハリス氏は日本の現代文学はおろか、古典にまで通じている。
reading: ハリス氏は日本の現代文学はおろか、古典にまで通じている。
english: Mr. Harris is quite familiar with classics of Japanese literature, to say nothing of (his knowledge of) modern Japanese literature.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: 「近くて遠い」。この表現は日本との国交がない北朝鮮はおろか、韓国との関係を指すのにもよく使われてきた。
reading: 「近くて遠い」。この表現は日本との国交がない北朝鮮はおろか、韓国との関係を指すのにもよく使われてきた。
english: Near yet far. This phrase has often been used to describe Japan's relationship not only with North Korea, with which it has no diplomatic relations, but with South Korea as well.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: 英語を話すのが好きなだけで、英米の文学はおろか日本の文学もろくに読んでいない学生が英米学専攻に入ってくると悲惨だ。
reading: 英語を話すのが好きなだけで、英米の文学はおろか日本の文学もろくに読んでいない学生が英米学専攻に入ってくると悲惨だ。
english: It'll be a tragedy if a student who has barely even read any Japanese literature, much less British or American literature, signs up to major in English literature just because he or she likes to speak English.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: 企業は今、セキュリティのための支出を増やさなければ、セキュリティの強化はおろか、維持さえも難しくなっているという。
reading: 企業は今、セキュリティのための支出を増やさなければ、セキュリティの強化はおろか、維持さえも難しくなっているという。
english: It is said that it has become more difﬁcult for businesses to maintain security, let alone enhance it, without increasing their security expenses.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: このサイトは検索はおろか、本の内容紹介までしてくれるので非常に便利だ。
reading: このサイトは検索はおろか、本の内容紹介までしてくれるので非常に便利だ。
english: Not only does this website let you search (for books), it also gives a summary of the (searched) books' contents, so it's very convenient.

translation: Let alone; not only ~ (but also ~); not to mention; to say nothing of; never mind; much less
explanation: A phrase that is used when something is not only true with one thing or person, but also with another thing or person that is less expected or understandable.
japanese: 戦争はおろか食糧難すら経験したことがない者が、口先だけて戦争を議論しているのは笑止だ。
reading: 戦争はおろか食糧難すら経験したことがない者が、口先だけで戦争を議論しているのは笑止だ。
english: It is laughable that those people who have never even experienced a food shortage, much less a war, make glib arguments about war.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: この店のサービスランチは値段の割に(は)おいしくボリュームがある。
reading: この店のサービスランチは値段の割に(は)おいしくボリュームがある。
english: The bargain lunch at this restaurant is tasty and the portions are generous for the price.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: ビルはよく勉強している割に(は)成績が伸びない。
reading: ビルはよく勉強している割に(は)成績が伸びない。
english: For all his hard work, Bill's grades don't seem to improve. / Although Bill studies hard, his grades do not improve.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: このチームは強い割に(は)人気がない。
reading: このチームは強い割に(は)人気がない。
english: This team is not popular despite its strength.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 彼は大学で秀才だった割に(は)実社会であまり成功していない。
reading: 彼は大学で秀才だった割に(は)実社会であまり成功していない。
english: He's not doing very well in the business world considering that he was such a brilliant student at college. / He was a brilliant student at college, but, despite that, he is not doing very well in the business world.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 彼女はずばらしい研究をしているが、その割に(は)認められていない。
reading: 彼女はすばらしい研究をしているが、その割に(は)認められていない。
english: She is doing excellent research, but hasn't gained as much recognition as she deserves.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 清水さんは年の割には若く見える。
reading: 清水[しみず]さんは年の割には若く見える。
english: Ms. Shimizu looks young for her age.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: この辺りはいつも海からの風があるので、強い日射しの割には過ごしやすい。
reading: この辺りはいつも海からの風があるので、強い日射しの割には過ごしやすい。
english: Because there is always a wind coming up off the sea in this area, it is comfortable (to stay here) despite the strong sun.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: このソフトは安い割には機能がよく、使いやすいです。
reading: このソフトは安い割には機能がよく、使いやすいです。
english: For as cheap as it is, this software is easy to use and has good functionality.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: この図書館は建物が立派な割には中の設備がよくない。
reading: この図書館は建物が立派な割には中の設備がよくない。
english: Despite the impressive building, the facilities inside this library are not that good.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 多くの人が「有機野菜」表示を気にする割には、その意味を知っている人は少ない。
reading: 多くの人が「有機野菜」表示を気にする割には、その意味を知っている人は少ない。
english: Although many people pay attention to "organic vegetable" labels (on produce), few know what they mean.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: アトルなどの都市がある北部太平洋岸は比較的暖かく、緯度が北海道と変わらない割には冬の寒さも厳しくない。
reading: シアトルなどの都市がある北部太平洋岸は比較的暖かく、緯度が北海道と変わらない割には冬の寒さも厳しくない。
english: The Pacific Northwest, which is home to cities like Seattle, has a relatively mild climate, and the winter is not as bitterly cold (as one would think,) despite the fact that it is at about the same latitude as Hokkaido.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 記念すべきイベントの割には参加者が少なく物足りない気がする。
reading: 記念すべきイベントの割には参加者が少なく物足りない気がする。
english: For an event that should be commemorated, there aren't many participants; I'm not quite satisﬁed.

translation: For; despite; although; (not) as much as; (not) ~ because of that; considering
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is not in proportion to what one would normally expect.
japanese: 彼は自国の大学で英語を教えていると言っているが、その割には英語が下手だ。
reading: 彼は自国の大学で英語を教えていると言っているが、その割には英語が下手だ。
english: He says that he teaches English at a university in his country, but despite that his English is poor.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 飛行機は12時間も遅れるわ荷物はなくなるわ(で)、今度の旅行は最悪だった。
reading: 飛行機は12時間も遅れるわ荷物はなくなるわ(で)、今度の旅行は最悪だった。
english: The ﬂight was delayed l2 hours, and my luggage was lost; this trip was the worst.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 客が来るわ来るわ、またたく間に小さい店はいっぱいになった。
reading: 客が来るわ来るわ、またたく間に小さい店はいっぱいになった。
english: Customers came in one after another, and in the blink of an eye, the small shop had ﬁlled up.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 仕事は増えるわ給料が下がるわ、今の状況は最悪だ。
reading: 仕事は増えるわ給料が下がるわ、今の状況は最悪だ。
english: We have more work to do, and our salaries have been cut; the current situation could not be  worse.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: クレジットカードをなくすわ怪我をするわで、今度のスキー旅行ではひどい目に遭った。
reading: クレジットカードをなくすわ怪我をするわで、今度のスキー旅行ではひどい目に遭った。
english: Having lost my credit card and gotten injured--I had an awful time on this ski trip.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 新しく雇った学生アルバイトは、仕事は遅いわ文句は多いわで、とても使いものにならない。
reading: 新しく雇った学生アルバイトは、仕事は遅いわ文句は多いわで、とても使いものにならない。
english: The student part-timer we hired recently is (of) no help (to us) because he (literally: his work) is slow and he complains a lot.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: この辺りは買い物には不便だわ環境は悪いわ、何一ついいところがない。
reading: この辺りは買い物には不便だわ環境は悪いわ、何一ついいところがない。
english: There's nothing good around here—the shopping is inconvenient and the environment is bad.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 台所は何一つ手伝おうとしないわ、一緒に外食してもお金を払わないわ、もうあんな客は来てほしくない。
reading: 台所は何一つ手伝おうとしないわ、一緒に外食してもお金を払わないわ、もうあんな客は来てほしくない。
english: She never offered to help in the kitchen or paid anything when we went out to eat; I don't want any more houseguests like that.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 面白い仕事はもらえるわ給料は上げてもらえるわ、新井君は最近いいことずくめだ。
reading: 面白い仕事はもらえるわ給料は上げてもらえるわ、 新井[あらい]君は最近いいことずくめだ。
english: He gets interesting work and a raise—Arai has had a real streak of good fortune lately.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 辞書で「コウ」という発音の漢字を調べてみたら、あるわあるわ、全部で１７４も出ていた。
reading: 辞書で「コウ」という発音の漢字を調べてみたら、あるわあるわ、全部で１７４も出ていた。
english: When I looked up the kanji with the pronunciation "kou" in a dictionary, there were so many of them—174 in all.

translation: X and Y; for example, X and Y; because X and Y; so many; so much; one after another
explanation: A structure that emphatically presents actions, events or states as examples or reasons, or indicates that someone does something or something happens to a great extent.
japanese: 余程おなかが空いていたのだろう。食べるわ食べるわ、またたく間に大きな茶わんでご飯を5杯も平らげた。
reading: 余程おなかが空いていたのだろう。食べるわ食べるわ、またたく間に大きな茶わんでご飯を5杯も平らげた。
english: He must have been very hungry. He ate and ate, and ﬁnished ﬁve large bowls of rice in an instant.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: その小説は発売されるや否やミリオンセラーになった。
reading: その小説は発売されるや否やミリオンセラーになった。
english: The novel sold one million copies as soon as it went on sale.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: 彼女は車から降りるや否や報道陣やファンに取り囲まれた。
reading: 彼女は車から降りるや否や報道陣やファンに取り囲まれた。
english: She was surrounded by reporters and fans as soon as she got out of the car.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: スタジオに着くや否やリハーサルが始まった。
reading: スタジオに着くや否やリハーサルが始まった。
english: The rehearsal began as soon as I arrived at the studio.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: 秀夫はアパートに帰るや否やベッドに倒れ込んだ。
reading: 秀夫[ひでお]はアパートに帰るや否やベッドに倒れ込んだ。
english: Hideo collapsed on his bed as soon as he returned to his apartment.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: 母の顔を見るや否や涙が込み上げてきた。
reading: 母の顔を見るや否や涙が込み上げてきた。
english: As soon as I saw my mother (literally: mother's face), my tears welled up.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: 小池氏はメディアから批判されるや否や、手のひらを返すように意見を変えた。
reading: 小池氏はメディアから批判されるや否や、手のひらを返すように意見を変えた。
english: No sooner was he criticized by the media than Mr. Koike abruptly (literally: as if he turned his hand over) changed his opinion.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: ジョージは大学を卒業するや否やゲームソフトのビジネスを始めた。
reading: ジョージは大学を卒業するや否やゲームソフトのビジネスを始めた。
english: George started his own game software business the moment he graduated from college.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: 安くておいしいと評判のそのレストランは、朝11時に開店するや否や、常連客でいっぱいになった。
reading: 安くておいしいと評判のそのレストランは、朝11時に開店するや否や、常連客でいっぱいになった。
english: The restaurant, which is popular for its reasonable prices and good food, was full of regular customers as soon as it opened at 11:00 a.m.

translation: As soon as; no sooner ~ than; the moment; soon after; immediately after
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea that something happened or someone did something immediately following another event or action.
japanese: そのテレビドラマは1回目が放映されるや否や、国中に大きな韓国ブームを引き起こした。
reading: そのテレビドラマは1回目が放映されるや否や、国中に大きな韓国ブームを引き起こした。
english: As soon as the ﬁrst episode of the TV drama was telecast, it sparked a big Korea boom throughout the country.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: このビルが完成するのはいつになるのやら。
reading: このビルが完成するのはいつになるのやら。
english: I wonder when this building will be ﬁnished.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: これから先、うちの会社は一体どうなることやら。
reading: これから先、うちの会社は一体どうなることやら。
english: I wonder what will happen to our company from now on. (I'm quite worried.)

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: こんな映画のどこがいいのやらさっぱり分からない。
reading: こんな映画のどこがいいのやらさっぱり分からない。
english: I just don't understand what is good about this movie.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: 学生たちが何やら面白そうな計画をしている。
reading: 学生たちが何やら面白そうな計画をしている。
english: The students are planning something interesting.
extra_notes: 何やら is actually a word meaning "some kind of" here

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: 競技場ははたしてオリンピック開会までに完成するのやら。
reading: 競技場ははたしてオリンピック開会までに完成するのやら。
english: I really wonder if the stadium will be completed in time for the Olympic Games.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: 一体いつになったら自分の家が持てることやら。
reading: 一体いつになったら自分の家が持てることやら。
english: I wonder when I'll be able to have my own house. (I feel almost hopeless.)

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: さっきまでの元気はどこへ行ったのやら。
reading: さっきまでの元気はどこへ行ったのやら。
english: I wonder where all the energy he had just a little bit ago has gone.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: どこが入り口やら分からずビルの周りを何度も回った。
reading: どこが入り口やら分からずビルの周りを何度も回った。
english: Not being able to ﬁgure out where the entrance was, I walked around the building several times.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: 誰も名札をつけていないので誰が誰やらさっぱり分からない。
reading: 誰も名札をつけていないので誰が誰やらさっぱり分からない。
english: No one is wearing a name tag, so I simply cannot figure out who's who.

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: 今日はどんなご馳走を食べさせてもらえるのやら、とても楽しみだ。
reading: 今日はどんなご馳走を食べさせてもらえるのやら、とても楽しみだ。
english: I wonder what kind of feast they'll have for me to eat today. I can't wait!

translation: I wonder (if)
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal particle that marks a self-addressed question.
japanese: いつのまにやら外は暗くなっていた。
reading: いつのまにやら外は暗くなっていた。
english: It got dark outside before I realised it.
extra_notes: いつのまにやら is actually a phrase meaning "before one knows/is aware"

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 私は会議やら講習会やらでこのところ出張が続いている。
reading: 私は会議やら講習会やらでこのところ出張が続いている。
english: I have been traveling for business a lot these days to conferences, workshops, etc.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: みんなに自分の写真をほめられて嬉しいやら恥ずかしいやら(で)変な気持ちでした。
reading: みんなに自分の写真をほめられて嬉しいやら恥ずかしいやら(で)変な気持ちでした。
english: When people praised the picture of me I felt strange, both happy and shy.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 今日は、上司に叱られるやら財布を落とすやら(で)さんざんな一日だった。
reading: 今日は、上司に叱られるやら財布を落とすやら(で)さんざんな一日だった。
english: I got told off by my boss; I lost my wallet—it's been a horrible day today.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 久子は来るやらこないやら分からないから、もう行こう。
reading: 久子は来るやらこないやら分からないから、もう行こう。
english: We can't tell whether Hisako will come or not, so let's just go.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 美術品のことは何も知らないので、この壷が安いのやら高いのやら全然見当がつかない。
reading: 美術品のことは何も知らないので、この壷が安いのやら高いのやら全然見当がつかない。
english: Because I know nothing about art objects, I have no idea whether this pot is cheap or expensive.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 着替えやらお土産やらでスーツケースはもういっぱいになってしまった。
reading: 着替えやらお土産やらでスーツケースはもういっぱいになってしまった。
english: My suitcase is full now with a change of clothes and souvenirs and other things.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 趣味のことやら家族のことやらを時々ブログに書いている。
reading: 趣味のことやら家族のことやらを時々ブログに書いている。
english: I write about my hobbies and my family in my blog from time to time.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 音を立ててスープを飲むやら口にものを入れたまま話すやら、直樹のテーブルマナーはひどかった。
reading: 音を立ててスープを飲むやら口にものを入れたまま話すやら、直樹のテーブルマナーはひどかった。
english: Naoki did things like slurping his soup and talking with food in his mouth—his table manners were horrible.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: アンディと楽しそうにおしゃべりしている陽子が憎らしいやらねたましいやらで、人と話していても上の空だった。
reading: アンディと楽しそうにおしゃべりしている陽子が憎らしいやらねたましいやらで、人と話していても上の空だった。
english: My mind was somewhere else when I was talking with people because I was mad at and jealous of Yoko, whom I saw talking happily with Andy.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 彼女は日本語を話すそうだが、まだ話すのを聞いたことがないので、上手やら下手やら全く見当がつかない。
reading: 彼女は日本語を話すそうだが、まだ話すのを聞いたことがないので、上手やら下手やら全く見当がつかない。
english: I heard that she speaks Japanese, but because I haven't heard her speak yet, I have no idea whether she's good or bad at it.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: この仕事は自分にできるやらできないやら、やってみなければ分からない。
reading: この仕事は自分にできるやらできないやら、やってみなければ分からない。
english: I can't tell if l can do this job unless I try.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 彼はアメリカ生まれの生粋のアメリカ人だが、日本人なのやらアメリカ人なのやら分からないくらい、考え方が日本人的だ。
reading: 彼はアメリカ生まれの生粋のアメリカ人だが、日本人なのやらアメリカ人なのやら分からないくらい、考え方が日本人的だ。
english: He is a genuine born-in-the-USA American, but his ways of thinking are so much like those of Japanese people that we (almost) can't tell whether he is a Japanese or an American.

translation: X and Y; things like X and Y; X, Y and so on; whether X or Y; whether X or not
explanation: A structure to present things, events, actions, etc., as examples, reasons or possibilities.
japanese: 貸してもらえるのやらもらえないのやら分からないお金を当てにしているのはよくない。
reading: 貸してもらえるのやらもらえないのやら分からないお金を当てにしているのはよくない。
english: It's not good to count on the money before you know if they will lend it to you or not.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 知らない単語が出てくるたびに辞書を引いているようではいつまでたっても速く読めない。
reading: 知らない単語が出てくるたびに辞書を引いているようではいつまでたっても速く読めない。
english: If (it is true that) you look up unfamiliar words in the dictionary every time you encounter a new one, you will never learn to read fast.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: アパートがそんなに高いようでは私たちは東京には住めない。
reading: アパートがそんなに高いようでは私たちは東京には住めない。
english: If (it is true that) apartments in Tokyo are that expensive, we cannot live there.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 成績が今までのようでは困ります。
reading: 成績が今までのようでは困ります。
english: If you continue to show the level of performance you have to date, we will have a problem. (literally: If your performance is like what you have exhibited up to now, it's a problem.)

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 今からそんなに文句を言っているようでは、この仕事をやり遂げるのは難しいだろう。
reading: 今からそんなに文句を言っているようでは、この仕事をやり遂げるのは難しいだろう。
english: If you complain like that now, it will be difﬁcult to complete this job.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 困った時に助けてくれないようでは友達とは言えない。
reading: 困った時に助けてくれないようでは友達とは言えない。
english: If (it is true that) he doesn't help you when you are in trouble, you cannot call him a friend.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 朝が弱いようではこの仕事は無理でしょう。
reading: 朝が弱いようではこの仕事は無理でしょう。
english: If it is true that) you have trouble getting up early in the morning (literally: are weak in the morning), you probably won't be able to do this job.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 千円程度の旅費払い戻しに4枚も5枚も書類が必要なようでは問題だ。
reading: 千円程度の旅費払い戻しに4枚も5枚も書類が必要なようでは問題だ。
english: It is a problem if (it is true that) it takes four or ﬁve forms to request a travel reimbursement for an amount as small as one thousand yen.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 今頃そんなことをしているようでは、とても締め切りに間に合わない。
reading: <ruby title="今頃(いまごろ)"><rb>今頃</rb><rt>いまごろ</rt></ruby>そんなことをしているようでは、とても締め切りに間に合わない。
english: If you're doing things like that now, there's no way you'll meet the deadline.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 部下の面倒が見られないようでは上司失格だ。
reading: 部下の面倒が見られないようでは上司失格だ。
english: If (it is true that) you cannot take care of the people under you, you are not qualiﬁed to be their boss.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 大学の施設が現状のようでは、せっかく研究資金を増やしても有効に活用できない。
reading: 大学の施設が現状のようでは、せっかく研究資金を増やしても有効に活用できない。
english: Even if we make an effort to increase research funding, with the university facilities the way they are (literally: if the university facilities are in their present condition), we won't be able to utilize the funds effectively.

translation: If; if it is true that; if it is the case that
explanation: A conjunction that presents an undesirable situation, which is assumed to be factual.
japanese: 次の試合も今日の試合のようでは、とても決勝には進めない。
reading: 次の試合も今日の試合のようでは、とても決勝には進めない。
english: If we play the next game like (we did in) today's game, there's no way we can advance to the ﬁnals.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: 山野氏は非常に時間に厳しい人で、面会時間に5分も遅れようものなら以後二度と会ってはもらえない。
reading: 山野氏は非常に時間に厳しい人で、面会時間に5分も遅れようものなら以後二度と会ってはもらえない。
english: Mr. Yamano is very strict about time; if you happen to be even five minutes late for an appointment with him, he won't meet with you again.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: 私はタバコの煙に特に敏感で、近くで吸われようものならもう何事にも集中できなくなってしまう。
reading: 私はタバコの煙に特に敏感で、近くで吸われようものならもう何事にも集中できなくなってしまう。
english: I'm particularly sensitive to cigarette smoke, so when someone is smoking nearby, I cannot concentrate on anything.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: ニューヨークでは信号が青に変わって一秒でも発進が遅れようものなら、すかさず後ろからクラクションを鳴らされる。
reading: ニューヨークでは信号が青に変わって一秒でも発進が遅れようものなら、すかさず後ろからクラクションを鳴らされる。
english: In New York, if you happen to take even a second to move (your car) forward after the trafﬁc light turns green, the driver behind you honks at you immediately.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: この島は、晴れていれば散歩や海水浴などが楽しめるが、雨に降られようものなら何もやることがなくなる。
reading: この島は、晴れていれば散歩や海水浴などが楽しめるが、雨に降られようものなら何もやることがなくなる。
english: On this island, you can have fun walking and swimming in the ocean on sunny days, but if it happens to rain, there's nothing to do.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: この飛行機は前の座席との間隔が極端に狭いので、私のように大きい人間は、前の人に椅子を倒されようものなら、文字通り身動きできなくなってしまう。
reading: この飛行機は前の座席との間隔が極端に狭いので、私のように大きい人間は、前の人に椅子を倒されようものなら、文字通り身動きできなくなってしまう。
english: The seats in this airplane have an extremely small amount of space between them, so if someone in the seat ahead chooses to lean back, large people like me are stuck (literally: are in a situation in which they literally cannot move).

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: 最近頻繁にやってくる訪問販売は頭痛の種です。断っても簡単には帰りませんし、うっかり家の中に入れようものなら買うまで帰りません。
reading: 最近頻繁にやってくる訪問販売は頭痛の種です。断っても簡単には帰りませんし、うっかり家の中に入れようものなら買うまで帰りません。
english: The frequent visits of door-to-door salesmen these days are a real headache. The salesmen won't leave even if you say "no thanks," and if you happen to let them in the house by mistake, they won't leave until you buy (their products).

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: 花粉症の季節にうっかりバイクで出かけようものなら、走行中にくしゃみ連発でフルフェイスのヘルメットの中は悲惨な状態になる。
reading: 花粉症の季節にうっかりバイクで出かけようものなら、走行中にくしゃみ連発でフルフェイスのヘルメットの中は悲惨な状態になる。
english: If you happen to go out on a motorcycle in pollen season (literally: pollen allergy season) by mistake, you'll keep sneezing and be miserable inside your full-face helmet.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: この魚は猛毒を持っていて、間違ってそのトゲに刺されようものなら、患部が大きく腫れ上がってしまう。
reading: この魚は猛毒を持っていて、間違ってそのトゲに刺されようものなら、患部が大きく腫れ上がってしまう。
english: This ﬁsh is very poisonous, and if you happen to be stung, that area will swell a lot.

translation: If ~ happen to; if ~ at all; if ~ choose to
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that presents　an undesirable hypothetical situation.
japanese: 田村さんは最近漢方医学に凝っていて、うっかりそのことを聞こうものなら、たっぷり一時間はその効用を聞くはめになる。
reading: 田村さんは最近漢方医学に凝っていて、うっかりそのことを聞こうものなら、たっぷり一時間はその効用を聞くはめになる。
english: Ms. Tamura has taken up (studying) Chinese medicine recently and if you ask her about it by mistake, you will end up listening to (her talk about) its effects for a full hour.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 徹に連絡しようにも電話番号もメールアドレスも知らない。
reading: 徹[とおる]に連絡しようにも電話番号もメールアドレスも知らない。
english: Even though I want to contact Toru, I don't know either her phone number or her e-mail address.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: ひどく頭が痛くて起きようにも起きられない。
reading: ひどく頭が痛くて起きようにも起きられない。
english: I have a terrible headache, and I cannot get up even though I want to.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 記事を書こうにも書く材料がない。
reading: 記事を書こうにも書く材料がない。
english: Even though I'm thinking of writing an article, I have nothing to write about.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 寿司を作ろうにも材料が手に入られない。
reading: 寿司を作ろうにも材料が手に入られない。
english: Even though I want to make sushi, I cannot get the ingredients (literally: materials).

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 苦情を言おうにも誰に言っていいか分からなかった。
reading: 苦情を言おうにも誰に言っていいか分からなかった。
english: Although I wanted to complain, I didn't know who to complain to.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 体を動かそうにもあちこち痛くて腕も上げられない。
reading: 体を動かそうにもあちこち痛くて腕も上げられない。
english: Although I'm trying to move my body, every part aches and I can't even lift my arms.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 母は僕の日本人のガールフレンドと話しそうにも日本語ができなかった。
reading: 母は僕の日本人のガールフレンドと話しそうにも日本語ができなかった。
english: Even though my mother wanted to talk with my Japanese girlfriend, my mother (couldn't because she) can't speak Japanese.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 気の毒に彼女は悩み事を相談しようにも相談できる人が近くにいない。
reading: 気の毒に彼女は悩み事を相談しようにも相談できる人が近くにいない。
english: It's sad that even though she wants to talk to someone about her troubles, she has no one to talk to near her.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: カウンセリングに行こうにも、その質や学派も様々でついつい懐疑的になってしまいます。
reading: カウンセリングに行こうにも、その質や学派も様々でついつい懐疑的になってしまいます。
english: Although I am thinking of going for counselling, the variation in quality and schools of thought makes me sceptical.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: その本は買おうにも絶版だった。
reading: その本は買おうにも絶版だった。
english: Although I wanted to buy the book, it was out of print.

translation: Even though ~ try/want to ~; even though ~ be thinking of doing ~; although ~ try/want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing ~
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: “even though someone tries to do something, he/she cannot do it for some reason”.
japanese: 携帯電話の電池が切れたので、電話をかけようにもかけられない。
reading: 携帯電話の電池が切れたので、電話をかけようにもかけられない。
english: Because my cell phone battery is dead, I cannot make a call even though I want to.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 公共の交通機関がないので、自分の車で行く(より)ほか(に)(は)ない。
reading: 公共の交通機関がないので、自分の車で行く(より)ほか(に)(は)ない。
english: Since there is no public transportation, we have no other choice but to go there in your/my car.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 新聞はニューヨークタイムズのほか(に)は読まない。
reading: 新聞はニューヨークタイムズのほか(に)は読まない。
english: I read nothing but the New York Times. (literally: I don't read any newspaper other than the New York Times.)

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: アルバイトの仕事が駄目になったので、両親にお金を借りるよりほかになかった。
reading: アルバイトの仕事が駄目になったので、両親にお金を借りるよりほかになかった。
english: Because I lost my part-time job, I had no choice but to borrow money from my parents.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 友人がどうして気が狂ってしまったのかは推測するよりほかにはない。
reading: 友人がどうして気が狂ってしまったのかは推測するよりほかにはない。
english: I can only speculate as to why my friend was acting crazy.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 信号機の故障で電車が止まってしまった以上、待っているよりほかない。
reading: 信号機の故障で電車が止まってしまった以上、待っているよりほかない。
english: Since the train is stopped due to a signal problem we have no choice but to wait.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 国際的に活躍したければ英語を学ぶよりほかはないだろう。
reading: 国際的に活躍したければ英語を学ぶよりほかはないだろう。
english: A person who wants to be internationally active will have no choice but to learn English.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 秩序を回復するには権威の力を直接見せつけた容赦ない手段をとるよりほかはない。
reading: 秩序を回復するには権威の力を直接見せつけた容赦ない手段をとるよりほかはない。
english: In order to restore order, there is no other choice than to take ruthless means, directly demonstrating the power of our authority.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: モーツアルトが35年の生涯に６００曲以上の作品を書いたというのには、ただただ驚くよりほかはない。
reading: モーツアルトが35年の生涯に６００曲以上の作品を書いたというのには、ただただ驚くよりほかはない。
english: The fact that Mozart composed more than 600 pieces during his life of thirty-ﬁve years is simply amazing (literally: leaves us no other choice than to be surprised).

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 典型的な科学者のイメージに合う人はアインシュタインのほかにはない。
reading: 典型的な科学者のイメージに合う人はアインシュタインのほかにはない。
english: Nobody but Einstein ﬁts the stereotypical image of a scientist.

grammar_point: より・のほか（に）（は）～ない
translation: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than
explanation: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
japanese: 学会に出席している学者は数人のほかは面識がなかった。
reading: 学会に出席している学者は数人のほかは面識がなかった。
english: All but a few of the attendees of the academic conference were total strangers.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: この度は本社営業部長にご栄転の由、誠におめでとう存じます。
reading: この度は本社営業部長にご栄転の由、誠におめでとう存じます。
english: I heard of your promotion this time to manager of the headquarters' sales department. Please accept my sincere congratulations.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 地球環境保護の国際会議が来年当市で開催される由(である)。
reading: 地球環境保護の国際会議が来年当市で開催される由(である)。
english: It is said that an international conference on global environmental protection will be held in this city next year.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 野沢先生は来年一年ドイツにいらっしゃる由、伺っております。
reading: 野沢先生は来年一年ドイツにいらっしゃる由、伺っております。
english: I've been informed that next year Professor Nozawa is going to Germany for a year.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 第一子御出産の由、心からお祝い申し上げます。
reading: 第一子御出産の由、心からお祝い申し上げます。
english: I heard that you gave birth to your ﬁrst child and I send my heartfelt congratulations.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 当ホテルでのご滞在が快適でなかった由、誠に申し訳なく存じます。
reading: 当ホテルでのご滞在が快適でなかった由、誠に申し訳なく存じます。
english: We learned that your stay at our hotel was not a pleasant one. We are very sorry for that.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 交通事故のこと伺いました。お怪我などなかった由、ほっといたしております。
reading: 交通事故のこと伺いました。お怪我などなかった由、ほっといたしております。
english: I heard about the trafﬁc accident. I am relieved to hear that you were not hurt.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 石垣島は運よく台風の通過コースからはずれたため被害が少なかった由。
reading: 石垣島は運よく台風の通過コースからはずれたため被害が少なかった由。
english: I was informed that there was not much damage on Ishigaki Island because, luckily, the typhoon missed it (literally: swerved away from it).

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 日本消費者連盟は、一部ウイスキーの不正表示に関して、公正取引委員会に申し入れる由である。
reading: 日本消費者連盟は、一部ウイスキーの不正表示に関して、公正取引委員会に申し入れる由である。
english: It is said that the Japan Consumers Union is going to appeal to the Fair Trade Commission regarding the dishonest labels on some whiskies.

translation: (I heard/It is said/etc.) that
explanation: A dependent noun that marks the content of what the writer has learned.
japanese: 懇親会にご出席の由、吉本君から連絡を受けました。
reading: 懇親会にご出席の由、吉本君から連絡を受けました。
english: I heard from Mr. Yoshimoto that you will be attending the reception.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 人が何と言おう{と/が}、私は自分の子供を信じている。
reading: 人が何と言おう{と/が}、私は自分の子供を信じている。
english: Whatever (other) people say, I believe my child.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 頑固と言われよう{と/が}馬鹿と言われよう{と/が}、私は自分の信じることをやります。
reading: 頑固と言われよう{と/が}馬鹿と言われよう{と/が}、私は自分の信じることをやります。
english: Even if people say I'm stubborn or stupid, I'll do what I believe.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: あの教授は学生が分かろう{と/が}分かるまい{と/が}、かまわず授業を進めていく。
reading: あの教授は学生が分かろう{と/が}分かるまい{と/が}、かまわず授業を進めていく。
english: That professor keeps lecturing (literally: advances his lecture) regardless of whether his students understand it or not.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 報酬が多かろう{と/が}少ないかろう{と/が}、私はやるべきことをやるだけだ。
reading: 報酬が多かろう{と/が}少ないかろう{と/が}、私はやるべきことをやるだけだ。
english: Whether the compensation is high or low, l'll just do what I have to do.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 語が上手だろう{と/が}下手だろう{と/が}そういうことは関係ない。
reading: 英語が上手だろう{と/が}下手だろう{と/が}そういうことは関係ない。
english: It doesn't matter whether his English is good or bad.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: プロの作品だろう{と/が}素人の作品だろう{と/が}いいものは採用する。
reading: プロの作品だろう{と/が}素人の作品だろう{と/が}いいものは採用する。
english: We'll adopt anything good, whether it's a work by a professional or an amateur.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 人が何をしようと大きなお世話だ。
reading: 人が何をしようと大きなお世話だ。
english: Whatever I do, it's none of your business.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 費用がいくらかかろうとかまわない。何としてもこの訴訟勝たなければならない。
reading: 費用がいくらかかろうとかまわない。何としてもこの訴訟勝たなければならない。
english: We don't care how much it may cost. We have to win this lawsuit by any means.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 彼はみんなが聞いていようがおかまいなしで、上司の悪口を言っている。
reading: 彼はみんなが聞いていようがおかまいなしで、上司の悪口を言っている。
english: He is saying bad things about his boss without regard to whether or not others are listening.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 自分の子供たちが走り回ろうが飲み物をこぼそうが、親たちは叱りもしないで自分たちの話に夢中になっている。
reading: 自分の子供たちが走り回ろうが飲み物をこぼそうが、親たちは叱りもしないで自分たちの話に夢中になっている。
english: Even if their children are running around or spilling drinks, the parents are too caught up in their own conversation to scold them.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 彼女が結婚しようがするまいが、そんなことは私には関係ないことだ。
reading: 彼女が結婚しようがするまいが、そんなことは私には関係ないことだ。
english: Whether she's going to marry or not, it has nothing to do with me.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 高かろうが安かろうが、必要なものなら買えばいい。
reading: 高かろうが安かろうが、必要なものなら買えばいい。
english: Whether it's expensive or cheap, we should buy it if we need it.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 参加者がたとえ一人であろうとツアーは予定通り行います。
reading: 参加者がたとえ一人であろうとツアーは予定通り行います。
english: We're going ahead with the tour as scheduled even if we have only one participant.

translation: Even if; whatever/whoever/ etc.; no matter what/who/how/etc.; whether X or Y
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that expresses the idea of concession.
japanese: 日本人だろうがアメリカ人だろうが、そういうことは関係ない。好きになったら結婚する。
reading: 日本人だろうがアメリカ人だろうが、そういうことは関係ない。好きになったら結婚する。
english: It doesn't matter whether she is Japanese or American. If I fall in love (with someone), I'll marry that person.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 彼女はその美貌(の)故(に)、悩みも多い。
reading: 彼女はその美貌(の)故(に)、悩みも多い。
english: Because of her good looks, she also has many things to worry about.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 結果にこだわりすぎる(が)故(に)、小さなことに心を奪われることになる。
reading: 結果にこだわりすぎる(が)故(に)、小さなことに心を奪われることになる。
english: Because you want the end result to be perfect, you end up being distracted by little things.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: これは極めてデリケートな問題だ。(それ(が)/その)故に、慎重に取り組む必要がある。
reading: これは極めてデリケートな問題だ。(それ(が)/その)故に、慎重に取り組む必要がある。
english: This is an extremely delicate problem; therefore, we must handle it very carefully.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 彼の精神は大病の故に強靭になった。
reading: 彼の精神は大病の故に強靭になった。
english: His mind was strengthened because of his serious illness.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 電子テキストは改変と公開が容易であるが、この特徴故に公開されている電子テキストは元データを追跡することが難しい。
reading: 電子テキストは改変と公開が容易であるが、この特徴故に公開されている電子テキストは元データを追跡することが難しい。
english: Electronic texts are easy to revise and present to the public, but because of these characteristics, it is difﬁcult to trace publicly-displayed electronic texts back to their original data.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 携帯電話は便利故に、使い方を誤らないようにしなければならない。
reading: 携帯電話は便利故に、使い方を誤らないようにしなければならない。
english: Because cell phones are convenient, we have to be careful not to use them incorrectly.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 山は高いが故に尊からず。
reading: 山は高いが故に尊からず。
english: Mountains are not sacred just because they are tall.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 日本列島は南北に伸びているが故に、温度差が大きい。
reading: 日本列島は南北に伸びているが故に、温度差が大きい。
english: Because the Japanese archipelago extends north and south, the temperature difference (within Japan) is great.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: アメリカでは今でも黒人であるが故に差別されるということがある。
reading: アメリカでは今でも黒人であるが故に差別されるということがある。
english: In the United States even now there are cases in which someone is discriminated against because he or she is black.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 我思う、故に我あり。」ーデカルト
reading: 「我思う、故に我あり。」ーデカルト
english: I think, therefore I am. -Descartes

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 人はきっとミスをする。故に、それを前提とした対策を考える必要がある。
reading: 人はきっとミスをする。故に、それを前提とした対策を考える必要がある。
english: People will certainly make mistakes; therefore, we need to think of countermeasures based on that assumption.

translation: Because; because of; due to; therefore
explanation: A conjunction that presents a reason or a cause.
japanese: 俳句は言葉が最小限に抑えられている。それ故に。表現されていないことを想像しなければならない。
reading: 俳句は言葉が最小限に抑えられている。それ故に、表現されていないことを想像しなければならない。
english: Haiku use a bare minimum of words. Therefore, one has to imagine what is not expressed.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: 技術の発達は社会環境の変化をもたらさずにはおかない。
reading: 技術の発達は社会環境の変化をもたらさずにはおかない。
english: Technological advancements are bound to bring about changes to social environments.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: コンピュータの普及とインターネット利用の拡大は大きな教育の変革を促さずにはおかない。
reading: コンピュータの普及とインターネット利用の拡大は大きな教育の変革を促さずにはおかない。
english: The spread of computers and the expansion of Internet use are bound to promote big changes in education.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: この映画は観る者に感動を与えずにはおかない。
reading: この映画は観る者に感動を与えずにはおかない。
english: This movie is bound to move viewers. (literally: This movie does not leave viewers without moving them.)

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: この小説は我々に人間とは何かを考えさせずにはおかない。
reading: この小説は我々に人間とは何かを考えさせずにはおかない。
english: Without fail, this novel makes us think about what it is to be human.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: この事故は日本とアメリカの関係に影響を及ぼさずにはおかないだろう。
reading: この事故は日本とアメリカの関係に影響を及ぼさずにはおかないだろう。
english: This accident will undoubtedly affect the relationship between Japan and America.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: 彼女は聴く者を魅了せずにはおかない音楽性とそれを表現する卓越した技術を持っている。
reading: 彼女は聴く者を魅了せずにはおかない音楽性とそれを表現する卓越した技術を持っている。
english: She has a musicality that unfailingly captivates her audiences and the superb technique to express it.

translation: Be bound to; definitely; unmistakably; unquestionably; undoubtedly; without fail; without doubt
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that someone/something necessarily or naturally causes something to happen.
japanese: 環境や用途に合わせて動物たちがつくりあげる構造物は、彼らの知恵と工夫がいたるところに見られ、我々の好奇心を惹起せずにはおかない。
reading: 環境や用途に合わせて動物たちがつくりあげる構造物は、彼らの知恵と工夫がいたるところに見られ、我々の好奇心を惹起せずにはおかない。
english: Structures that animals construct according to their environment and needs exhibit in every aspect their wisdom and ideas, and are bound to arouse our curiosity.

translation: Without ~ing; before (~ing); with no ~; if ~ do not; when ~ do not
explanation: A phrase meaning “without doing something”.
japanese: インカ帝国を知らずして南米大陸を語ることはできない。
reading: インカ帝国を知らずして南米大陸を語ることはできない。
english: You cannot talk about the South American continent without some knowledge of the Inca Empire.

translation: Without ~ing; before (~ing); with no ~; if ~ do not; when ~ do not
explanation: A phrase meaning “without doing something”.
japanese: 我々のチームは最終日の最終戦を待たずして優勝が決定した。
reading: 我々のチームは最終日の最終戦を待たずして優勝が決定した。
english: Our team won the championship before (literally: without waiting for) the ﬁnal game on the ﬁnal day.

translation: Without ~ing; before (~ing); with no ~; if ~ do not; when ~ do not
explanation: A phrase meaning “without doing something”.
japanese: 自分の義務を果たさずして人の責任を問うべきではない。
reading: 自分の義務を果たさずして人の責任を問うべきではない。
